loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 27 years old, married to Simon N., and they have three school-aged children.  

Hellen has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she was introduced to KADET LTD by one her friends.  This will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow to increase the milk produce which she sells to her customers, who are mostly residents of the same locality.

In the future, Hellen hopes to grow her business and become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City.  He is 48 years old. Jimmy is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Jimmy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and necessities needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & necessities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is married with four children: two daughters and two sons. Unfortunately, none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints. Shamshad is a very supportive lady by nature. She operates a rice selling business. She does this business from her home. She earns good profit which helps her pay utility bills and bear other household expenses. Her husband is a factory worker and earns on a monthly basis.  

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her rice selling business. With the loan, she will buy rice in bulk quantity for selling to her clients at a profit. She has been doing this business for the past 15 years and hopes that after investment her business will grow further and make her even more money every month.  

In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Shamshad.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing notions.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 55 years old, married and blessed with three children. She has been in the business of hog fattening and breeding for almost 15 years. Each month, Iluminada earns PHP 9,000. To make her business more profitable, Iluminada is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to purchase additional hogs to raise and to buy vitamins and medicines to ensure that her animals will grow healthy.

Iluminada has been a client of ASKI for six years. In the future, Iluminada would like to strengthen her business to provide a progressive living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs, vitamins and medicines

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 58, owns and operates a food stall business in the Moi bridge area of Kitale, where he lives with his family. He is the husband of two wives and the father of nine children. Christopher's food stall business has been in operation  for the last five years and brings in a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Christopher's seventh loan with KADET Ltd. He has repaid all his other loans successfully. With the present loan, he intends to stock his food stall with such foodstuffs as sugar, baking flour, and rice. 

In future, Christopher plans to expand his food stall business, allowing him to better provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to stock his food stall with such foodstuffs as sugar, baking flour, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding supplies and equipment (bottles of gas,crossbars, blowtorches, etc.)

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married but has no children. Her husband owns a service station where he offers washing and oil changing services for motorbikes & cars to his customers. He works very hard and tries to provide the best services to his customers. 

Khursheed supports her family by selling quilts. She purchases them from different cities and supplies to different shops to earn income for the family. The income she earns helps to pay off the utilities. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his service station business. Through the loan, he will buy vehicle-washing items and pipes to offer better quality services to his customers. He started this business 10 years ago and it is working well for him. Khursheed is confident that her husband will get the desired results from his business after the loan investment. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy vehicle-washing items for service station.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is a 53-year-old farmer from village Zemo Alvani, in mountainous Georgia. Givi lives alone in his house. He is running small pig farm with four pigs. He sells piglets in the same village and earns his living. Also he works as a shepherd in the village and is paid by villagers for this service. 

With the requested credit Givi plans to purchase four or five calves. In the fall the calves will have grown and Givi will sell them for a higher price. Received profit will be used for expansion of his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Nyikira Okole Women's Group A

texts.en:
Steven, a 49-year-old hard-grinding entrepreneur has been engaged in a retailing enterprise for 12 years now. He plys his trade in Kampala. At his shop, he sells a variety of general merchandise though his major drawback has been inconsistency in restocking his shop with goodies. This normally comes to pass when customer demand increases. He says he set forth in his business with the persuasion of friends. 

Before then, he was and is still operating his poultry business. Savings from the poultry business enabled him to take root. Weekly he says this business generates him 150,000 shillings as profit. He says that with this loan, he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to buy retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is thirty-six years old, married, and a father of four. His family lives in Endebess in the outskirts of Kitale, where he works with Kitale transporters. He also has had a shop of his own in Kitale for two years and gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings. 

This will be Benard's second loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to use it to buy two bags of sugar, rice, etc. for his shop business. He plans to use the income he will get to repay the loan. 

In the future he wants to expand his shop and also give his family a comfortable life financially.

loans.use: to add stock to his shop like sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Housein

texts.ar: حسين عمره 42 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع المحروقات ونقلها الى المحطات له في عمله 15 سنة هو طموح محب للعمل يعمل بجد ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يربي اولاده ويساعدهم في تخطي الظروف الاجتماعية الصعبة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء محروقات ومازوت وان يطور المحطة له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم في تحسين الظروف المادية للمصلحة له خبرة واسعة في عمله ويحلم بأن يمتلك محطة وقود كبيرة حتى يكون قد اساس لحياة اجتماعية سليمة
texts.en: Housein is a 42-year-old husband and father of three who is committed to helping his children advance in life. For the past 15 years, Housein has been transporting and selling fuel, a job which he has been very passionate about. Housein’s last loan from A. Majmoua went far in helping to improve his business, and he now wanted to seek another one to purchase more fuel and diesel oil and to further develop his gas station. Housein ultimately hopes to one day own a mega gas station.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and further develop his gas station.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Vip Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early thirties, is married. He has had a general store since 2007. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be the borrower's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loan to buy the items which were missing from his shop's stock. He has paid back his loans sucessfully. He wishes for a loan to increase the shop's inventory further. His dream is to one day become an international businessman and sell food outside the country. 

The borrower will share this loan with his loan group "VIP" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, the borrower is third from right second row.

loans.use: to expand his general store's inventory.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Père de 05 enfants, kossi vit en famille avec sa femme.il est âgé  de 39 ans et  a appris la maçonnerie. N’ayant pas beaucoup de chantier mais devant l’obligation de s’occuper de sa famille il décide d’ouvrir un kiosque de produits alimentaires à Lomé depuis 2008.Il s’approvisionne au grand marché pour les besoins de son activité. Ce  second prêt  lui servira à augmenter son stock pour satisfaire convenablement la demande.
texts.en:
Kossi is a father of 5 children, he lives with his wife and family. He is 39 years old, and learnt the trade of masonry. Faced with little construction work and the need to provide for his family, he decided to open a  food products kiosk in Lomé in 2008. 

He obtains the supplies he needs for his business at the Grand Market. This second loan will allow him to increase his inventory in order to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 57, married to Joyce, and a father of five. He has been in farming  in the town of Kikuyu for the last four years, and this is his primary business. 

Daniel has a good credit history with KADET Ltd., this is his ninth loan from KADET and he plans to buy a dairy cow for more milk production. And with any profits, he plans to buy some piglets so that he can invest more for higher returns. 

He hopes to operate a large-scale dairy and pig farm.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de 04 enfants, Adjoavi malgré son âge de 50 ans s’acharne au quotidien pour s’occuper des siens. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture plus précisément elle prépare de la pâte faite avec  de la farine de maïs .Elle s’approvisionne de cette farine au marché de Lomé et son activité se passe devant sa maison. Ce  prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité pour servir pour de clients. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’an 2000.
texts.en: Widowed and a mother of four, Adjoavi, despite her 50 years, perseveres daily to take care of her family. She sells food, specifically paste made from corn flour. She stocks up on this flour at the Lomé market, and she conducts her business in front of her house. This loan will help her to grow her business and customers. She has been doing this since the year 2000.

loans.use: to grow her business of selling corn flour paste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Priscilla Mweru

texts.en:
Priscilla is 34 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is in the transport business. She does crop farming as well as livestock rearing, which she has been doing for the last 20 years.The business earns her a monthly income of 40,560 KES. 

Priscilla is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD.  She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow for milk production, which she will sell to her customers. Priscilla hopes to expand her business and supply milk to other towns in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen foods and phone cards

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 26 ans et mère de deux enfants, Virginie est revendeuse de chaussures à Lomé depuis 2000 et pour les besoins de sa clientèle elle se ravitaille sur place .cette activité lui a permis d’aider son conjoint dans les charges qui lui incombe. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et est une  femme de bonne moralité.
texts.en: A young married woman of 26 and a mother of two, Virginie has been selling shoes at Lomé since 2000 and for the needs of her clientele, she stocks up on site. This business has allowed her to help her spouse with the expenses that fall on her. She is on her third loan and is a moral woman.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.ar: ميلا عمرها 45 سنة هي امراة عزباء تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية لها في عملها 26 سنة تحب العمل وكانت تطوره بشكل مستمر لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض السابق في دعم العمل حيث استطاعت ان تطوره من متجول الى محل ثابت لها تحلم بأن تصبح مالكت محل خاص بها حيث انها تعتمد على نفسها في تطوير الحياة الاجتماعية والعملية لها ولعائلتها فهي تسعى الى شد الروابط الاسرية من خلال التكفل بمصاريف والديها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية مستوردة من الخارج حتى تكون متجددة وترضي جميع المطلبات حيث انها تعاني من منافسة قوية في محيطها
texts.en: Mila is 45 years old and unmarried. She works in a clothes and shoes store and has 26 years experience in this. She loves her business and is continuously developing it. She has good credit history with al-Majmoua and the last loan helped support her so that she was able to transfer her shop to fixed premises. She now owns her own store and is able to depend on herself to progress in social and business life, both for herself and her family. She aspires to strengthen her family ties by paying towards her parents living costs. With this loan she wants to import new clothes and shoes from abroad in order to be up to date and fulfil her customers' demands, as she suffers from strong competition in her local area.

loans.use: to import new clothes and shoes stock from abroad for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hilal

texts.ar: هلال عمره34 سنة اعزب ويعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية له في عمله 11 سنة يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله من خلال تطوير عمله يسعى الى ان يعمل بجد ونشاط حتى يتمكن من تأسيس حياة اجتماعية ومادية جيدة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية موسمية لأقتراب الموسم الصيفي هو طموح محب للعمل يريد ان يبني اسرة تكون على اساس مادي سليم له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث استطاع القرض السابق من دعم عمله وتطويره ولكنه يعاني من منافسة قوية في محيطه
texts.en: Hilal is 34 years old and unmarried. He works in a clothes and shoes store and has been doing this for 11 years. He wants to increase his income by developing his business. He aspires to work hard and seriously so that he is able to establish a stable financial and good social life. With this loan he wants to buy new seasonal stock as summer approaches. He is ambitious and loves his business, and wants to establish a family whilst he is financially stable. He has good credit history with al-Majmoua and the last loan supported and strengthened his business; however, he suffers from a lot of competition in his local area.

loans.use: to purchase new seasonal clothes and shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 31 years old and the married father of four lovely children. He lives with his family in Mitume, which is located in the outskirts of Kitale town. Shadrack is a dairy farmer and for the past seven years has also had a shop where he sells milk. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Shadrack is requesting his sixth loan with KADET LTD to buy a refrigerator to preserve his milk for a longer time. He will use the income from his loan to repay the loan and also to save for the future. Shadrack plans to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to preserve milk

texts.ar: فداء في عمر 39 سنة متزوجة وهي ام ل3 اولاد تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية محل لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب العمل وتعتمد على نفسها في تربية الاولاد والاهتمام بحاجاتهم ودفع مصاريف تعليمهم تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة موسمية للصيف البسة واحذية حتى تزيد من البضاعة في محلها خاصة انها تتعرض لمنافة قوية في محيطها العملي فهي تريد ان تساعد نفسها في تخطي هذه المصاعب المادية التي تقف دون تطور العمل فهي تتميز بالعمل الجيد وملاحقة التطور وتمتلك جميع انواع الالبسة الرجالية والنسائية والولادية
texts.en: Fidaa is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She works in a clothes and shoes store and has been doing this for 10 years. She loves her business and independently raises her children, fulfils their needs and pays for their education. With this loan she wants to purchase new seasonal stock for the summer season, both clothes and shoes, so that she can increase her stock size. This is especially because she suffers from a lot of competition in her local area and she wants to help herself overcome the financial difficulties that are holding back the development of her business. She is distinguished for her unique business which is constantly being developed, and she stocks all types of men's, women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to grind and sell

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en:
Mungunzul, 31, is married and lives with her husband and daughter, aged 9, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the backyard of her husband’s workplace. Her daughter goes to primary school.  

Mungunzul helps support her family by operating a retail stall at “Undram” center.  When she first began her business in 2010, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital but she has since expanded it to 1,800,000 MNT in working capital and she sells bags, wallets and remembrances. She purchases her products from Ereen, a border city in China. She is applying for a loan of 600,000 MNT to buy more bags, wallets, presents and remembrances to sell to her customers before “Mothers and children holiday”. 

Her main goal is expand her business and then to be able to buy her own small house and yard.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, wallets and presents before "Mother and Children holiday".

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Altansukh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is one year old; his wife looks after the baby at the moment. 

Recently they moved to a one-bedroom apartment which they bought last March. Altansukh runs a taxi business using his family car and it is the only source of the family’s income. 

Altansukh is planning to do some interior decoration in the old apartment which he bought. The loan he is taking will be used to buy wallpaper, plaster, glue, paint and to do interior decoration in the old apartment which he bought recently.

loans.use: To buy wallpaper, plaster, glue, paint and to do interior decoration on the old apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more paraffin for sale.

loans.name: Dantye

texts.en:
Dantye is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. He is married with three children: Yosmi, 10 years old and in the fourth grade of elementary school, Angel, 6 years old and in the first grade of elementary school, and Farah, one month. 

Dantye owns a kiosk selling everyday items such as sugar, coffee, soaps, gasoline, and mobile phone recharges. He has been running the business for 10 years and is able to support his family's daily needs and provide a good education for his children. As an entrepreneur, Dantye dreams to improve his business. He wants to add more products and sell more mobile phone recharges in his kiosk to meet customers' needs. 

Dantye tries to seek more capital so is requesting a loan. Fortunately, Dantye met a TLM field officer who introduced him to TLM's lending program. Dantye thinks this is a good opportunity for his business and has submitted an application to TLM. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to add stock for his kiosk, and to start a broiler business in order to generate money for his family. He hopes that TLM will help him by providing the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, coffee, soaps etc. and to start a broiler business

loans.name: Sabokhon

texts.ru: Сабохон жительница района Рудаки. Ей 44 года. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. У нее среднее - специальное образование, продавец. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке «Шохмансур», где продает помидоры. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки огурцов и помидоров.
texts.en: Sabokhon lives in the Rudaki region. She's forty-four years old, married and has three children. She's had vocational training and, for the past fifteen years, has worked as a salesperson in the "Shopmansur" market selling tomatoes. Sabokhon is asking for a loan in order to buy tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to purchase cucumbers and tomatoes

loans.name: Sisters Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-forties, is married with one son who is still going to school. She has had a business selling milk, milk tea, dry tea, and chapati for 15 years. She works from 6.00 am to 11.00 am daily and is able to make a small profit. This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of chapati, sugar, milk and flasks for keeping the tea warm. She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy a sack of baking flour to make more chapatis and to renovate the place where she sells her snacks.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "sisters" which has 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asha is second from right, second row, with a yellow scarf on her head.

loans.use: to buy a sack of baking flour and renovate the place where she sells her snacks.

loans.name: Shohidahon's Group

texts.en:
Shohidahon, 30, is a member of this group. In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, her husband went to work in Russia. She has a daughter and a son — both under seven. Shohidahon works as a teacher of English at school. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. To contribute additional money to the family budget, she sells about eight liters of milk every day. In this way she earns an additional 4000 soms per month. This activity helped the family to improve its living conditions. Shohidahon hopes to obtain the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase cattle. In the future she wants to save money for house repair and, of course, she will make efforts to provide her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mary  Wanjiku

texts.en: Mary is 70 years old and married to Samson, a farmer. She has been doing crop farming and raising livestock for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.65,000. This is her fourth loan cycle from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sale. Mary intends to use the anticipated profits to rent a piece of land to grow more vegetables and hopes to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding supplies (a bending machine, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new tyres and other spares for his taxi

loans.name: Linkito Samba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LINKITO SAMBA est à son quatrième cycle de le programme des bancs villageois.il est composé de 46 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame SALIMATOU  (assise à extrême gauche et en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  66 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle vend de la pâte d’arachide et de l’huile de palme dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle a plusieurs années d’expérience de ce domaine d’activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des pâtes d’arachide et de l’huile de palme pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des membres de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
The Linkito Samba group is on their fourth loan in the bancs villageois program. It consists of 46 women who live in the same village. Their primary business is small commerce.

Mrs. Salimatou (seated to the far left, inset) is the head of the group. She is 66 years old, married, and a mother of three.

She sells peanut butter and palm oil in the weekly markets. She has several years of experience doing this.

With her new loan, she is going to buy peanut butter and palm oil to sell.

The profits from this business will allow her to support her husband in paying for their family’s food, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter and palm oil to sell

loans.name: K Boli

texts.en: Boli, 57 years old man is a retired teacher. His wife, Tri, 52 years old, is still working as a teacher. Boli has one son named Octovianus, 21 years old, who is currently studying in university. As a retired teacher, he definitely does not receive as much money as when he was still teaching, whereas the cost of his son’s education is quite high; he has to pay IDR 1,200,000 per semester. To overcome this problem, he established a chicken-breeding business which has been running for three years. He had 300 chicks to raise in his chicken pen but  many died due to the poor, small cage. Some died because they were trampled by other chickens. He desires to improve his business in order to generate better income. To accommodate up to 500 chickens, he has to renovate the cage so he submitted a loan application to TLM for IDR 4,000,000. He plans to buy building materials to renovate the cage and to buy 8 boxes of chicks.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate his chicken cage and buy eight boxes of chicks

loans.name: Hajalhon's Group

texts.en:
Hajalhon, 22, the young leader of this group, is a farmer who cultivates and sells cotton. When she graduated from school, her mom taught her the craft of sewing, so Hajalhon also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets, pillows, cloth, and dressmaking supplies, earning 4000 soms per month. Haljahon saved some of her savings to contribute to her sister’s wedding, as under Kyrgyz traditions the wife’s family prepares a dowry (furniture, household appliances, clothes, etc.). She is now applying for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers which are needed for sowing cotton.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ataya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31 mai 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. L'activité principale des membres est le petit commerce. 

La dame, debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe est responsable du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle est détentrice d'une cantine à la gare routière où elle vend des produits cosmétiques (lait de corps, pommade pour cheveux, parfums etc.) Elle pratique cette activité depuis un an.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux approvisionner sa cantine en produits cosmétiques. 

Son objectif est de renforcer sa cantine en marchandises, augmenter son niveau d'épargne, et de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 30, 2007. It consists of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.
The lady standing on the far right in the photo wrapped in a scarf is the head of the group. She is married and a mother of five.
She runs a cafeteria at a bus station where she sells cosmetic products (body lotion, hair pomade, perfumes, etc.). She has been doing this for a year.
Her new loan will allow her to stock up her cafeteria with more beauty products.
Her goal is to increase the merchandise in her cafeteria, to increase her savings, and to help pay for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is a 32-year-old farmer from the village of Matani, Akhmeta District. She is married and lives with her husband, Martia, 12-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son. The children go to school. Martia is a painter and works in the village. He earns approximately 400 laris per month. Mimoza is busy with agriculture. On the family-owned plot of the land (0.8 hectares), she grows maize and sells it. Her average monthly income amounts to 100 laris. The family is the beneficiary of state financial assistance, as a family living below the poverty line. 

With the requested loan, Mimoza plans to start up trade in secondhand clothes. She will purchase the clothes from wholesalers and sell them in the village among the villagers. According to her estimations, she will have many customers as secondhand clothes will be popular because of affordable prices. With the increased income, this family will improve their living conditions by purchasing better food and household items.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur Huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration  à travers de LALA, la présidente.
LALA compte acheter avec son  prêt, 550 Kg  de de riz et quatre cartons de cube maggi. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.  Elle fait sa restauration sur place à BOUGOULA HAMEAU  et vend ses plats alimentaires, famille et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group, all married women, average 40 years of age, with at least four children each. They live in polygamous families in Bougoula Hameau, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their eighth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The prior loans have been properly reimbursed. The group members cook food for sale, as Lala (the group’s leader) does, for example.

Lala plans to use her loan to buy 550 kg [1210 lbs] of rice and four boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso. She prepares food locally in her village, selling her dishes out of her home and at the market, to a customer bas composed of men and women, for cash. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding supplies (torches, gas, pressure regulators)

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 55 years old and lives in the village of Babaneuri with his family: his wife, Marine, and 26-year-old son. Vazha and his family are busy with scot breeding: they have five milk cow and 18 calves. Vazha’s son takes the scot to the mountains each year in the month of May and brings them back in fall. This relocation results in better quality dairy products and better calves. In October, the family sells cheese and calves. Their average monthly income is 850 laris. 

With the requested loan, Vazha will purchase six calves and take them to the mountains together with his already existing scot. In October, grown calves will be sold for a higher price. 

Vazha plans to use the earned profit for house renovation. After renovations, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Horonkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe HORONKANTIGUI, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KAFELA  un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois à travers de NAWA. 
NAWA,compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100  sacs de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins. Les sacs de charbon de bois sont revendus aux  marchés de SIKASSO et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Horonkantigui group are all married 35 year olds with an average of four children, and live in polygamous families in Kafela, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third largest region in Mali. 
They are on their fifteenth loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' rising demand, and all of their previous loans have been successfully repaid. This group sells charcoal via one of their members, Nawa. She aims to use her loan to purchase 100 bags of charcoal. She sources her goods from the nearby villages and sells them from the markets in Sikasso and to her family. Her customer base is made up of men and women, and she takes cash sales. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her family's everyday needs and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: (cisailles, signole, etc.) to buy welding materials (shears,, hand drills etc.)

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont tous des femmes mariées. Ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans  et en moyenne  4 enfants, elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à KAFELA un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente du charbon de bois à travers  DIATA. 
DIATA, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 sacs de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les villages voisins. Le charbon est revendu dans les différents marchés de Sikasso et en famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et  souvent en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jiguisseme group are all married women in their 40s with four children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kafela, one of the villages of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region of Mali. 
They are on their fifteenth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association, so that they can meet their customers' rising demand. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. 
This group sells charcoal through one of its members, Diata. She aims to use her loan to purchase 100 bags of charcoal. She sources her goods in the neighbouring villages and sells it in the various markets in Sikasso and to her family, to a customer base made up of men and women. She takes cash and credit sales. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits à travers AWA. 
AWA, compte acheter avec son  prêt,  7 chargements de charrettes en fruits auprès des paysans et au grand marché de MEDINE, auprès des grossistes.
Les fruits sont revendus au  marché de HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the JIGUIYA group are all married. They average 39 years of age and 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is their 3rd collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institute, in order to meet the needs of their customers. Past loans have been repaid with no issues. This group of women is in the fruit business through AWA.
AWA intends on buying 7 cartloads of fruits from farmers and at the big market of MEDINE, from wholesalers.
The fruits are then sold retail and for cash, both at the market in HAMDALLAYE as well as door to door to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 90.000FCFA, which will be mostly used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Joli Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JOLI est constitué 3 femmes mariées et  d’une célibataire, qui ont en moyenne 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits  avec  FATI. 
FATI, compte acheter avec son  prêt,  750 Kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de MEDINE. Les pommes de terre sont revendus  à la gare et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The JOLI group is composed of 4 women (3 married and 1 single) who average 27 years of age and 3 children. They live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is the first time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is in the fruit business with FATI.
With this loan, FATI intends on buying 750kg of potatoes. She buys them at the market in MEDINE. The potatoes are then sold retail and for cash, both at the station and door to door, to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 30.000FCFA, which will be mostly used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bales of skirts and two bales of blouses for sale

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA, composé de sept femmes toutes mariées, ont   une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de riz à travers BINTOU, qui compte acheter avec son  prêt,  une tonne de riz, auprès des paysans producteurs du village et des villages voisins.  Le riz est  revendu au  marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
KOTOGNOGOTALA is a group composed of seven women, all of whom are married. They average 35 years of age and 4 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in BOUGOULA HAMEAU, one of the villages of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is their 8th collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance insitution. All their previous loans have been repaid in good conditions. This group of women is in the rice business through BINTOU, who, with this loan, intends on buying one ton of rice from the farmers in her village as well as surrounding villages. The rice is then sold retail and for cash, both at the market and door to door, to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 75.000FCFA, which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, aged 24, is a single mother of a 3-year-old child.

She sells curios in Westlands and has been doing this business for one year. The business earns her a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to buy more curios for sale. Sharon hopes to educate her child and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy curios to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne  4 enfants, elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus  avec KOROTOUMOU, la présidente. 
KOROTOUMOU, compte acheter avec son  prêt,  120 rouleaux de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO, auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à SIKASSO ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five women of the group SABOUGNOUMA are all married, and they average 37 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in BOUGOULA HAMEAU, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These group members are on their seventh collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. All the previous loans have been repaid without any problems at all.  This group of women does commerce in fabrics, with KOROTOUMOU, the group’s president.

KOROTOUMOU plans on using her loan to buy 120 rolls of cloth. She gets her supplies at the main market of Sikasso from wholesalers. Accepting cash, she makes her sales in Sikasso City and at the house to a customer base composed of women and men.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old.  He is married to Leah, who is an assistant chief.  They are blessed with four children: Mary aged 22, Edward aged 20, Mumbi aged 16, and Gakuru aged 13.

Peter's primary business is farming but he also sells timber alongside, which he has been doing for the last six years.  The businesses earn him a monthly income of KES 40,000.

This is Peter's third loan cycle from KADET LTD.  He has managed to successfully repay his previous loans.  He will use this loan to buy more timber to resell.

Peter intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and increase his savings.  He hopes to supply timber to other towns in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 180 kgs of beet pulp

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SÉRIEUX sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU  un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus et de pagnes avec KARI, qui compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE et effectue sa vente au  marché de BOUGOULA HAMEAU et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120.000FCFA, qu’elle utilisera  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et réinvestir dans les affaires.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The eight members of the group SÉRIEUX are all married, and they average 30 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in BOUGOULA HAMEAU, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans have all been repaid nicely.   This group of women does commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in the case of KARI, who intends to use her loan to buy 100 lengths of Wax pagnes. She gets her supplies at the main market of Medine. Accepting cash, she makes her sales at the BOUGOULA HAMEAU market and at the house. Her customer base is composed of women and men. KARI plans on making an average monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will be used for day-to-day family expenses and for reinvesting in the business. Her ambition is to increase her turnover, so as to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: to buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Nanok

texts.en:
Nanok has been practising poultry farming in Nakuru town for the last six years.  He is 41 years old, married to Anwara and they have one child.  

Nanok was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy chicks, which he will raise and sell at the local market after maturity.

In the future, Nanok hopes to get major contacts around Nakuru town to supply chickens as he grows his business.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has been selling second-hand clothes in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 63 years old, married to Lucy, and they have two school-going children.

Samwel was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more used clothing to resell.  His target customers are low income earners.

In the future, Samwel hopes to grow his business and move to a more permanent place.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI, tous des femmes mariées, ont   une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le bois de chauffe avec TENE, qui  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 chargement  de CAMION en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins, auprès des paysans agrées par les autorités. Les bois de chauffe sont revendus au marché de HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sinignessigui group, all married women, average 36 years of age, with  two children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Bougoula Hameau, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their seventh collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The prior loans have been properly reimbursed. The group members  sell various items, such as  firewood, which is the case of Tene.

Tene plans to use her loan to buy one truckload of  firewood. She stocks up in the nearby villages, from farmers who have official permission for this. The firewood  wood is tjem retailed for cash at the Hamdlalaye market and out of her home to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses and loan repayment. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana   is 36 years old. She has a business with her husband purchasing and re-selling poultry and cattle.  They have 5 children. 

Yegana would like to request a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenues and ultimately greater profit for her family. 

In the future, Yegana would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. They plan to use the increased income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase more cattle and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two dairy cows and more fodder

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is dedicated to improving her quality of life and does not scrimp on any efforts to achieve this.  She is an Internally Displaced Person who has suffered from the war and has lost everything.   Her responsibility as a mother to four children is her major driving force. 

Kamala has been working for 8 years raising cattle. She usually buys small calves, raise them, and once every two months take them to the livestock bazaar to sell.  Kamala has built a small stable in her house in order to do this.  Her earnings are results of her long-term efforts to care for these animals. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals, since this will allow her to improve her conditions. 

Kamala has asked for a loan of 1300 AZN to purchase more young cattle in order to expand her business. She promises to repay on time.

loans.use: purchase three calves and more fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one dairy cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq is a low-income person. He is 38 and lives with his wife and three children.  He has a grocery store where he sells foodstuffs.  His business is very successful but needs some capital investment to increase its daily turnover. That is why Sadiq has applied for a loan of 1300 AZN. This loan will allow him to buy larger amounts of goods for resale.  The additional profit will help him better provide for his family and save more money to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Memtee Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Memtee” group. They are small-business women based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown.  This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mamusu. Mamusu is 50 years old.  She was born in Waterloo, where she currently resides with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is a businessman, and one of her children is attending primary school.  

For 15 years now, Mamusu has been selling gari (a fast food made from cassava roots) and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil in the area).  With this loan, Mamusu will buy gari and palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy gari and palm oil to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He cooperates with his parents to gather a good income for the family. He has been working as a freelance electrician specialized in electric projects since 2007. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in purchasing new tools needed for his work. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming years and he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase new tools.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and five children. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2002. He works independently. His farm produces milk and he delivers his products to local markets and multiple clients that he deals with directly. He cooperates with his wife, who works as bread seller, to provide better living conditions for the family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a new cow in order to enlarge his business operation. In the future, he hopes to own more cows so that he can increase his milk production and sales. In Lebanon, it’s very familiar to buy milk from cattle farms and produce special Lebanese dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy construction supplies to resell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma es una señora D. 52 años D. edad, domiciliada en la Compañía Itá Potrero D. la Ciudad D. Itá, tiene 9 hijos D. los cuales 2 se encuentran en España, 1 cursando la Carrera D. Militar, otro estudiando en el S.N.P.P; la mayoria D. sus hijos ya se independizaron y formaron su propio hogar.
La Sra.Irma se dedica a la venta D. leche desD. hace más D. 6 años, posee 4 vacas y 2 vaquillas, su venta diaria D. leche alcanza los 30 litros, posee una clientela bien formada en los alrededores D. su domicilio.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable y requiere este préstamo para aumentar la calidad D. los animales y obtener mejor y mayor cantidad D. leche.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is 52 years old. She lives in the Itá Potrero neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has 9 children. Two live in Spain, one is pursuing a military career, and another studies at the S.N.P.P (a Paraguayan institution that provides vocational training). Most of her children are independent and have formed their own households.

For more than six years, Sra. Irma has been engaged in the sale of milk. She owns 4 cows and 2 heifers. Her daily milk sales reach 30 litres. She has an established clientele from the area around her home. Irma is a very hardworking and responsible person and needs this loan in order to improve the quality of her animals and obtain a greater quantity of milk.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El Sr. Porfirio tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Miguel con su señora quien es ama de casa y está esperando un hijo.
Él trabajaba anteriormente como empleado de una ferretería siendo chofer, luego se independizó vendiendo ropas, champión y electrodomésticos, todos a base de pedidos que luego fue creciendo gracias a la cantidad de clientes que ha formado.
En esta ocasión solicita un crédito para la compra de mercaderías por la cantidad de clientes que le demanda los pedidos y aumentar de esta manera sus ingresos que le permitirán ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su señora y su hijo en camino.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel neighborhood together with his wife who is a homemaker and expecting a child.

Porfirio used to work as an employee at a hardware store.  He worked as a driver.  He later started working for himself, selling clothes, sneakers and electrical appliances.  He made his sales to order.  His business grew thanks to the quantity of customers that he had acquired.

On this occasion, Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to fill his customers' orders and increase his income.  This will enable him to offer his wife and son with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothes

loans.name: Unity Brothers Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Kono city about 38 years ago.  He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary school.  

Mohamed is an okada* driver and has been doing this business for 8 years now.  He has requested  a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva lenders in order to upgrade and buy a new okada.

*Motorbikes used as taxis

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for his transport business

loans.name: Kafundezi Basubuuzi Twegatte Group

texts.en:
23-year-old Joseph has been in the food sales business in Mubende for 3 years now. He mostly deals in bananas in the food markets in that district. Joseph is single with no kids and he says he was inspired by his friend to try his hand at this business. 

The decision he took to begin this source of livelihood has in many ways made him proud. Joseph says living by his wits was a proposition that he dreaded. Before, he was before engaged in  a small farming business but it did not help that much as most of the food he was growing was harvested for home consumption.

Monthly he says this business generates shillings 300,000 as profit and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more foods like sweet potatoes, rice, maize, etc. which he says sell at higher prices on the local market. In the group photo, Joseph is the one with the raised hand.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as sweet potatoes, rice, maize, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He is a relatively new business owner; he started working as a construction worker almost three years ago.  His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. Despite his situation, he feels positive about his business potentiA. for the coming year because during those three years, he has been able to build a good business reputation. He is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed for his work. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and butter for her bakery

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 29 years.  He is 61 years old, married to Tabitha, and they have two children.  

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Peter plans to use this loan amount to buy oat seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy oat seeds and fertilizer, and hire field workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, age 20, earns an income as a fish vendor. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more fish to offer for sale. She hopes to expand her venture in the future using the extra profits from her business.

Charity and her husband have two children, neither of whom attends school yet.

loans.use: to stock more fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nidia de 45 años de edad está casada hace 26 años con el Sr. Jorge de 45 años de edad; la pareja tiene dos hijos, la mayor de 25 años ya está casada y vive en forma independiente y su otro hijo de 18 años está cursando el último año de la secundaria y la idea de los padres es que su hijo continúe una carrera universitaria cuando culmine su estudio a fin de año.
La Sra. Nidia se dedica a este negocio de ropería y mercería  hace 13 años, su negocio tiene en su propia casa en un salón comercial, sus ventas la realiza todas a crédito y luego sale a cobrar en forma semanal, quincenal y mensual. Mientras sale, su negocio es atendido por su hijo, su esposo trabaja como empleado,  es chofer, todos aportan para llevar adelante los gastos de la unidad familiar.  
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de pantalones, remeras, camisas, ropa interior, vaqueros, camperas y otros abrigos de la temporada otoño, invierno, artículos que los comercializará en su negocio,  así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nidia, 45, is has been married for 26 years to Jorge, 45.  They have two children.  The oldest is 25 years old, married and living independently.  Her 18-year-old son is in the final year of high school.  His parents hope that he will continue on to college when he completes this school year.

Nidia has sold clothes and notions for the last 13 years.  Her business is located in a commercial room in her own house.  All her sales are on credit and she goes out to collect weekly, bi-weekly and monthly.  When she goes out her son watches the store.  Her husband is employed as a driver and they all contribute to meet family expenses.

She is asking for this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts, underwear, jeans, jackets, coats and other items for fall-winter to sell in her store and thus offer more variety to her customers and have the opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married man living with his wife. He has owned an amusement shop since 2009. He has a big number of customers from all ages visiting his shop to enjoy their time with his funny games machines. With his loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase a new espresso machine. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to expand his business further. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a new espresso machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, age 21, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. He and his wife, Joyce Wanjiru, have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to open up a retail shop and stock it with different products to offer for sale, such as maize flour, rice, wheat flour and a variety of home products.

In future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the area and also eventually to grow his new retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to open and stock a retail shop

loans.name: Na We Say Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the "Na We Say" group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With the help of this loan, each of these women will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Celina, age 31, is the leader of this group. Her husband has his own business and they have two children. Celina has run a retail business for six years now: she sells such beverages as cold water, ginger drinks, and soft drinks. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy such beverages as cold water, ginger drinks, and soft drinks to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 10 gallons of oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 26 years.  She is 50 years old, married to Joseph Macharia and they have five children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She paid all of her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and also a dairy cow.

In the future, Josephine hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 90 kilograms of Irish potatoes and ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman living with one parent. She is from Lebanon. After the death of her father, she became the only income provider in the family. So she had to work hard each day to afford their heavy living expenses. In 2009, she was able to open a small grocery shop where she sells dairy and daily products.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is willing to enlarge her shop and add more merchandise into it in order to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 37 years old. He is married and the father of two children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue it generates.

Rovshan is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock. Rovshan is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase his stock.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Sagrado Corazón de Jesús se conformó en fecha 10 de Junio del 2010, gracias a la Sra. Celeste, quien tiene una ferretería y quedó muy interesada con la promoción que la asesora realizó en la zona, quien a su vez le comentó  la forma de trabajo en el grupo  y del crédito a algunas amigas y conformaron su grupo, contactaron con la asesora  y formaron el grupo con 17  mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3º ciclo.
Es un grupo que se destaca por su trabajo conjunto y solidario dentro del programa.
La Sra. Celeste espera contar con este crédito para adquirir nuevos productos de ferretería y lograr aumentar el negocio con mayores variedades.
Todas las integrantes realizan actividades para recaudar fondos,  se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The women’s committee called “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” (Sacred Heart of Jesus) was formed on June 10, 2010 thanks to Celeste who has a hardware store and was very interested by the promotion the advisor carried out in the area.  She then described the way the groups work and about the loan to some friends and they formed the group, contacted the advisor and formed the group with 17 members who are working very comfortably and are now in their 3rd cycle.  It is a group that stands out because of its collaborative work and mutual support within the program.

Celeste hopes to have this loan to acquire new hardware items to increase sales with more variety.

All the members carry out fund raising activities.  They help each other reach common goals that they all have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice sells beans and groundnuts. She is 43 years old and a widow with ten children. None of her children attend school. Rejoice borrowed a loan to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell. With extra profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To become economically stable is the main goal of Evelyn. This is why she is working so hard in her general store business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 as additional revolving capital to buy new products to offer like vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and a lot of food ingredients.   

Evelyn is a married woman with two children. She is now 44 years old and has been managing a general store for two years. She is earning around PHP 6,000 monthly doing this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, soft drinks, crackers and food ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three young children. Two of the children are still attending school. Over the years, he has gained good experience working as a home painter for 26 years. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been an excellent client, paying on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase scaffolding. He needs to be prepared to satisfy his clients. In the future, he hopes to stick with multiple construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Chacharika Group

texts.en:
Rashidi, who is in his mid-thirties, is married with three children who are still attending school. He has been running a business selling Irish potatoes since 2000. He goes upcountry to collect the Irish potatoes and brings them to the City centre to sell them to, amongst others, the people who sell chips.

This will be Rashidi's third "motisha" loan, which is a loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and to receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He used his previous loans to bring more sacks of Irish potatoes, and he has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to still buy more sacks of potatoes from upcountry. His dream is to one day manage to bring a big lorry of Irish potatoes from upcountry.

Rashidi will share this loan with his loan group, "Chacharika," which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old and lives in Paynesville. She's married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 25 who all attend school.

Esther has been operating a small food stall for the past eight years where she sells oil, rice, bread, coal, etc. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice and charcoal for her business. She plans to make her business very big in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Qakhraman

texts.en:
Qakhraman has always been hardworking man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with four children. 

He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Qakhraman began this enterprise many years ago. Over time, he expanded his business and today, his whole family is engaged in the business. 

Today, Qakhraman needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods he sells. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1,300 Azerbaijani new manat. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three school-age children. He has been working in the agriculture field for almost 25 years. He grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These tents allow him to grow more types of products throughout the year. He is well established in his business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work.  He estimates that with the coming harvest, his sales will increase and so will his profits.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Comité Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino Caballero de la ciudad de Caaguazu, son 15 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un  comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua.
La que encabeza el grupo es Felicita, una madre soltera que lucha día a día para mantener  a sus 2 hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para uso doméstico como detergentes, lavandinas, jabones, desodorantes de ambiente, entre otros, porque se dedica a la venta de estos productos y desea poder obtener un mayor ingreso familiar, pretende que utilizando este crédito pueda otorgar a sus clientes una mayor variedad en los artículos de limpieza doméstica.
Todas las integrantes son personas que se reúnen semanalmente, con el compromiso de coordinar las tareas del comité para una mejor organización entre las integrantes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood.  It has 15 women who joined together to form a solidarity committee.  They are very responsible and hard working; they have a spirit of enterprise and mutual help.

The group is headed by Felicita, a single mother who strives daily to support her two children.  She asked for the loan to buy home cleaning supplies like detergents, bleach, soap and room deodorizers, among others.

The group meets weekly in order to coordinate group tasks for better organization among the members.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells fish. She is 24 years old. Betty is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with any extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children. In 2000, he started his new business working as a farmer. He cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season and he distributes the harvest to specific agriculturA. markets he works with. He’s thankful for his new business; it allows him to make extra money for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds because he's planning to expand his business.
