This borrower is a member of the communal bank Perolniyoc [the name of a canyon]. She lives in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old and separated. She has two children, aged 15 and 12. She owns a tourist restaurant. She manages the restaurant and serves food herself. She applies for a loan to renovate and improve her restaurant. She will repair the roof and the walls, and then repaint the premises. She needs money to buy construction material and to pay for labor. She wants this loan to make these investments and she will repay the loan in installments.

She values and appreciates the awarded loan. Her quality of life will be improved. She is committed to repay the loan in installments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction material and paint in order to renovate her restaurant.

loans.name: Célida

texts.es:
La señora Celida de 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la comercialización de  todo tipo de  prendas de vestir hace más de 3 años, empezó gracias a la ayuda crediticia de su cónyuge.
Actualmente cuenta con un negocio próspero, gracias a sus ingresos diarios puede solventar los gastos    escolares de sus dos niñas, una de  10 años y otra de 13 años.
La venta de sus mercaderías lo realiza desde su casa, para lo cual cuenta con un salón bien amplio, vende prendas de vestir para caballeros, damas y niños como remeras, camisas, vestidos. 
Uno de sus mayores anhelos es de confeccionar sus propias prendas para posterior venta, ya que ella posee conocimiento sobre alta costura que aprendió de trabajos anteriores. Desde ya agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Célida, aged 33, is married and the mother of three children. She sells all kinds of clothes. She began her activity more than three years ago, thanks to financial support from her husband. Currently, she owns a prosperous business. The daily income from it enables her to pay the school fees for her two daughters, one of 10 years and one of 13.

Célida sells her merchandise in a large room in her house. She sells clothes for men, women and children, such as T-shirts, shirts, dresses and suits.

One of her greatest desires is to make her own clothes for sale, since she is quite knowledgeable about haute couture, after having learnt the skill at previous workplaces. She thanks the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya for the provided opportunity.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children.

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Edda del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usa desde hace 18 años la cual distribuye en San Ramón, la Dalia…en el departamento de Matagalpa de donde es originaria. 
Además de este negocio en su casa de Managua los sábados vende nacatamales comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo, y los domingos vende sopas.
texts.en: Señora Edda del Socorro is a hard-working and courageous enterprising woman. For 18 years she has been selling second-hand clothes in San Ramón and La Dalia, located in her native department of Matagalpa. In addition to this business, she has two other activities at her home in Managua. On Saturdays she sells nacatamales, a typical food consisting of dough made from corn and a filling consisting of pork meat. And on Sundays she sells soup.

loans.use: to buy clothes, corn, pork meat, vegetables, bones and chickens.

loans.name: Sandra Grimaneza

texts.es:
Sandra Grimaneza tiene 23 años, es soltera vive con los padres y un hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y trigo y a la comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y comprar una casa.

Le gusta  dedicarse a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra Grimaneza is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents and her son in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has one son.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Sandra is a farmer. She grows corn and wheat, and she sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to improve her business and buy a house. She likes to devote herself to her son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Laneh Kuru” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 35, married, and has five children. Three are in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

Fatmata sells cooking utensils – spoons, knives, plates, pots, etc., and has been doing this business for 22 years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying different kinds of cooking utensils in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
Jessica Viviana tiene 21 años, vive en Unión Libre  vive con él con viviente en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Jessica se dedica comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta  descansar y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Jessica Viviana, aged 23, lives in a common-law marriage in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has no children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Jessica sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to have her own house. She likes to rest and go to fiestas.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gloria del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 55 años. Ella tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace siete años vendiendo fresco y comida, con sus ganancias y los préstamo fue surtiendo su venta primero compró  golosinas, chiverías, gaseosa, luego invirtió en granos básicos actualmente vende hasta accesorios de celular. 
Ella con el crédito comprará mercadería para seguir surtiendo su pulpería. Esta clienta inicio con Adim en crédito grupal en el Grupo Ciudadanos del Reino y ahora inicia su crédito individual.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria del Carmen, aged 55, is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She owns a small grocery store, which she opened seven years ago and where she sells refreshments and food. In the beginning she used her earnings and loans to buy candy, milk products and soda; later she invested in staple grains. Currently, she also sells accessories to cell phones.

She will use her loan to buy goods to stock up her store. Gloria del Carmen became a client of the microfinance institution ADIM as a member of the Group "Ciudadanos del Reino" (Citizens of the Kingdom). This is her first individual loan.

loans.use: to stock up her grocery store with staple grains and accessories to cell phones.

loans.name: Franklin Rolando

texts.es:
Franklin  Rolando tiene 22 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Franklin se dedica comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa, tener terrenos para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y bailar en las fiestas
texts.en:
Franklin Rolando is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. He has no children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Franklin Rolando sells vegetables. He gets his supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells his goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

He applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is to buy a house and own a few fields to sow. He likes to practice sports and dance at parties.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Urubamba en la provincia D. Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 52  años D. edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales ella vive con dos D. ellos D. 29, 25 años D. edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta D. animales menores ella se dedica  a la crianza y engorD. D. animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia suele comprar en las ferias los animales menores los cuales cría y engorda y luego los venD.. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank Perolniyoc [the name of a canyon]. She lives in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old, widowed and the mother of three children. She lives with two of them, aged 29 and 25. She alternates her activities between household chores and buying and selling small animals. She breeds and fattens small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she usually buys at the traD. fairs. After having fattened them, she sells them. She applies for a loan to invest in the purchase of small animals.

She values and appreciates the awarded loan. Her quality of life will be improved. She is committed to repay the loan in installments on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals.

loans.name: Lola María

texts.es:
Lola Maria tiene 44 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Lola se dedica a la agricultura tiene un solar, casa propia, siembra maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, tiene dos cerdos además se dedica a la venta de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es, tener terrenos para sembrar y comprar un vehículo para el negocio.

Le gusta tener limpia la casa.
texts.en:
Lola María is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband and the children in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has five children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Lola is a farmer. She has a plot of land and her own house. She grows corn, potatoes, wheat and barley. She has two pigs and she also sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to own a few fields to sow and to buy a car for her business. She likes to clean the house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 3 est formé de dix personnes qui habitent toutes dans la même agglomération. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Zansi Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Zansi Christine est une veuve ayant à sa charge cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis vingt sept ans, Zansi Christine vit seule à Tchonvi avec ses cinq enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Pour y arriver, Zansi Christine prépare divers repas (riz, pâte de maïs, accompagné de sauce, etc.), qu’elle vend à son domicile. Zansi Christine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Zansi Christine et son groupe sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group JESUTOGBE 3 is comprised of ten people who all live in the same town. The group’s representative, by the name of Zansi Christine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Zansi Christine is a widow who supports five children, who have all had schooling. For 27 years, she has lived alone in Tchonvi with her five children, and she ensures by herself that their various expenses are covered. To do so, she makes a variety of meals (rice, corn mash, with sauce, etc.) that she sells out of her house. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

This is the first time that Zansi Christine and her group has requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to bolster their businesses in order to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, and sauce condiments

loans.name: We Go Try Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We Go Try” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,400,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawanatu is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old woman is single and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Hawanatu has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells food such as rice, pepper, onions, oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, onions, oil, etc., at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. M.; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora donde realiza trabajos de fotocopias y tipeos y también la socia trabaja en una librería desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de fotocopiadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de la maquina fotocopiadora y para comprar papeles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
M. is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Guadalupe – Cusco" (Our Lady of Guadalupe – Cusco). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Señora M. is 45 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities between her photocopy business, where she makes photocopies and provides typing services, and her job at a bookstore, where she works from 8 am to 8 pm. M. wants to expand and improve her photocopy business. She applies for a loan to service the photocopier and buy paper.

M. thanks for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to service her photocopier and buy paper.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 42  años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ella vive con dos de ellos de 16, 11 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales mayores, la socia compra y vende toros, vacas; la socia desea invertir en la copra de 2 toros pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos y después de esto venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales mayores, la socia comprara dos toros.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to, " PEROLNIYOC"; she lives in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.  This member is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom she still lives with, of ages 11 and 16.  She alternates her household activities with the purchase of older animals; she buys and sells bulls and cows.  She wishes to purchase 2 younger bulls in order to raise them and fatten them up to later sell.
This member solicits the loan to invest in the puchase of older animals, she would be buying 2 bulls.  This member values and is thankful for the loan given to her in order to improve her quality of life; at the same time she commits to fulfilling her payments withing the allotted time.

loans.use: to purchase older animals, this member would purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Aurelio Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Aurelio Martin; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de transporte, el tiene un carro que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere ahorrar para estudiar alguna profesión, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi que realiza.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos repuestos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Aurelio Martin, age 24, is single and works as a taxi driver.  He uses his own vehicle to provide services throughout the city of Cusco from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  With the income from this business he plans to save to study for a professional career.  He wants to improve the taxi service and is requesting a loan to buy repair parts and pay for maintenance.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy auto repair parts and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el restaurant, ella vende desayunos y también almuerzos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, también la socia vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Segundina, age 50, has a live-in partner and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a restaurant where she offers breakfast and lunch.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  She also sells "chicha" (a corn-based drink).  She wants to expand and improve her restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as meat, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Good Friend Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group member will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata was born in Russel village about 45 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has seven children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Aminata sells building materials and has been doing this business for six years now. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,800,000) to buy building materials such as paints, nails, hammers, shovels, etc., in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paints, nails, hammers, shovels, etc., in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de grains de céréales (riz et arachide),  de lait, de bananes,  des mangues,  de savons et d’habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce pour certaines et d’entreprendre de nouvelles activités génératrices de revenu pour d’autres, les membres du groupe ont adhéré  au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bayta a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beauté. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 douzaines de cartons de crèmes pour la peau. Elle se ravitaille en gros au grand marché de Bamako en ces produits et les revend en détails au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Château à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bayta espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Benkadi group are in their majority married in monogamous families. They are on average 32 years old with five children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Segou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and got to know each other through neighborhood contacts and their income-generating activities at the 'Château de Ségou' market. The group members retail grains and cereals (rice and peanut), milk, bananas, mangoes, soap and clothing. In order to build up their stock for some, and to launch new income-generating activities for others, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso's lending program. This is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Bayta has a great reputation in the retail of cosmetics. She plans on using her loan to purchase four dozen boxes of skincare products. She get her supplies wholesale from Bamako's big market, and retails for cash or credit from home, door-to-door and on the Château market, mostly to female consumers. With this loan, Mrs. Bayta hopes to generate an average monthly benefit of 20,000 CFA, which will reinvested in the business and used to take care of her household's secondary needs. Like the other group members, her objective is to increase her level of activity through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, fish, etc., in order to produce more cooked rice for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy forma parte del Banco comunal “Villa el Estero” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de paquetería, específicamente perfumes, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este negocio lo realiza puerta a puerta, se dirige directamente a la casa de sus clientes, ya que además brinda facilidades de pago. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 8 años y comenzó vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo. Además Nancy trabaja en una casa particular cuidando personas de la tercera edad. Por lo que su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su trabajo dependiente y su negocio. Sin embargo igual aprovecha de ofrecer sus productos en su trabajo. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, ya que los precios son a bajo costo, por ende más convenientes.
Con éste préstamo comprará artículos para su negocio, específicamente cosméticos, camisetas, calcetines, perfumes y bufandas.
Su meta es establecer su negocio instalándose en un local, para abastecerlo con mayor variedad de productos y así obtener mejores ganancias. 
Nancy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, para brindarle a su familia una mayor comodidad, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional y continúa ahorrando. 
Nancy está muy agradecida del préstamo y facilidades de pago que brinda Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones que tiene junto a su grupo, ya que son muy amenas. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the communal bank "Villa el Estero" which is in the city of Concepción.  She sells items such as perfumes, cosmetics and underwear on a door-to-door basis and offers easy payment terms.  She has been in business for eight years and began selling by catalogue.  Nancy also works for a family as an elderly care giver and divides her time between her job and her business.  She buys her products through distributors for lower cost and more convenience.

She plans to use the loan to set up a shop and stock it with a variety of products to increase her earnings.  She enjoys the meetings with her group.

Concepción is located near the basin of the Biobio River, one of the largest in the country, in southern Chile.  Bordering on Mapuche territory, it is an important location in our history because of the battles and relevant settlement, especially during the Arauco War.  The city currently has a significant economic and demographic development and is considered to be one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: To buy inventory for retail sales, such as cosmetics, t-shirts, socks, perfumes and scarves.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans de familles monogames, les huit femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffe, de chaussures, de pagnes brodés et d’échalotes. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  200 kg d’échalotes avec les forains de Niono au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Médine à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres membres du groupe de devenir grossiste dans l’activité qu’elle mène.
texts.en:
The eight women from the Benkadi group are on average 39 years old and have on average 5 children. They are married and for the most part in monogamous families. They all live in the Angouleme quarter of Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, and their income generating activities at Segou’s Medine market. The members of the group sell wood coal, firewood, shoes, embroidered “pagnes” [colorful wrap around fabric] and shallots.

In order to increase their working capital the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Mrs. Fatoumata wants to use her loan to buy 200 kg of shallots from Niono's itinerant merchants at the Grand Market of Segou. She sells retail for cash or on credit from her house or at the Medine market to customers who are both men and women. 

Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 Francs CFA and will use it to be reinvested in her activity and to cover the health expenses of her children. Her goal, just like the other group members, is to become a wholesaler in her line of business.

loans.use: to purchase shallots

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 42  años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 15, 5 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades  del hogar con un pequeño negocio que ella misma puso, la socia es docente de profesión pero este año no la contrataron y ella decidió elaborar tortas para la venta y en casa acondiciono un espacio para dedicarse a la elaboración de tortas, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos para la elaboración de tortas.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "PEROLNIYOC" and lives in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 42 years and married with three children, ages 21, 15 and 5.  She alternates her daily activities as a homemaker with a small business she set up.  She is a teacher by profession but was not hired this year so decided to make and sell cakes.  She adapted her house to include a working area and now is requesting a loan to buy materials and ingredients to make the cakes.

She is grateful for the loan which will help her improve her quality of life, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, cotton cloths, slippers, etc., in large quantities

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les sept femmes du groupe Dakan ont en moyenne 36 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois e chauffe, d’habits, de la friperie, du riz et du pain. 
Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Madame Fatoumata compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux ballons d’habits de la friperie au grand marché de Ségou.. La revente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant dans les différents quartiers et de façon fixe au marché Médine, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’ouvrir un magasin de vente d’habits de la friperie.
texts.en:
The majority married in monogamous families, the seven women of the Dakan group are on average 36 years old with six children. They live in the Angoulême district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They are acquainted through marriage, kinship, and business associations at the Médine market in Ségou. The group's members do business in charcoal, firewood, clothing (new and used), rice, and bread. 

In order to pay for supplies in cash, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso; they are on their ninth group loan. The previous loans have been fully repaid.

Madame Fatoumata plans to use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing at the big market in Ségou. She resells door-to-door, as an itinerant vendor, and at a stall in the Médine market; her customers are both male and female, and she sells for cash and credit. 

Madame Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 29,000 CFA with this loan. This will be reinvested in the business and used for occasional household expenses. Her goal is to open a second-hand clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.es:
Andrey, tiene la edad de 26 años, está Casado y vive con su hijo y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar una moto para trasladarse al tabajo. El tiene un trabajo fijo como guarda de seguridad privada por las noches, por el horario que maneja, también puede trabajar ratos en construcción, lo que la moto le economiza mucho tiempo para trasladarse de un lugar a otro y a su casa. 

Andrey  quiere crecer en lo económico  y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y su esposa. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibide de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Andrey, age 26, is married and lives with his wife and son.  He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation to his workplace.  He works as a private security guard at night and when his schedule permit, he also is active in the construction sector.  The motorcycle will help him save time getting from one place to another or home. 

Andrey wants to grow economically and give his wife and son the best quality of life.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never taken out any state bank loans, and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas en forma independiente y también la socia trabaja como preventista, la socia lleva la ropa a diferentes lugares para vender la ropa, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de ferretería, venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de repuestos de carro.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the "San Antonio" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ana Maria is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a business selling clothes.  She is self employed and sells pants, polo shirts, blouses and sweaters.  She also works as pre-sales agent.  She takes the clothes to different places to sell them.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Ana Maria would like to expand her clothes business.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale.

The other members of this group run a hardware store, sell handicrafts, sell beauty products and sell car parts.

Ana Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream in this way and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella vende naranjas, manzanas, platanos, uvas y entre otras frutas, la socia vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de frutas.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cleofe is a member of the 'Madres Trabajadoras' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Cleofe is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her fruit business.  She sells oranges, apples, bananas, grapes and other fruit.  Cleofe sells her produce in Huancaro market, from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her business she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand and improve her fruit business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit wholesale.

Cleofe is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Tiacaque" este nombre fuen elejido por que las señoras viven en la comunidad de Tiacaque que significa lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos. Está ubicado en el estado de México y esta comunidad se caracteriza  por que hay un centro turistico en la localidad donde hay una enorme presa de agua y la mayoria de los habitantes se dedican a la crianza de borregos. El grupo está conformado por 13 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Adriana M. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y se dedica a la crianza de animales, principalmente a la cria de borregos, comenta que la crianza de animales es lo que le agrada ya que es una actividad principal en la comunidad y tiene 3 años criando animales. Ella tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Para ella es la tercera vez que ha entrado en prestamos para fortalecer su negocio y quedando agradecida por la oportunida. Su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que sus animales sean reconocidos por los clientes al momento de venderlos ya que la carne es de buena calidad, el prestamo le ayudará a comprar alimento y pastura para sus borregos ya que es lo primordial para que los animales crescan rapidamente y asi poder venderlos. Sueña que algun dia pueda incrementar el inventario de sus animales teniendo un corral con 50 cabezas de borregos y poner un local donde venda tacos de barbacoa y obtener mayores ganancias, tambien para contribuir a que sus hijos tengan una mayor educacion y tengan una profesion a futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Tiacaque'.  They chose this name because the ladies all live in the community of Tiacaque which means 'place where water is born between rocky outcrops'.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and their community is noted for the fact that it has a tourist site where there is an enormous reservoir.  Most of the town's inhabitants raise lambs for a living.

The group has 13 members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan.  One of the members is called Adriana M.  She is 25 years old and studied up to high school.  She is a homemaker and also raises animals, mainly lambs.  She says that raising animals is something she enjoys.  It is the main business activity in her community and she has been raising animals for three years.  Adriana has a 3 year-old son.  This is the third time that she has taken a loan to strengthen her business and she is grateful for the opportunity.  Her dedication to her business has enabled her animals to become well known by her customers because their meat is good quality.  This loan will help her to buy feed and fodder for her lambs since this is essential if her animals are to grow quickly and be sold.

Adriana dreams that some day she will be able to increase her inventory of animals, owning 50 head of lambs and setting up premises where she can sell 'tacos de barbacoa' (spicy shredded-beef tacos) and make more profits.  She also wants to help her children receive a good education and have a profession in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her business raising lambs

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aida; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de gas y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y también la socia vende cerveza desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de gas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de tiendas de abarrotes y para comprar gas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Aida is a member of the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" ("Working Mothers") communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco. 

She is 43 years old, single with 2 children. On top of her daily activities she has a gas selling business and also runs a grocery store selling staples such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk as well as beer. She sells from  5:00 am to 7:00 pm, She would like to expand and improve her grocery store and the gas selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries and gas.

She is happy with the loan and committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy groceries and gas.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda, de 25 años, es una mujer ambiciosa y luchadora, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 22 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Desde hace 5 años que prepara pan, en un inicio lo distribuía en los diferentes puntos de venta de su localidad pero ahora tiene su propia panadería, que además de vender pan, vende también tortas y pasteles. Con ello creció su negocio y sus ganancias, y eso le favoreció mucho para poder ayudar con los gastos de estudios universitarios de su hermana que deseaba estudiar enfermería. Pero para continuar con el apoyo a su familia, tuvo que incursionar en la agricultura, ayudando a sus padres en la siembra de arveja, papa y hortalizas; y durante el fin de semana, ella va a supervisar los cultivos y a negociar lo que ha cosechado en el mercado central de su ciudad; logrando enviar hortalizas a la capital. Lo que más le gusta a Jocelinda es ayudar a su familia, pues su mayor deseo es ver a su hermana realizada y a sus padres tranquilos. Ahora quiere comprar productos para implementar su panadería, asimismo adquirir su propio terreno y de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas, para cumplir con la demanda que le genera los compradores mayoristas y para ellos tendrá que contratar peones para que le ayuden en el cuidado de sus futuros cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura que su banco comunal es muy respetado en su localidad. Jocelinda, con el crédito solicitado comprará semilla de espinaca, varios sacos de abono orgánico, para su próxima cosecha. Asimismo  sacos de harina y manteca para realizar los ricos panes y pasteles que prepara.
texts.en: Jocelinda, 25 years old, is an ambitious and hard-working woman. She lives with her parents and her sister, Lisbet, who is 22, in their own house located in the Palcamayo area. For five years she has prepared bread, initially distributed in the different outlets in her area but now she has her own bread shop where, in addition to selling bread, she also sells cakes and pastries. With that her business and earnings have grown and this helped her a lot to be able to help with the university education expenses of her sister, who wished to study nursing. However, to continue to support her family, she had to enter into agriculture, helping her parents in planting peas, potatoes and vegetables. And on weekends, she supervises the crops and negotiates what has been harvested in the city's central market, sending vegetables to make money. What Jocelinda likes most is helping her family. Her greatest wish is to see her sister successful and her parents calm. Now she wishes to buy products for her bakery, as well as acquire her own land and, in this way, be able to farm a greater quantity of vegetables to meet the demand that the wholesale buyers generate and for that she will have to hire workers to help her to take care of future crops. She belongs to the "Patrón San Cristóbal" community bank and this is the second loan with MFP, where she is sure that her community bank is very respected in her area. Jocelinda, with the loan requested, will purchase spinach seeds and various bags of organic fertilizer, for her next harvest, as well as bags of flour and butter to make the delicious bread and cakes that she prepares.

loans.use: to purchase spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer. She will also buy bags of flour for the preparation of bread and cakes.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte y también se dedica al negocio de servicio de llamadas de forma ambulatoria en las calles de la ciudad de Cusco y su esposo maneja el carro que hace servicio de taxi, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y servicio de llamadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y pagar las líneas de sus celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadores" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Valentina. She is 59 years old and lives with her partner and has two children. The member alternates her daily activities between a transportation business and also a business providing a calling service of a wandering nature in the streets of the city of Cusco and her husband drives the car that performs a taxi service. Through these businesses, the member gets her children ahead. She wishes to expand the transportation business and calling service. She is requesting a loan to maintain her car and to pay for the cell phone lines.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to maintain her car and to pay for her cell phone lines.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de servicios de llamadas telefónicas, ella tiene celulares y presta servicio de llamadas en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso, cemento y arena para hacer el acabado de su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" (working mothers) community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Yovana. She is 40 years old and is single and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with telephone call services. She has cell phones and loans calling service in different streets in the city of Cusco. She works from 5AM until 10PM. Through this small job, this member gets her children ahead. She wants to finish building her house. She is requesting the loan in order to buy construction materials such as plaster, cement and sand to finish her house.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as plaster, cement and sand to finish her house.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karen; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ocas (es un tubérculo parecido a la papa),ella los prepara al horno y los vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ocas al horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ocas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “WORKING MOTHERS” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province.

The member is Karen; she is 20 years old, partnered, and has 1 son.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling ocas (a tuber similar to a potato).  She prepares them in an oven, and sells them in the Cusco city’s market.  She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.  By means of this business, she helps her family get ahead.  She would like to expand her business selling oven-roasted ocas.  She requests a loan to buy ocas at wholesale.

She is glad for the opportunity to get a loan, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy ocas (a tuber similar to a potato) at wholesale.

loans.name: Flamingos I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Flamingos" y se ubica en la cacomunidad en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Florina es una integrante del grupo se dedica a la venta de marranos que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más marranos para criar y posteriormente vender. Ella estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, esta casada y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan de crecer en su negocio y superarse. Quiere este prestamo para comprar más animales que ya tiene comprometidos y con esto tener mayor ganancias y así brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y la oportunidad de ofrecerles educación con lo cual puedan tener un mejor futuro y cumplir sus metas que se propongan. Observaciones la señora que no se alcanza a ver bien en la fotografia se llama Alejandra
texts.en:
This group is called “Flamingoes” and is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is comprised of 11 members, and this is the first time they request a loan.  Florina is one of the members; she dedicates herself to selling hogs, a business she started 10 years ago.  

She requests this loan to buy more animals to raise and later sell.  She studied up to the third grade, is married and has 3 children.  At the time of making this request for a loan, she is enthusiastic about the opportunity it gives her to grow her business and succeed.  

She would like this loan to buy more animals since she already has commitments for them.  This brings her more income, which will allow her to provide a better standard of living for her children and to offer them an education so they can enjoy brighter futures and meet any goals they set for themselves.  Note that the woman who is difficult to see in the picture is named Alejandra.

loans.use: buy hogs to raise.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ocas (es un tubérculo parecido a la papa) y también vende plátanos al horno, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ocas y plátanos al horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar plátanos y ocas para preparar al horno.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “WORKING MOTHERS” cooperative bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province.

The member is Sofia; she is 42 years old and single.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling ocas (a tuber similar to a potato) and also sells baked bananas.  She works as a street vendor from 9:00 am until 4:00 pm and, by means of this business, she helps her children get ahead.  She would like to expand and improve her business selling baked ocas and bananas.  She requests this loan to buy bananas and ocas to prepare in the oven.

She is very glad to have access to a loan, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: buy bananas and ocas (a tuber similar to a potato) to bake in the oven.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 22 años; es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su padre Adán, su mamá Armanda y su hermanito Jean. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a la agricultura, pues sus padres necesitaban de su apoyo y sobre todo su vitalidad, desde entonces siembra espinaca, arveja y flor de gladiolo sobre terrenos propios y alquilados. Este joven además de la fortaleza que tiene para ejecutar este trabajo, también es negociante, por lo que cada temporada se va a la capital de país para comercializar sus productos, obteniendo una considerable ganancia. Además cuenta que en sus tiempos libres, trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, “No puedo estar sin hacer nada”, afirma. Por ello cada vez que puede ahorra lo necesario para comprarse sus propios terrenos agrícolas e independizarse de sus padres, a quienes agradece las enseñanzas que le brindaron y promete ofrecerles una vejez sana y muy feliz. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener muchos éxitos con su asociación. José, dentro de estos días sembrará espinaca; por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará semilla y varios sacos de abono orgánico para su fertilización.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, and a single, hard-working young man.  He lives with his father, Adán, his mother, Armanda, and his little brother, Jean.  They live together in their own house, located in the Palcamayo area.

He has dedicated himself to farming for more than 2 years, as his parents needed his support and, most of all, his vitality.  Since then, he has planted spinach, peas and gladiolas on lands they own and some they rent.  This young man, in addition to the strength he has for carrying out this work, is also a merchant.  Each season, he goes to the country’s capital city to sell his products, obtaining substantial profits.  In addition, when he has free time, he works as a laborer on agricultural lands.  “I can’t spend time doing nothing”, he affirms.

For this reason, each time he can, he saves the necessary amount to buy himself some land to become independent from his parents.  He is very thankful to them for all they have taught him, and promises to offer them a healthy and happy life in their old age.

He belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” cooperative bank.  This is his first loan with MFP, where he hopes to have many successes with their association.  During these days, José will plant spinach; for this reason, he will use the loan he is requesting to buy seeds and various sacks of organic fertilizer for his crop.

loans.use: buy spinach seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón de  27 años de edad, es soltero y cuenta con un lavadero y gomería propios en el predio de la casa de sus padres.
Gracias a la ayuda económica de su padre, quien es empleado de una empresa de transporte, y de su madre, quien  posee un pequeño copetín, pudieron adquirir todo lo necesario para montar el pequeño taller y lavadero.
Actualmente necesita de un nuevo compresor de aire ya que el que posee está bastante deteriorado por el uso realizado en estos últimos tres años.
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza otorgada y comenta que con el compresor nuevo estaría cumpliendo  mejor con su numerosa clientela.
texts.en:
Ramón is 27 years old, single, and has his own laundry and tire workshop at his parents’ house.  Thanks to the financial support from his father, who works for a transportation enterprise, and his mother, who has a small snack bar, they were able to acquire the necessities for starting the small workshop and laundry.

Currently, he needs a new air compressor, as the one he currently has is very deteriorated due to all the use it has had over the past three years.

He thanks the Paraguaya Foundation for their confidence in him, and comments that the new air compressor would allow him to better serve his many customers.

loans.use: buy a new air compressor.

loans.name: Analffy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Analffy; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y también el socio trabaja como mecanico,el arregla motosierras,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el negocio de motosierras.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y algunos materiales para arreglar la motosierra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadores" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Analffy. He is 45 years old and is married and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his grocery store business. The member sells basic necessity products like rice, sugar, milk and noodles and also works as a mechanic. He fixes chainsaws. Through these businesses he gets his children ahead. The member wishes to expand and improve the grocery store and improve his chainsaw business. He is requesting the loan to purchase products for the shop and some materials to fix the chainsaw.

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase products for his grocery store and some materials to fix his chainsaw.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Agustín; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería metalica y también es maestro de construccion,el hace estos trabajos en forma independiente construyendo algunas casas y haciendo trabajos de carpintería metalica como puertas, ventanas y estructuras metalicas,el socio quiere refaccionar y mejorar su casa.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como pintura, cemento y arena.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Agustin is a member of the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" ("Working Mothers") communal bank. The bank is Located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

He is 55 years old, married with 6 children. Alongside his daily activities he runs a metalwork business and he also works as master builder. He works independently, building some houses and doing metalwork jobs such as doors, windows and metal structures. He would like to renovate and improve his home. He is requesting the loan to buy building materials such as paint, concrete and sand.

The partner is happy for the loan and committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: to buy building materiasl such as paint, concrete and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de turismo y también servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el también lleva turistas a distintos lugares como Ollantaytambo, Chinchero y Machupicchu, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de turismo.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar algunos repuestos de carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 35 years old and is married and has one child. The member alternates his daily activities with the transportation business. He provides a tourism service and also a taxi service. He works from 7AM until 6PM. He also takes tourists to different places like Ollantaytambo, Chinchero and Machupicchu. The member wishes to improve his tourism service. The member requests the loan to maintain his car and to buy some car parts.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his car and to buy some car parts.

loans.name: Andres Dario

texts.es: Andres es un joven de 19 años que desde los 16, inicio su vida laboral  trabajando con unos amigos como ayudante en un almacén de repuesto y lujos para carros en el  barrio 7 de Agosto en la ciudad  Bogotá;  Posterior a esta experiencia con recursos propios emprendió hace un año y medio su propio negocio de instalación de alarmas, bloqueos, radios y venta de cajas de sonido para carros; él vive con sus padres y su hija de 4 meses que está  a su cargo y es su mayor motivación para con su negocio construir un futuro prometedor, que la lleve a alcanzar el éxito de manera conjunta. En su negocio vende alarmas para autos, alarmas y bloqueo central, radio e instalación, así mismo fabrica parlantes y cajones de sonidos para carros. Su poco capital de trabajo lo obliga a hacer compras en pequeñas cantidades y con mucha frecuencia porque después de vender el artículo, con ese mismo dinero surte y reemplaza el articulo que vendió. Esta es una de las razones por las cuales recurre a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cajas de maderas, alarmas, parlantes, bloqueos automáticos, radios y herramientas para mejorar la oferta de su taller, donde ofrece el servicio de instalación de  equipos, sonidos para autos y fabrica tambien parlantes. Su sueño es posicionarse en el mercado, dándose a conocer por el servicio de buena calidad que ofrece y por los productos que vende en su almacén, porque en la actualidad surtirlo es su mayor desafío, así como el no tener una vivienda propia. Mientras Andres construye sus sueños persiste en su trabajo responsable y disciplinado para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Andres is a young man of 19 years who, since he was 16, began his career working with some friends as a helper in a car parts and lights store in the 7 de Agosto neighborhood in the city of Bogotá. After this experience, with his own resources, he started his own business installing alarms, locks, radios and selling sound boxes for cars a year and a half ago. He lives with his parents and his 4-month-old daughter who is in his care and is his greatest motivation to build a promising future with his business that leads to success together.

In his business, he sells car alarms, alarms and central locking, radio and installation, as well as making speakers and sound boxes for cars. His little working capital obliges him to make purchases in small quantities and with a lot of frequency because after selling the item, with that same money, he stocks and replaces the item he sold. This is one of the reasons why he uses crediKiva, which is the first loan that he made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with which he will buy wooden boxes, alarms, speakers, automatic locks, radios and tools to improve the offerings of his shop, where he offers the service of installing equipment, car audio systems and makes speakers as well. He dream is to position himself in the market, becoming known for the good quality service that he offers and for the products that he sells in his store since, currently, stocking is his greatest challenge, as well as not having his own home. While Andres builds his dreams, he persists in his work in a responsible and disciplined manner to achieve them.

loans.use: To buy wooden boxes, alarms, speakers, automatic locks, radios and tools to improve his shop's offer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 56 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de costurera y también vende chompas, la socia cose pantalones, blusas y faldas y también teje las chompas y lo vende en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de costurera y venta de chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos y lanas para coser y tejer las chompas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the 'Madres Trabajadoras' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 56 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her dressmaking business.  She also sells sweaters.  She sews pants, blouses and skirts and also knits sweaters which she sells independently.  Through these businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to improve and expand her dressmaking business and her sweater business.  she is requesting this loan to buy materials such as threads and yarn with which to sew and knit sweaters and pants.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as threads and yarn to sew and knit sweaters and pants

loans.name: Iris Ii Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Iris ll" porque es el nombre de la hija de la señora Amanda quien es la presidenta del grupo y se ubican en Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Amanda se dedica a la compra/venta de ropa en su domicilio que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada que ya le pidieron sus clientas, tiene 29 años, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 2 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada al ofrecerles esta oportunidad. Con esto desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. La señora Carmen V. es otra integrante de este grupo. Tiene 57 años de edad, no tiene estudios, es legalmente casada y tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a la costura que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar tela e hilos que le hacen falta. Sus clientes son de la misma localidad. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada ya que se surtira de tela e hilos para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio. Tambien espera tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ganancias para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called "Iris ll" because it is the name of Amanda's daughter (Amanda is the group's president).  It is located in Puebla, in Mexico.

This group has eight members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.  Amanda works buying and selling clothes from her home.  She started her business two years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes that her customers have already requested.  She is 29 years old, studied up to the sixth year of elementary school, lives with her partner, and has two children.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic that her group has been offered this opportunity.  She hopes that it will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Carmen V. is another member of the group.  She is 57 years old, didn't attend school, is married, and has one daughter.  She has been running a sewing business for five years and is requesting this loan to buy fabric and threads that she needs.  Her customers are from the same town.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic as she will be able to stock up on fabric and thread so that she can continue growing her business.  She hopes to attract more customers and improve her profits so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años, es soltero,  tiene casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua,luz y desagüe), ubicada en una zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Este distrito se caracteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadería y turismo.

Juan se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves corral como gallinas y pavos, ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras), sus corrales de crianza se encuentran en la parte externa de su casa.  A sus animales los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales,  una vez que estos han llegado a su desarrollo óptimo los ofrece a la venta a los pobladores y en los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque, la venta de sus animales le permite tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Con el préstamo que le piensan dar va a comprar más animales y alimentos para los mismos, y  así pueda seguir incrementando sus ventas y tener unamejor calidad de vida.  Por eso ha visto conveniente solicitar dicho préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles.  Juan es una persona que quiere superarse en la vida siendo responsable y empeñosa en todo lo que hace y siempre con elobjetivoque su negocio crezca cada vez más para pagar su crédito y seguir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, single, and he has a house of his own. It is not equipped with basic services (water, electricity, or sewage services). It is located in a rural region in the department of Lambayeque. This district is known for its population who are involved in agriculture, farming, and tourism activities. 

Juan raises and sells poultry, such as chicken and turkeys, sheep, and goats from corrals. They are located in the external part of his property. He feeds them balanced feed and natural grasses. Once they have reached an optimal level in their development he offers them for sale to the locals and at the different markets in Lambayeque. The livestock sales help him earn an income to cover his personal expenses. 

With the loan that he requests he will purchase more livestock and feed to keep increasing his sales and to achieve a better quality of life. He has seen it convenient to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. Juan is a person who wants to excel in life, being a responsible and earnest person in everything he does. He has always had an objective to keep increasing his business to be able to repay his loan and to advance more every day.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Marica Lorena

texts.es:
Marcia es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones en su vida por eso es vendedora de ropa y artículos según la temporada.  

Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercial de mercadería y ropa para poder mantener a sus tres hijos. Trabajan en conjunto porque tienen  que viajar a otras provincias para tener un resultado favorable en sus ventas ya que en las provincias se vende más la mercadería.  Venden camisas, pantalones, zapatos. 

Tienes muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando pero por ahora quiere adecuar su casa para darle una buena vida a sus hijos. Por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento, arena, bloques. En el futuro quiere continuar con el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Marcia is a hard-working woman who has a lot of aspirations in life.  Her business is selling clothes and other goods according to the season.

Marcia and her husband sell merchandise and clothes so that they can support their three children.  They work together because they have to travel to other provinces in order to make good sales since their merchandise sells better in the provinces.  They sell shirts, pants and shoes.

Marcia has a lot of aspirations for her business and would like to continue working.
