However, right now she would like to do some work on her house so that she can provide her children with a good life.  She would like to use her loan to buy cement, sand and blocks.  In the future, she would like to continue with her family business.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone and sand

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio, de 45 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, convive con Juana de 48 años padres de 04 hijos, quienes conforman la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja. Epifanio es un hombre trabajador, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao, café y barbasco plantas que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió tornarlas muy productivas. Son 20 años de trabajo continuo por lo que lo ha convertido en una persona con mucha experiencia. Sin embargo sabe que este trabajo es arduo, así es que debe contratar jornaleros cuando es temporada de cosecha y limpieza de sus campos. La cantidad de frutos que recolecta son llevados a las empresas acopiadoras, en donde le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo que vende. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras ya que no cuenta con espacios para seguir sembrando. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y se compromete seguir aportando sus cuotas puntualmente como en los anteriores créditos, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por elegirle como presidente de la junta directiva. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de cacao para luego sembrarlos de manera tecnificada.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 45 years old and from the city of Quimbiri.  He lives with his partner, 48 year-old Juana, and the couple have four children who bring happiness to their home.  They live in their own home, in the community of Vista Alegre Baja.

Epifanio is a hard-working man who puts a lot of care into the work that he does.  He is a farmer.  He owns four hectares of land where he grows cacao, coffee and barbasco plants which, through a lot of effort, he has managed to make very productive.  He has been working for twenty years and so has a lot of experience.  However, he knows that the work is hard and he hires day laborers when it is the season to harvest and weed his fields.  He takes the fruit that he harvests to middlemen who pay him very well for every kilogram of produce that he sells.  The problem in his work lies in not being able to fight the pests which damage the fruit on his plants.  However, his main priority right now is buying new land as he doesn't have enough space to continue sowing.

This is Epifanio's fifth loan from MFP and he pledges to continue making his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  He is grateful to the other members of his community bank for electing him as president of the board of directors.  He will use the loan he has requested to buy cacao plants which he will then sow using modern technology.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 24, 23, 19 años, Mercedes se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas, carne en un triciclo por las calles del distrito de San Juan Bautista. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, para surtir su mercadería. Mercedes comenzó con éste negocio hace 7 años, porque su esposo no le ayudaba y tenia que mantener a sus hijos. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta porque le enseñaron a valorarse a trabajar, le dan préstamos para trabajar, pasa bonitos momentos con sus compañeras del banco estando en FINCA educo a su hija que termino enfermería técnica. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y vender en su casa, construir el segundo piso de sus casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella community bank.  She is married and has three children aged 24, 23 and 19.  Mercedes sells fruit, vegetables and meat from a three-wheeled vehicle in the streets of San Juan Bautista district.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying fruit, vegetables and meat with which to stock her business.  Mercedes started this business seven years ago because her husband didn't help her and she needed to support her children.

Mercedes joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing borrower.  She likes it because they have taught her to value work and given her loans so that she can work.  She enjoys spending time with the other members of her community bank and she has managed to educate her daughter who has finished a nursing course.  Mercedes' dream is for her business to continue prospering and to be able to sell from home.  She would also like to build a second level on her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, casada con 28 años y tres hijos de 11, 10, 3 años de edad. Doris se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pollo, carne, verduras, frutas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina, verduras, frutas, para surtir su mercadería. Comenzó con éste negocio hace más de un año. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una amiga, está en tres ciclos, le gusta por la facilidad de créditos y puede ahorrar, ahora está ahorrando para tener más capital de trabajo. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca, poder construir el tercer piso de su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the "Estrella" (Star) Communal Bank. She is married, 28 years old, and has three children ages 11, 10 and 3.

Doris sells groceries like chicken, beef, vegetables and fruit. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy rice, sugar, pasta, flour, vegetables and fruit to stock her store. She began this business more than a year ago.

Doris joined FINCA Perú because a friend invited her. She is in her third loan cycle, and she likes it because the loans are easy to deal with and she can save up money. Right now she is saving to have more working capital.

Her dream is that her business will grow, she will be able to build a third floor onto her house and her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta, flour, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, tiene 25 años es soltera, es de profesión técnica en enfermería. Se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado 12 de Abril. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras para surtir su mercadería. Antes trabaja con su mamá y decidió independizarse y le va bien. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Angélica is a member of the communal bank Estrella.  She is 25 years old, single and a nurse.  She sells vegetables in the April 12 market and is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables.  She used to work with her mother and then she decided to become independent and things are going well for her.  Her dream is to continue growing her business and to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un camión que lleva agua a diferentes lugares como construcciones, elaboración de adobes y lozas, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de llevar agua a distintos lugares.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su camión.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Esmeralda community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 27 years old, lives with his partner, and has three children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He has a truck with which he transports water to different places such as construction sites and places where they make adobe and concrete.  He is self employed and, through his work, he gets his children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand and improve his water supply service.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires for his truck.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elvira; ella tiene 74 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. maíz y habas, la socia venD. en el mercado desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. maíz y habas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y habas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Esmeralda community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Elvira is 74 years old, married, and has five children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling corn and beans.  She sells her produce in the market, from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Elvira would like to expand and improve her business selling corn and beans.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn and beans wholesale.

Elvira is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans wholesale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 36 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por salir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Victoria de 39 años y sus 06 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Félix es el cultivo de cacao, café y frutos de piña, que se encuentras sobre sus 03 hectáreas de tierra, convirtiéndole en uno de los principales productores de la zona, ya que lo hace de manera tecnificada. Sus productos más rentables son los frutos de piña y granos de cacao, por tener mayor demanda en los mercados nacionales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucha perseverancia, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los puntos de venta situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. En lo futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y así tener mayores ingresos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP por lo que menciona pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, como lo venia haciendo en anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es un socio participe y  puntual en toda las reuniones acordadas. Con el crédito solicitado más una cantidad de dinero que ahorró podrá compra una moto carguera para transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de San Francisco.
texts.en:
Félix is 36 years old and from the city of Quimbiri.  He is a hard-working man who goes to a lot of trouble to get ahead in life.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 39 year-old Victoria, and their six beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Félix grows cacao, coffee and pineapple over three hectares of land.  He is one of the main producers in his area as he grows his crops using modern technology.  His most profitable products are the pineapple and cacao as they have the most demand in the national market.  What he most enjoys about his work is harvesting his crops and he does this with a lot of perseverance.  Félix has been in this business for 17 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops from the farm to sales locations in the city of San Francisco.  In the future, he would like to buy new land so that he can increase his crops and thereby make more income.

This is Félix's sixth loan from MFP and he says that he will continue to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  He is a very participative and punctual member of his community bank.  He will use the loan he has requested, together with some money he has saved up himself, to buy a cargo motorbike for transporting produce from his farm to the city of San Francisco.

loans.use: to buy a cargo motorbike

loans.name: Juntas Progresaremos Group

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer muy emprendedora, que ha sabido dar la educacion a sus hijos, tiene mucha energia la cual la aplica para su negocio de la venta de comida (desayuno, almuerzo), el cual se dedica las mañanas para su preparacion y distribucion pues tambien reparte a domicilio a negocios o a quienes no tienen tiempo para cocinar y por las tardes en su propia casa se dedica a enseñar a leer y escribir a adultos quienes no pudieron hacerlo en su niñez, olinda les enseña como madre enseña a un hijo, con mucho cariño.
Olinda es tesorera de la Alcancia Comunal JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS, quienes vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por mas de 2 años, la alcancia esta formada por personas responsables quienes buscan un apoyo para continuar y hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios, tambien entre ella se encuentran alumnas de Olinda quienes ya estan aprendiendo a leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Juntas Progresaremos (Together We Will Progress)

Olinda is a very hard working woman who knew to provide for the education of her children.  She has a lot of energy which she applies to her business of selling food.  She prepares the meals in the mornings and distributes them to homes and businesses, to people that do not have time to cook.  In the afternoons she teaches reading and writing to adults that have not been able to learn when they were young.  Olinda teaches lovingly, like a mother would teach her children.

Olinda is the treasurer of the Communal Bank Juntas Progresaremos who has been working  with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for mO. than 2 years.  The bank is made up of responsible people who are looking for support in their goal to continue to grow their small businesses.  Among the members are some of Olinda's students who are already learning to read and write.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Nuevo Solecito Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA NUEVO SOLECITO PORQUE CON ESTE PRESTAMO QUIEREN INICIAR CON UN NUEVO SOL. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. ESTE GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA ANA LUISA C. ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO LA SECUNDARIA, VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y TIENE UN NEGOCIO DONDE VENDE TORTILLAS HECHAS A MANO DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS, SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA MEJORAR EL LOCAL DONDE TIENE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE POR AHORA ES DE TRONCOS Y TRIPLAY. AL SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO ESTA MUY EMOCIONADA YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTA OPORTUNIDAD PUDO INICIAR SU NEGOCIO Y POCO A POCO HA CRECIDO Y SU META ES LLEGAR A TENER LA MEJOR TORTILLERIA DE LA LOCALIDAD. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA VA AHORRAR PARA MEJORAR SU CASA Y LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This group was named 'Nuevo Solecito' (New [Little] Sun) because the group members want to start this loan with a new sun.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has eight members.

Ana Luisa C. is the group's president.  She is 24 years old, completed high school, and lives with her partner.  She has run a business selling hand-made tortillas for two years.  She is requesting this loan to improve her business premises as, right now, it is made from logs and plywood.  At the time of requesting this loan, Ana Luisa is very excited because, thanks to this opportunity, she was able to start her business and it has gradually grown.  Her goal is to own the best tortilla bakery in town.  She will use the profits that she makes to save up so that she can improve her home and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to re-build the premises from which she sells her tortillas

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana deldistrito de Catacaos a 30 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía (metalurgia, tejido y alfarería)

Josefa es comerciante desde hace varios años de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para que pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado Josefa un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y sus alimentos y mejorar su corral donde viven sus cerdos, con la finalidad de engordarlos para luego venderlos a un mejor precio y así mejoraría la calidad de vida de su hogar.  Josefa es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Josefa is the mother of a family, 46 years old, and she lives in her own home together with her husband and children. It is equipped with water and electricity and it is located in the urban district of Catacaos, 30 minutes from the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, farming, and tourism activities (metal crafts, knitting, and pottery). 

For many years Josefa has been a merchant of pigs. Her corral is located in the posterior section of her house. She feeds them balanced feed so that they will reach an ideal development. She will offer them for sale at the different market s in the region to obtain very good profits which will be used to cover the family’s expenses. 

Josefa has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase more livestock and their feed and to improve the corral where she keeps her pigs. Her goal is to raise and resell them at a better price, so to improve the quality of life in her home. Josefa is a very responsible and hardworking person who is always conscious of improving her business and to keep providing for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Ayidote 1 Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pauline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier et mènent certaines activités ensemble. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pauline est née le 20 juin 1968. Pauline est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Pauline prépare de la nourriture ("Akassa" fait à base du maïs, accompagné de la sauce de viande) qu’elle vend  à son domicile. Pauline et son groupe vendent également du charbon de bois. Pauline exerce ce métier depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari ,  d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Pauline s’approvisionne au Bénin. Pauline vend la nourriture à son domicile. Ce cinquième prêt permettra certainement à Pauline et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: AYIDOTE 1 is a group composed of three people. The president, by the name of Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. The group members live in the same district and operate certain businesses together. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting for the fifth time a loan from ALIDé. Pauline was born on June 20, 1968. She is married to man named Jean. The couple has four children to support. None of the children are in school. After dropping out of primary school, she has been making food (akassa, made from cornmeal and served with meat sauce) that she sells out of her house. She and her group also sell charcoal. She has been working at her trade for fifteen years. It enables her, along with her husband, to ensure that the various family expenses are covered. She gets her supplies from Benin. This fifth loan will surely enable Pauline and her group to boost their businesses and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, corn, cassava flour, and some meat

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es:
Karen de oficio promotora de venta con seis años laborando para el apoyo de su familia, como objetivo ha sido la mejora a su casa,  el cual ha vendió mejorando con el apoyo de su esposo y la institución Afodenic, en donde con cuatro ciclo ha comprado materiales de construcción y levantado las paredes de enfrente.
Karen está feliz por poder lograr esta mejora, con este nuevo préstamo comprara ventana y puerta a si como hierro, soldadura para hacer las verjas y poder tener una casa con mayor seguridad para sus pequeños hijos.
Como planes a futuro es seguir levantando las paredes de concreto hasta terminarla y que espera lograrlo con los financiamientos siendo con modalidades de pago.
texts.en:
Karen is a sales consultant by profession.  She has been working for six years to support her family.  Her goal has been to improve her home and she has managed this with the support of her husband and Afodenic.  For four loan cycles, she has bought construction supplies and managed to build the front walls of her house.

Karen is happy to have made this improvement and will use her new loan to buy a window and door, as well as iron and welding materials, so that she can have some grilles made which will make her house safer for her young children.

Karen's future plans are to continue building her walls from concrete until the house is finished and she hopes to achieve this with loans.

loans.use: to buy a door and window, as well as iron and welding materials so that she can close off her house

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefa; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de llantas, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella es propietaria de una tienda donde vende llantas y otros repuestos para carros y también para las llantas, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de llantas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como llantas y cámaras para llantas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Estefa  is a member of the communal bank Esmeralda.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco and is in the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 23 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She owns a store where she buys and sells tires as well as other car parts for a living.  She works from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She wants to expand her business of selling tires.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as tires and inner tubes.  

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires and inner tubes for her store.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián de 48 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Mauricia de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Julián, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar las plantas de cacao, piña y frutas cítricas es de buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cosechar los frutos ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados. En adelante, espera incrementar más plantas de piña ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio para cultivar. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy campechano y jovial. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y hacerlas muy productivas.
texts.en:
Julián, 48, is a happy and hard-working man. He lives in his own house with his wife Mauricia, 40, and their 4 beloved children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. The farm lands that Julian has put so much effort into getting are the principal means of support for his whole family. 

His products are very highly sought after in the city of San Francisco, since it is well-known that his harvests of cacao, pineapple and citrus fruit are of good quality. What he likes best about his work is harvesting the fruit because he feels that the quality of his fruit makes up for the months of hard work. He has done this work for 22 years and says the hardest part is transporting the bags full of his harvest because they are very heavy. In the future he hopes to add more pineapple plants since he has enough space to grow them. 

This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he knows that it will be very helpful for the development of his work. He is a very good-natured and jovial member of his communal bank. With the requested loan he will purchase bags of manure to fertilize his lands and make them very productive.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruben Adriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ruben Adriel; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte,el,socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi y también tiene una sisterna que es un carro que lleva agua a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, el socio maneja y el taxi que hace servicio en la ciudad de Cusco alquila a una persona para que maneje, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi y servicio de sisterna.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos repuestos para la sisterna.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Ruben Adriel is a member of the “ESMERALDA” Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and department of Cusco.

He is 25, single, and has 1 son. In addition to his daily activities, Ruben Adriel has a transportation business. He has a car for taxi service, and he also has a cistern, which is a car that delivers water to the city of Puerto Maldonado. He drives the cistern and he hires a person to drive the taxi which offers service in Cusco. 

Ruben Adriel wants to improve both services. He requests the loan in order to maintain his car and to purchase some parts for the cistern. He is happy for the loan and promises to make his required payments.

loans.use: to maintain his car and to purchase some parts for his cistern vehicle.

loans.name: Betsabe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betsabe; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cds y películas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de cds y películas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cds y películas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Betsabe is a member of the “ESMERALDA” Communal Bank, which is located in the Cusco district, within the province and department of Cusco.

Betsabe is 26, single, and has 1 son. In addition to her daily activities, she has a door-to-door business buying and selling CDs and movies from 3:00 pm to 10:00 pm. Through this business she has been able to give her son a good start in life. 

She wants to expand and improve her CD and movie business. She requests the loan to purchase wholesale CDs and movies. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments as required.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and movies wholesale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has five children aged 20, 18, 12, 10 and 5. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because she is a relative of his wife. 

Mohamed owns a used shoes business.  He began his business because he wants to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy additional used shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house for his family and educate his children to the university level.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes for his business

loans.name: Mayé

texts.fr: Née en 1967, Mayé est mariée à Anatole un comptable. Le couple a trois enfants à charge tous scolarisés. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Mayé contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Mayé vit ensemble avec son  mari et ses enfants. Mayé vend en effet depuis près de vingt cinq ans divers articles (sucre,lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, etc.) au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mayé  vend du maïs. C’est au Bénin que Mayé s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie, Mayé sollicite pour une quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Mayé is married to Anatole, an accountant. The couple supports three children, all in school. Thanks to the income from her business, Mayé contributes to the various family expenses. Mayé lives together with her husband and their children.

For almost five years, Mayé has been selling various items (sugar, milk, canned goods, pasta, soap, vegetable oil, etc.) in Benin. At the same time, Mayé sells corn. In order to better satisfy her clientele and to improve her standard of living, Mayé is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy corn and various products (sugar, milk, canned goods, pasta, soap, vegetable oil, etc).

loans.name: Josefina Pascuala

texts.es:
Josefina es madre de familia de 42 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su hijo, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de San Pedrode Lloc, a unos 30 minutos de la provincia de Pacasmayo y a dos horas del departamento de la Libertad (Trujillo).  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Josefina labora  en la venta de verduras al por menor, desde hace 8 años, lo realiza en el mercado San Pedro de ese distrito, cuenta con su propia clientela,la que se a idoincrementando progresivamente,lo que le permite tener ingresos y de esa manera puede cubrir sus  necesidades diarias de au hogar. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa fue de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad de verduras de todas las especies para que su clientela pueda llevar otros productos (frutas,tubérculos, menestras,etc.)y así obtener más ingresos y poder seguir ayudando a su hijo a que se supere en la vida.  Josefina es una mujer con muchos ideales y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda ampliar su negocio con la venta de otros productos con el único objetivo tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 42 year-old mother who owns her own home and lives there with her son.  Her home has all basic services and is located in the urban area of San Pedro de Lloc district, some 30 minutes from Pacasmayo province and two hours from La Libertad (Trujillo) department.  This district is noted as being an area where people farm and raise livestock.

Josefina sells vegetables retail.  She has been doing in this business for eight years.  She sells her produce in San Pedro market, in her district.  She has a customer base which she has progressively increased which allows her to make income with which to cover her daily household needs.

Josefina requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy a larger quantity of vegetables of all kinds, so that her customers can buy them and other products (fruit, tubers, mixed veg. etc.)  This will enable her to make more profits and continue helping her son to get ahead in life.  Josefina is a woman with a lot of aspirations and one of them is to expand her business through her efforts and hard work.  She would like to sell more products with the sole aim of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of vegetables and other products to expand her business

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino de 44 Años de edad, convive con Martha de 42 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 04 hijos y juntos viven en una casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja  Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. La labor que realiza Marcelino es labrar la tierra y sembrando café, plátano  y frutos de piña, sobre sus 02 hectáreas de terreno que posee. Aprendió el trabajo del campo en las tierras de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a arar y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia parcela, con sus ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias y ahora trabaja con mucha dedicación. Sabe lo arduo que es éste trabajo es así que han transcurrido 20 años en esta labor, además que cuando es temporada de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros quienes se encargan de limpiar y sacar la mala hierba que crece en sus campos, además de llevar lo cosechado de la chacra hasta su comunidad para luego ser comercializados. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo disfruta el obtener calidad de sus  frutos, que son muy cotizados en el mercado. Menciona que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga. Por lo cual Marcelino solicita el crédito para la  compra de insecticidas y estiércol de animales para combatir las plagas que asechan sus cultivos; en lo futuro comprará más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP sabe que este crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y es  el primero en llegar a las reuniones. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará insecticidas y estiércol de animales.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 44 years old and lives with 42 year-old Martha.  They have four children and live together in their own home which is located in the small community of Vista Alegre Baja, in Kimbiri district.

Marcelino is a farmer who grows coffee, bananas and pineapples on the two hectares of land that he owns.  He learned to farm on his parents' land.  They taught him how to plough the land and he grew up wanting to own his own plot.  He used his savings to achieve his goal and now he works his land with a lot dedication.  He knows how hard his work is and has been working in the business for 20 years.  When it is harvest season, he has the support of his children and day laborers who get rid of the weeds that grow in his fields.  They also transport his harvested crops from his farm to town so that they can be sold.  Marcelino feels very committed to his work because, thanks to his efforts, he grows good quality fruits which are very much sought after in the market.  Marcelino mentions how difficult it is to protect his crops from pests.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy insecticides and animal manure to fight the pests that attack his crops.  In the future, he will buy more land so that he can increase his production.

This is Marcelino's fifth loan from MFP.  He knows that this loan will be very useful to him in making progress in his work.  He is a very cheerful member of his community bank and is always the first to arrive at meetings.  He will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy insecticides and manure.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and manure

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: La señora Rosa tiene la edad de 56 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos todos ya casados e independientes, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Rosa desde hace ocho años se dedica al comercio ,la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el espacio del lugar donde ella tiene su negocio ya que es muy pequeño y no le permite dar una atencion adecuada .Con este  financiamiento quiere comprar, abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros producto para su negocio. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva .
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, together with her husband who buys and sells.  She has three children who are already grown up and live independently.  Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions.  Rosa has been buying and selling for eight years.  Her biggest difficulty is that the space in which she runs her business is very small.

With this loan, Rosa would like to buy groceries, soda, candies and other products for her business.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic give her through their Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soda and candies.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL CRISTO REY

Idina una persona muy cooperativa que tiene muchos años siendo parte de la Alcancia Comunal CRISTO REY, cuyo nombre fue elegido porque tienen mucha fe en Cristo.
Idina mas conocida como Dina, como le dicen sus vecinas y miembros de su grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor, ya sea ambulatoriamente o a pedido de sus amigos, vecinos, clientes, etc, ella aprovecha esta temporada en la cual hace mucho frio para vender su mercaderia de temporada como chompas, casacas.
Idina sueña con tener una tienda propia en un mercado muy concurrido para asi tener mas ingresos para su casa y asi dejar comodidades a sus hijos y consentir a sus nietos
texts.en:
Christ the King Communal Bank

Idina is a very cooperative person who has been a member of the Cristo Rey (Christ the King) communal bank for many years; the name was chosen because they have much faith in Christ.

Idina, better known as Dina, as her friends and group members call her, sells clothes at retail either as a street vendor or to order from friends, neighbors, customers, etc.  She takes advantage of this cold season to sell seasonal merchandise like sweaters and jackets.

Idina dreams with having a store of her own in a very busy market in order to earn more income for her house and provide more comfort for her children and to be able to coddle her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 22, 19 años de edad; la socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de forraje, la socia distribuye el alimento para ganados a diferentes clientes que ella tiene, la socia solía comprar al por mayor forraje de la cervecería llamad sutuchi pero ya no lo hace ahora ella saca de las cosechas de maíz y vende a los clientes que tiene sus ganados, chanchos, cuyes, la socia también tiene chanchos y cuyes que cría y los vende. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar el follaje al por mayor fresco y distribuirlo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar follaje para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank.  She lives in Urubamba district, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 50 years old, single, and has three children aged 25, 22 and 19.  She buys and sells fodder.  She distributes the animal feed to different customers that she has.  She would like to buy fodder called 'sutuchi' wholesale from a brewery but right now she buys corn harvests and sells them to customers for their cattle, pigs and guinea pigs.  She also raises and sells pigs and guinea pigs herself.  She would like this loan to buy fresh fodder wholesale which she will then sell.

The borrower appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy fodder to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es comerciante,  vende tortillas, carne de cerdo, y ahora está comercializando ropa, teniendo el propósito de captar más ingresos que ayude con los gastos de la canasta básica como gastos básicos de agua y luz.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo de profesión jardinero, atraves de Afodenic ha venido logrando estas mejoras con cuatro ciclos siendo para aumentar el inventario de sus ventas como las mejora de su vivienda.
Hoy con este préstamo hará un sumidero para tener inodoro y lograr mejor higiene, ya que no pasan las agua negras por el barrio. Es por tal razón pagara para que le hagan el sumidero, en donde comprara: bloques, hierro, cemento, para hacer el arranque del sumidero, a si como la compra del inodoro.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas and pork, and now she also sells clothes.  She plans to make more income which will help her with her basic household food expenses and also help her cover her water and electricity bills.

María has the support of her husband who is a gardener by profession.  Through Afodenic, she has managed to make improvements.  Over four loan cycles, she has increased her sales inventory and also improved her home.

María will use this loan to build a sewage drain so that she can install a toilet and achieve better hygiene.  This will mean that sewage no longer passes through the neighborhood.  She will pay some people to build her a sewage drain and will buy blocks, iron and cement.  She will also buy a toilet.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as blocks, cement and iron to build a sewage drain so that she can install a toilet and achieve better hygiene

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est née le 11 janvier 1966 au Bénin. Justine est mariée à un gendarme du nom de Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés. Justine vient en aide à son mari grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la famille. Justine à fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Depuis sept  ans, Justine vend des céréales (maïs, sorgho, soja, haricot, etc.). Justine achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Justine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Justine was born January 11, 1966 in Benin. She is married to a gendarme named Joseph. The couple supports three children, all in school. Justine helps her husband thanks to the income she makes from her business, paying jointly with him the various family expenses.

Justine attended school until high school. For seven years she has been selling cereals (corn, sorghum, soy, beans, etc.). She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the fourth time that Justine has sought a loan through ALIDé. The loan will serve to raise the level of her business activity in order to better meet the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Marquise

texts.fr: Marquise est née le 10 décembre 1975. Marquise est mariée à Pierre un chauffeur et à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Marquise vit seule avec ses enfants et assure les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de dix ans que, Marquise mène comme activité la vente de potasse et du bissap au Bénin. Marquise s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à se prendre en charge et à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Marquise sollicite pour une première fois l’aide financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Marquise was born on December 10, 1975. She is married to Pierre, a driver, and has three children, who are all in school and in her care. She lives alone with her children and ensures that the various household expenses are covered. For nearly ten years, she has been running a business selling potash and hibiscus in Benin. She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. This business generates revenues that help her to support herself and to cover family expenses. With regard to boosting her business further and increasing her profit, Marquise is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus leaves and some potash

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivonne es negociante en  venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumería con más de dos años en este negocio, el cual inicio con ventas de muebles teniendo la facilidad que le dieran al crédito, ya que su esposo trabajaba en carpintería, lo que daba a mejor precio a sus clientes.
Ha logrado equilibrar sus ventas, gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado en varios ciclos en donde ha invertido en ropa, cosmético el cual vende por catálogos, dando en créditos de quincena a sus clientes.
Con esta nueva inversión, lograra la compra de: dos docenas de pantalón de niños, camisetas, de dama, perfume y cosmético para aumentar las ventas y cumplir con la demanda de los pedidos.
texts.en:
Ivonne sells clothes, cosmetics and perfumes.  She has been in this business for two years.  She started out selling furniture.  She was able to have her products on credit because her husband was a carpenter.  This meant that she was able to provide her customers with better prices.

Ivonne has managed to balance her sales thanks to the loans that Afodenic have given her over several loan cycles.  She has invested her loans in clothes and cosmetics which she sells through catalogs.  She gives her customers two weeks to pay for their products.

Ivonne will use this new loan to buy two dozen pairs of children's pants, ladies' t-shirts, perfume and cosmetics in order to increase her sales and fill her orders.

loans.use: to invest in men's and women's clothes and cosmetics so that she can improve her sales

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier, tiene la edad de 43 años habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , es soltero , tiene dos hijos a sus cargo , los cuales estudian su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia se le pasa el agua , don Javier desde hace seis años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación que se le presenta en el cultivo de limones agrios son las plagas que invaden la planta ya que esta carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir los insectos . Don Javier necesita que se le apoye para poder realizar la compra de insumos  y aplicar al plantillo obteniendo una mejor calidad y sobre todo jugo de la fruta, para que esta sea bien pagada en el mercado.
texts.en:
Javier is 43 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  He is single and has two children in his care.  His children are in elementary school.  Javier's plan for the future is to improve the roof of his home since the water gets in during rainy periods.

Javier has been farming for six years.  The biggest problem he faces in growing his sour lemons are the pests which attack his plants since he lacks the fertilizers and supplies he needs to fight them.  Javier needs support so that he can buy supplies and apply them to his plants so that he obtains a better quality juice from his fruit.  This will enable him to charge more money for his produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 40 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, corn husks, fresh fish, firewood and more

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama has been selling men's and women's underwear at Kwaprow a village in Abura for some time now. 

Ama has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in the payment of their utility bills. 

Her loan when received will be used to buy underwear for resale.  She has the plan of building a shop and reinvesting back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Agustin Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Agustín,  tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en  la comunidad las conchitas , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras , ellos tienen tres hijos ya casados e independientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar la vivienda ya que está muy deteriorado la parte donde es madera , don Agustín desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación que se le presenta es animales como vacas que ingresan a la parcela y se comen la piña , ya que en un futuro quiere poner cercas de alambre para evitar el ingresos de animales vecinos . Don Agustín necesita un financiamiento para la comprar de fertilizantes e insumos  ya que la piña esta de un mal color y la fruta un tamaño no adecuado a su edad. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva .
texts.en:
Agustín is 46 years old and lives in Las Conchitas community together with his wife who sells fruit and vegetables.  They have three children who are already married and live independently.  Agustín's plan for the future is to improve his home since the part which is made from wood is in a bad state of repair.

Agustín has been farming for 20 years.  The biggest challenge he faces in his work is animals such as cows coming onto his land and eating his pineapples.  In the future, he would like to put up wire fences to stop neighboring animals from straying onto his land.  Agustín needs a loan to buy fertilizers and farming supplies because his pineapples are not a good color and the fruit is not a good size for its age.  He is grateful for the support provided by Afodenic through their Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old man who takes care of his wife and the household expense. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.
Mahmoud has a small electronic engine repair workshop in the city, which helps him have more income besides his small salary. Mahmoud took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the spare pieces needed to repair engines. Mahmoud appears in the picture above in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase electronic engine spare parts

loans.name: Ernesto Rufino

texts.es: El señor Ernesto B. , tiene la edad de 53 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen un hijo a su cargo , actualmente estudiante , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ernesto labora en una empresa privada desde hace varios años , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder tener el capital suficiente para ir  comprando materiales de construcción de una sola vez , con el primer financiamiento logro hacer gran parte del baño de la vivienda y ahora este segundo financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de una puerta , cerámica , cemento y otros materiales para terminar la obra .
texts.en:
Ernesto B., 53, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife who works and helps him with household expenses.  They have a son in their care who is currently a student.  His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions.

Ernesto has worked for a private firm for several years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having sufficient capital to buy all the building materials at one time.  

With his first loan he was able to complete most of the bathroom in his house and now needs this second loan to buy a door, tile, cement and other materials to finish the project

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Shek Ahmed

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shek. He is married, and has 2 children ages 25 and 20 years old. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are relatives of his wife. 

Shek owns a refrigerator spare parts business. He began his business because he wants to gain more income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about 300,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional compressors for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL.

In the future, Shek plans to build his family a dwelling house and add to his business revenue. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more freezer compressors for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is a peddler in slippers, shoes and sandles at Kwaprow, near Abura, in Cape Coast. Akosua has been through junior high school. She is married to a driver and together they take care of their four children. Akosua has been in this business for 5 years. She helps in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers and shoes for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and shoes for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ekua cooks food such as fufu with goat soup, banku with okra and other types of soups at Kwaprow, which she has done for 4 years. Ekua pays the rent as a way of supporting her husband. She wishes to expand her cooking business, so a loan will help her buy more food items to cook for sale. She has plans of reinvesting the additional profit into selling of soft drinks.

In this photograph Ekua can be seen peeling the cassava to be boiled for the fufu.

loans.use: to buy more food items to cook for sale

loans.name: Tala't

texts.en: Tala't is a 32-year-old man who is married and a father of a girl and four boys. He has a clothing store and he is planning to improve his work, as he has a large family, Tala't wants to buy a larger amount of summer clothes to increase the store's sales, so he took out a loan from FATEN. Tala't, who has a good reputation and manners, is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To pay for summer clothes to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba, who has been educated up to the junior high level, is married to a cleaner and has two children. Aba sells tubers of cassava and bags of charcoal in Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast, using her income to support her children's education. Aba says the loan from Kiva will help her to buy more bags of charcoal for distribution. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for distribution.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es: La señora Ana, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen una hija a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de  vida  y darle un mejor bienestar a su pequeña hija, doña Ana desde hace dos años labora como empleada domestica en una casa privada, lo cual su salario no le permite comprar de una sola vez los materiales de construcción y poder realizar las paredes intermedias de la vivienda , con el préstamo va a comprar  playcem, clavos , cuartones , regla , entre otros materiales .
texts.en: Señora Ana lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband.  He works for a private company to earn money to help with the household expenses.  Since they have a daughter to take care of, their family plans are to improve their living conditions and give their young daughter an improved well-being.  For the last two years, doña Ana has worked as a maid in a private home.  Her salary is insufficient for her to purchase the building materials all at once to be able to build the interior walls for her dwelling.  With the loan, she will purchase cement board, nails, wood beams, a straight edge and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama, who is married to a sanitary officer and has four children, sells cooked rice which is normally served with tomato sauce, fried fish, meat and macaroni in Kwaprow, a village in Cape Coast. Ama has been selling cooked rice for three years, helping support her husband to take care of the home.

Her loan will be used to buy rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a food joint. In the photo, Ana is seen frying some of the fish she would be using to serve with the rice.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: For the past four years Adisa has been selling sweet potatoes. Demand for it has increased and therefore she needs a loan to enable her buy sacks of sweet potatoes for resale. The income realized from her sales would be invested in her children's education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a cleaner.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace cooks rice for sale at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. Grace has been selling rice for four years and wants to increase her sales, as sometimes the food gets finished too quickly. She needs a loan to buy more bags of rice and ingredients to cook food for sale. Her profit will be reinvested back into her business. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a timber contractor.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and ingredients to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María de 47 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Esta casada y su conyugue es maestro albañil tienen hijos mayores de edad. Tiene un puesto de comida.

Comenzó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás abriendo en su casa vendiendo comida. Labora diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos . Le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia ya que por sus sector esta peligroso. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar sillas mesas varia mercadería para su negocio y así e incrementar su capital para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Y tener una vida mas saludable con sus familia.
texts.en:
María, 47, lives in La Primavera de Duran (an outlying urban area that originally was irregular with several hills, streams and lagoons that still remain as evidence of ecology in erosion.)  She is married and her spouse is a Master Bricklayer.  They have adult children.  She has a food stand.

She started her activity some time ago opening a food stand at home.  She works daily with help from her children.  Her business is affected by the delinquency because her neighborhood is dangerous.  

With help from the loan she wants to buy tables, chairs and various merchandise to increase her capital and be able to finish building her house and have a more healthful life with her family.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and various merchandise.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells multiple items such as the local dish, kenkey, and fish, and bags of charcoal. She is divorced but currently takes care of six dependants. Ekua has been selling kenkey and fish and charcaol for five years. Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcaol for resale. She anticipates building a cover for the charcoal with the new profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcaol for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to erect a wall in the back yard.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 51 years old and the father of three daughters and four sons. Mahmoud, who is photographed in FATEN's branch in Jabalia Refugee camp, is an employee with a decent salary.

Mahmoud took out a loan from FATEN to replace the 20-year-old house furniture that is not good for a big family like his any more.

loans.use: to replace the old house furniture

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has three children. She has sold food such as tomatoes, rice, okra, garden eggs, and oil for 6 years. Her husband is a driver. Ama uses her income to help provide the basic needs of her home. A loan will go a long way to help her purchase additional oil, okra, and tomatoes for sale. With the new profits, Ama plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional oil, okra, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells the local dish, kenkey, and serves it with okra sauce at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to store and to produce kenkey for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a kiosk for the sale of the food.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to store and to produce kenkey for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells cosmetics at Kwaprow a village in Abura. She is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for the general well-being of the home.  

Esi has been selling cosmetics for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more other cosmetics to bring variety into her sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more other cosmetics to bring variety into her sales.

loans.name: Esi Atta

texts.en:
Esi is a widow taking care of three children. Esi sells cooked food and food-wear at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast, which she has done for four years. Esi uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her children. 

She will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene  43  años  y es madre de 02  hijos,  una mujer y un varón ambos estudian en el nivel secundario.

Decide  iniciar su negocio de venta de refrigerios hace 20 años, su capital inicial fue de S/ 100.00  nuevos soles, sus principales consumidores son clientes que acuden al taller de su esposo y transeúntes.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos preparados como: humitas,  tamales, juanes (alimentos fríos a base de maíz, arroz, carne) , queques, galletas, paquetes de gaseosa de diferentes sabores y tamaños, agua mineral con gas y sin gas.  Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de  frutas de la región para la preparación de jugos y refrescos para acompañar el refrigerio. 

Rosa Elena siempre está contenta y su sueño es contar, mas adelante, con una tienda de repuestos para vehículos  muy grande. Está agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena belongs to the “El Abiseo” communal bank in Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department.  She’s married and is 43 years old.  She is the mother of two children, a girl and a boy; both go to secondary school.

She decided to start her refreshments business twenty years ago.  Her initial capital was 100 new soles and her main consumers are customers that come to her husband’s shop and passersby.

She will use this 3000 new sol loan to buy prepared products like: humitas, tamales, juanes (cold food based on corn, rice and meat), cakes, cookies, various flavors and sizes of soft drinks, sparkling and flat mineral water.  Part of the money will be used to buy regional fruit to prepare juice and beverages to accompany the food.

Rosa Elena is always happy and her dream is to have, later on, a very large vehicle spare parts store.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help it provides towards her dream becoming a reality.

loans.use: to buy prepared food like: humitas, tamales, juanes (cold food based on corn, rice and meat), cakes, cookies, soft drinks and water.

loans.name: Isabel Jacqueline

texts.es:
Isabel de 34 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Esta casada  y su conyugue trabaja en barco atunero regresa cada tres meses. Tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal. Ella se dedica a venta de cosméticos y ropa por catálogos.

Comenzó su actividad hace unos años, cuando era soltera vendía comesticos ahora adicionalmente vende ropa y producto de papelería. Labora diariamente recorriendo por todo el sector promocionando sus productos a sus amistades y conocidos lo deja a créditos. Su ventas son de perfumes, cremas, ropas. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere el arreglo de local comprando cemento, arena, pinturas para poner sus productos a la venta y captar a su clientela y asi mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro darle lo mejor a sus hijas en salud y estudios.
texts.en:
34-year-old Isabel lives in the canton called Playas, one of the touristic places in Ecuador with a wide-range of seafood. She is married and her spouse works on a tuna boat; he comes back every three months.  They have two children in public school. She sells cosmetics and clothes from catalogs. 

She started her business a few years ago. When she was single, she sold cosmetics, and now she also sells clothes and stationary-store products.  She works every day going all over the area promoting her products. She lets her friends and acquaintances pay on credit. She sells perfumes, creams and clothes. With the help of this loan she wants to fix up her business local buying cement, sand and paint to sell her products and capture her customers and in this way improve her income. In the future she will give her daughters the best in health and education.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paint to fix up her business local.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has two children. She sells cooking utensils and cloth at Kwaprow. Ekua uses her income see to the well-being of her home. She will use the loan to purchase cloth for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for resale.

loans.name: Las Camelias Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Camelias, inicia su ciclo número 3 con 11 socios, las cuales tienen diferentes negocios como alquiler D. gras sintético, venta D. chicha, venta D. abarrotes, animales menores, venta D. ropa.
Julia, es la Presidenta para este ciclo en el Banco Comunal, tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica la venta D. ropa por pedidos. Ingresó a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. un amiga, le gusta por la facilidad en los créditos, las capacitaciones que recibe por parte D. su promotora y sobre todo porque pueD. ahorrar. Sus ahorros lo invirtió en surtir sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Las Camelias Communal Bank started its third cycle with 11 members who have different businesses such as the rental of synthetic grass, chicha (a Latin American drink, typically alcoholic, maD. of fermented maize) sales, small animals, and clothing sales. 
Julia is the President for this cycle of the Communal Bank.  She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children.  She sells clothing to order. She joined FINCA Peru through the invitation of a friend.  She likes it because of the ease of loans, the trainings she receives from the loan officer and above all because she can save. She invests her savings in stocking her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for the season.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Rosa Aurora pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 68 años y tiene tres hijos; todos ya cuentan con familia propia.

Inicia su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad  con un capital de S/500.00 nuevos soles; haciéndose rápidamente de muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención,  lo que le permitió ampliar su negocio.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  surtirá y comprará  productos como:  cajas de jabones, cajas de leche, sacos de azúcar y arroz, paquetes de fideos, jabas de huevos así como insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Rosa Aurora  es una mujer emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un Mini Market.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella, a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora is a member of the Comunal Bank “El Abiseo” in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is married, 68 years old and has three children, all of whom have their own families already.

She started her small grocery and basic goods business with 500 new Peruvian soles of capital. Quickly building a good client base due to her charisma and good customer service enabled her to expand her business.

With this loan of 2000 new Peruvian soles she will stock up buying products such as: boxes of soap, milk cartons, sacs of sugar and rice, packets of noodles, beans and eggs as well as personal hygiene and household cleaning supplies, soda packets and other products to give good customer service.

Rosa Aurora is an entrepreneurial woman. Her dream is to have a Mini Market.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy soaps, milk, sugar and rice, noodle packets, beans, eggs etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ama sells cosmetics and kenkey, a local dish of fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. Kenkey is normally served with fried fish and hot pepper sauce. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase maize, fresh fish to fry, tomatoes,and peppers. With the profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to build a store. She is seen in this picture taking out a kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase maize, fresh fish, tomatoes, and peppers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single parent. Mercy sells hair clips, lipstick, etc, by moving from one area to another in a village called Kwaprow. She has been selling these items for three years and wants to increase her sales.  She is requesting a loan to buy hair clips, lipstick, etc. to resell. She hopes to build a shop with the profits from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase hair clips, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. El se dedica al comercio ambulante vendiendo una variedad de productos, sin embargo lo que más vende durante los meses de marzo a septiembre son pescados ahumados, específicamente jurel, sierra y salmón. La compra de estos productos la realiza a través de encomienda a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Roberto vende sus productos los días lunes, miércoles y viernes, durante las mañanas y los fines de semana, instala su negocio en una feria libre para vender sus productos. Roberto se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 16 años y el negocio de venta de pescados lo heredó de su padre desde hace 8 años. Él aprovecha todas las temporadas festivas para explotar las fechas del comercio y compra artículos de acuerdo a cada temporada.
Con el préstamo comprará pescados ahumados por encomienda.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener una fábrica ahumadora para realizar el proceso de ahumado de los pescados él mismo, ya que Roberto entiende y puede llevar a cabo todo el proceso. Junto con esto anhela comprar una camioneta para el traslado de su mercadería. Pero le falta el capital para concretar estos proyectos.
Roberto vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos, sus sueños y motivaciones son poder brindarle a su familia un mejor confort de vida, a través de la prosperidad de su negocio. 
Él está agradecido del crédito y la confianza depositada por Fondo Esperanza para emprender en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy amenas y comparte con las demás integrantes del banco comunal, por lo cual ha generado vínculos de amistad. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Roberto is part of the “Belén” communal bank in the city of Valparaíso. He is a traveling merchant selling a variety of products. However, what he sells the most during the months from March to September is smoked fish, specifically horse mackerel, sierra and salmon. He orders these products from the city of Talcahuano. Robert sells his products on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in the mornings, and on the weekend, he sets up his business in a market to sell his products. Robert has been doing this for 16 years and the fish-selling business he inherited from his father 8 years ago.  He takes advantage of all the holiday periods to exploit the business dates and to buy articles in accordance with each season.
With the loan, he will order smoked fish by parcel.

His goals in his business are to have a smoking factory in order to be able to undertake the fish-smoking process himself, since Robert understands and can complete the entire process. Along with this desire he wishes to buy a truck to transport his merchandise. However, he lacks the capital to make these projects reality. Roberto lives together with his wife and three children. His dreams and motivation are to be able to provide his family with a more comfortable life through the prosperity of his business.

He is grateful for the loan and the confidence of the Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) to undertake his business. Regarding the meetings, they are very enjoyable and he shares the communal bank with the other members, which has generated bonds of friendship.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the countries headquarters of legislative power. It is the nation’s number one port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like for example the house of Pablo Neruda, a Nobel Prize winning poet.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish by parcel.

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Naana buys fresh fish from the market and comes home to fry them for resale to people living in the village of Kwaprow, near Abura. 

Naana uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry for resales.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 29-year-old working woman who is married to Sami. Sami appears in the picture instead of her, as she is a conservative woman. Iman and Sami have two daughters (Safya and Wala) and three sons (Ahmad, Ibrahem and Wafa).  Iman needs electric  appliances for her kitchen like an oven and a refrigerator, so she took out the loan from FATEN.

loans.use: to pay for electric appliances

loans.name: Marly Rosalini

texts.es:
La Sra. Marly Rosalini pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 26 años y tiene 02 hijos  ambos estudian  en el nivel  primaria.

Desde muy  joven  le gustaba los negocios por lo que  decide  vender  abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, invirtiendo un pequeño capital de S/. 500.00.  En la actualidad cuenta con muy buena clientela gracias a la buena atención que ella brinda. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00,  surtirá y comprará  productos para su negocio como:  aceite en caja, y  leche en cajas, paquetes de fideos, javas de huevos, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para atender las necesidades y mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Marly Rosalini es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un Súper Mercadobien implementado. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marly Rosalini is a member of the "Virgen de las Mercedes” community bank which is located in Juanjui district, in Mariscal Cáceres province, in San Martín department.  She is 26 years old, single, and has two children who are both in elementary school.

Marly liked businesses from a very young age and so decided to start selling groceries and essential household products.
