She invested a small amount of capital (500 Peruvian soles) in starting up her business.  She currently has a very good customer base owing to the good customer service that she provides.

Marly will use this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to stock her business, buying products such as oil, milk, packets of noodles, trays of eggs, soda and other products so that she can meet her customers' needs and keep them happy.

Marly Rosalini is a tenacious woman whose dream is to own a well-stocked supermarket.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself, by providing opportunities to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, noodles, trays of eggs, soda and other products

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells kenkey (kenkey is made from steamed, fermented corn dough) at Kwaprow, near Abura, in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security personnel. 

Esi needs money to be able to produce the kenkey in large quantities. A loan from Kiva will help her to achieve her goal. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of corn. Her future plan is to be able to give a proper education to her children. The pan in front of her is half-cooked corn dough to be rubbed and boiled for sale.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of corn.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells kenkey and porridge at Kwaprow, near Abura, in Cape Coast. Demands for the porridge have increased and so, Akjoa needs a loan to buy millet, sugar, pepper and other items to make millet porridge for sale. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa is responsible for helping her husband pay the bills of the home. In this picture she is scooping some of the porridge out with a ladle.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, pepper and other items to make millet porridge for sale.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
El Sr. Sebastián es comerciante hace más de 6 años. El mismo realiza y vende chipas en el Mercado Municipal de Coronel Oviedo, además de eso tiene un pequeño kiosko también en su domicilio donde atiende su señora. 
Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela en el mercado porque vende café y cocido bien caliente con la chipa.
Nos comenta que el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la adquisición de materia prima como ser maíz, leche, queso, huevo, etc. y lo administrará correctamente para devolverlo en tiempo y forma para seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Sebastián has been a merchant for over 6 years.  He himself makes and sells “chipás” (bread rolls made from tapioca flour stuffed with cheese) in the Coronel Oviedo Municipal Market.  He also has a small kiosk at home that his wife tends to.  He mentions that he has a very good clientele in the market because he also sells coffee and piping hot herbal tea with the chipas.

He tells us that the requested loan will be used to buy raw materials like corn, milk, cheese, eggs, etc. and that he will manage it correctly to repay in a timely manner and continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk, eggs, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. As a supportive wife, Ekua's income helps to take care of the home. Ekua wants to increase her income. She needs to increase the quantity of smoked fish released to her customers so she can make more money. A loan will help Ekua purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to increase her income. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke to increase her income.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es vecina  de Golfo Dulce de Puntarenas. Ella es una líder  con .  Gran deseo de superación.  
Su familia se dedico a la agricultura por muchos años. Y ahora  ella tiene el deseo de iniciar con su propio proyecto con cerdos. Es por eso que ella desea un préstamo de 300 000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de lechones  y material de construcción para empezar a desarrollar  su proyecto Familiar.
Ella desea involucrar a toda su familia en el negocio, y espera que sea todo un éxito.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Golfo Dulce, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Golfo Dulce, Puntarenas.  She is a leader with a great desire for self improvement.

Her family was in farming for many years.  She now wants to start her own project with pigs.  Because of this she wants a 300,000 colones loan to buy piglets and building materials to start carrying out her family project.  She wants to involve her entire family in the business and hopes that it will be a complete success.

She is a member of the Golfo Dulce Communal Bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy pigs and building materials.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells fried pies at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. She is a widow and has four children. Her loan will be used to buy oil, flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients to prepare the pies for sale.  She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients

loans.name: Amanda Andrea

texts.es:
La cliente Amanda es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Virgen de Fátima, tiene 24 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo. Lucha día a día para solventar los gastos de la familia.
Tiene una carnicería en el Mercado Municipal de San Estanislao, además vende empanadas, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
La señora empezó con el crédito solidario o créditos de comités, ahora ya accede con el crédito individual, por el hecho de que ya mejoró su ingreso.
La cliente con este crédito adquirirá más capital para la venta (carnes en sus variedades) y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The client is Amanda.  She is from the city of San Estanislao’s Virgen de Fátima neighborhood.  She’s 24 years old, separated and has a son.  She struggles daily to meet her family’s expenses.

She has a butcher shop in the San Estanislao Municipal Market.  She also sells turnovers.  She has a well established clientele as well as good personal and business references.

She started out with communal loans but is now applying for an individual one because her income has improved.  She will use this loan to acquire more working capital (assorted meats) in order to earn better income.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, okra and other ingredients

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has four children. She has been educated through junior high school. Her husband is a security man. Aba sells smoked fish at Kwaprow, near Abura in Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills, as a way of assisting her husband. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business.

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
El señor Narcizo está casado con la señora Basilisa, con quien tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad.
Narcizo desde hace 30 años se dedica a la albañilería especialista en colocación de piedras.
Hoy en día ya tiene una buenísima cantidad de clientela formada y dos de sus hijos también trabajan con él para poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes con sus trabajos.
Con este crédito solicitado pretende comprar más piedras para que no pierda algún pedido de materiales debido a la demanda que recibe.
texts.en:
Narcizo is married to Basilia; they have five adult children.  Narcizo has been a bricklayer, specializing in stone installation, for 30 years.

Today he has quite a large established clientele and two of his sons work with him to meet all of his customer demand.

Due to the high demand he receives he intends to use the requested loan to buy more stones so that he won’t lose any possible orders he might get.

loans.use: to buy stone.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos tienen dos hijos a su cargo actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña margarita labora como comerciante de nacatamales, fritanga , comida rápida en su casa de habitación , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder contar con un capital suficiente para invertir y hacer mas comida para obtener más ingresos . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondos Kiva por que sin ellos no podría  obtener un financiamiento.
texts.en:
Margarita, 34, lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband who works as a bricklayer to help her meet household expenses since they have two children in their care currently who are in school.

Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions.  Margarita works as a nacatamal (Nicaraguan style tamales) and fast food vendor at home.  The greatest difficulty she faces is not having sufficient capital to invest to be able to make more meals and obtain more income.

She is grateful for the support Afodenic provide through Kiva funds because, without them, she would be unable to obtain financing.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and others.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells secondhand clothes and slippers as a peddler at Kwaprow, near Abura. She is married and has a son, who is standing behind her in this photo. Her husband is a messenger. 

Felicia wants to expand her business and needs a loan to purchase more slippers to revive a clothing business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and to revive a clothing business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina in this photo is sitting close to a pan of body creams, lotions, hair creams and baby creams. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a saw mill operator. She has received junior high level of education. 

Faustina wants a loan so she can supply other types of creams requested by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase other types of creams requested by her customers.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr Alfredo es casado, tiene un taller de reparación  en km 7 Ciudad Nueva, el trabajo del mismo es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposa y toda la familia  están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. 
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresario exitoso y en constante progreso. Es muy cumplidor con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo, y ello es la razón de la necesidad del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de herramientas para la reparación de sus equipos de electrónica.
texts.en:
Alfredo is married and has a repair shop at Km 7, Ciudad Nueva.  His work is gratifying because he has a large, established, regular clientele; income is quite satisfactory. With help from his wife and all of the family they are getting ahead with will, work and dedication.

Today, he has become a successful micro businessman who is constantly making progress.  He is very reliable with respect to his commitments so deserves support to continue growing and this is the reason for the loan: to buy tools to repair electronic equipment.

loans.use: to buy tools for electronics repairs.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba makes porridge from millet to sell at Kwaprow, near Abura in Cape Coast. The porridge is normally served in the early hours of the morning. She is married and has four children. As a supportive wife, she helps to pay the utility bills of the home. Her loan will be used to buy millet, sugar, milk, salt, pepper and other ingredients which will enable her make the porridge for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, milk, salt, pepper and other ingredients, which will enable her make the porridge for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the above mentioned items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
El  Sr. Julio es soltero, tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con mucho esfuerzo, el cual es su elemento de trabajo en el microcentro como trasporte alternativo. Con la ayuda de su madre y todos sus hermanos están saliendo adelante.
Hoy día el es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesto en sus compromisos por lo que consideramos que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta forma ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes con mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Julio is single.  He owns a car that he bought with much effort that’s his work tool; he provides an alternate mode of transportation at the Microcentro (shopping center).  With help from his mother and all his siblings they are getting ahead.

Today, he is a successful micro businessman with a numerous, regular clientele thanks to his kindness.

He has demonstrated being a responsible, honest person with respect to his commitments so we feel that we should provide him with all the support necessary.

He is asking for the loan to service his car in order to offer a better, more comfortable and secure, service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAMBENG a été créé le 04 Mai 2010. Les membres habitent le même village. L'activité principale est la vente de bétail. 

Méta debout derrière à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle achète des moutons qu'elle revend après embouche sur une période de 04 à 05 mois. 

Ce crédit lui permettra à acheter 03 moutons à emboucher.

Avec les recettes, elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale (nourriture et santé)
texts.en:
The solidarity group KAMBENG was created on May 4, 2010. The members live in the same village. The principal business is selling livestock. 

Méta (in the back on the far right, raising her hand) is the leader of the group. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She buys sheep then resells them after fattening them for four to five months. 

This loan will allow her to buy three sheep for fattening. With her revenue, she will help her husband with famiL. expenses (food and health).

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten for 4 to 5 months.

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familia, inicia su ciclo numero 6, con 11 socias. Las cuales tienen diversos negocios como la venta D. pescado, confección D. prendas D. vestir, comercialización D. leche, venta D. queso, venta D. animales menores, bordados D. artesanías.
Tersa, es la Presidenta para éste ciclo, tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 33,31,16,13 años D. edad. Tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general en su casa. Ingreso a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. su hija. Le gusta por la facilidad D. los préstamos para trabajar y pueD. ahorrar.
texts.en:
The “Familia” communal bank starts its cycle #6 with 11 members who have various businesses like: fish sales, dressmaking, milk sales, cheese sales, sale of small farm animals and embroidered crafts.

Tersa, 48, is the President for this cycle.  She’s married and has four children who are 33, 31, 16 and 13 years of age.  She has a grocery store at home.

She joined FINCA Perú thanks to an invitation from her daughter. She likes it because the loans are easy to negotiate and she can save

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Belene Ndendy Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31/05/2007.Il est composé de 18 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata debout à l'extrême droite ,est veuve et vit avec 07 enfants dont 02 sont ses enfants.Elle est âgée de 40 ans.

Elle est vendeuse de céréales et d'arachides.Elle s'approvisionne dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans le marché central de sa ville. Elle a une expérience de 03 ans environs dans ce domaine d'activité.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter des céréales et des arachides.

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa progéniture tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en: This solidarity group has been created on May 31, 2007. It is composed of 18 women living in the same neighborhood. Their main business activity is vending. Mrs. Aminata, standing to the far right [in the photo], is a widow, and lives with seven children, of whom two are her own. She is 40 years old. She sells cereals and peanuts [ground nuts]. She stocks up at different weekly markets in order to resell her goods at the central market of her town. She has three years of experience in this area. This loan will allow her to buy cereals and peanuts. Her goal is to be able to provide for her children while continuing to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy cereals (millet and corn) and peanuts [ground nuts]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue and other products

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria Dolores es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Cerrito, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Pastor Severiano de 67 años de edad. Actualmente tienen 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad, trabajan independientemente.
Posee una despensa, también trabaja como vendedora ambulante, artículos de mercerías y bijouteries, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora.
La cliente con este crédito pretende comprar mercaderías que va desde ropas hasta artículos para el hogar y alimentos imperecederos para tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
María Dolores is from the city of San Estanislao’s Cerrito neighborhood.  She’s 47 years old, married to Pastor Severiano, 67.  They have four adult children who work independently.

She has a store and also works as a street vendor selling notions and costume jewelry.  She has an established clientele, good income and good personal and business references; she is a very hard working woman.

She intends to use this loan to buy assorted notions that range from clothing to article for the home and also perishable food items to have better income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell as well as to buy rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su casa. Pero antes de comenzar a vender la ropa ella era empleada domestica en una casa pero decidió salir de ese trabajo porque le pagaban muy poco y necesitaba pasar tiempo con sus hijos y darle una mejor vida.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus hijos ya que esta separa de su esposo hace 10 años y ella ha mantenido el hogar. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas.
texts.en:
María, 55, is a hard working woman who sells clothes at home.  However, before starting to sell clothes she was a domestic employee at a house but decided to leave that job because she was paid very little and she needed to be able to spend time with her children and give them a better life.

She has many goals for her business and wants to continue working to provide her children with a good life since she’s been separated from her husband for the last 10 years and she’s supported the household.  Because of this, she wants the loan to buy clothes like pants, shirts and blouses.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mayllory

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayllory pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de  Mariscal, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 49  años  tiene tres  hijos dos de ellos ya cuentan con familia propia, el menor de 10 años cursa estudios primarios. 

Por iniciativa propia se inició con un capital de S/ 300.00 nuevos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, negocio que le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00, comprará vestidos, blusas, pantalones, polos, faldas, adicional a esto invertirá en la compra de espejos pequeños, aceitillos, ganchos, carmines y otros productos  para brindar una  buena atención a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Mayllory   es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta,  su sueño es tener una boutique.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayllory belongs to the “El Abiseo” Communal Bank, located in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal, department of San Martín. She is married, 49 years old and has three children two of which have their own families, the youngest is 10 years old and is in primary school.

Through her own initiative, Mayllory began working with a capital of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, she sells clothes for women, men and children. The business gives her good profits and a lot of satisfaction.

With a loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos she will buy dresses, blouses, pants, polo shirts, and skirts, as well as small mirrors, oils, hangers, lipstick and other products to give good service to her customers.

Mrs. Mayllory is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman; her dream is to have a boutique. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy dresses, blouses, pants, polo shirts, and skirts.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La cliente es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado que acopia del río Paraguay, posee embarcación propia en la cual realiza su trabajo de acopio, sus productos lo comercializa en la ciudad de Pilar y también vende a compradores de otras ciudades.
La Sra. Carmen está acompañada, tiene dos hijas ya todas adultas y su compañero trabaja conjuntamente con ella en la pesca.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias  comerciales,  buen movimiento en su negocio, una micro empresa muy reconocida en la ciudad de Pilar. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de elementos para la pesca y destinar luego lo obtenido a la comercialización. Se compromete a cumplir en tiempo y forma con la responsabilidad asumida con la empresa.
texts.en:
The member is a salesperson; she buys and sells fish that she collects from the Paraguay River. She has her own craft where she does her fishing; her products are then sold in the city of Pilar and other buyers in different cities.

Mrs. Carmen has a partner, and has two adult daughters. Her significant other works with her in the fishing industry.

Mrs. Carmen is a very hardworking woman with good business references as she has a good return rate on her business, it is also a well-known microenterprise in the city of Pilar. She needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and use what she collects to sell. Mrs. Carmen is committed to meet her payments on time as well as being responsible with the loan organization.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment and tools for fishing like a fishing rod, bait, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  computer accessories to increase sales.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. María  Cecilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y tiene  04 hijos, tres ya cuentan con familia propia solo el menor de 17 años está en el nivel superior.

Ante la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos inicia su negocio con la venta de cosméticos  que muchas veces los vendía al crédito, hecho que causó la pérdida de gran parte de su capital y  contando tan solo con  un capital de S/. 500.00 decide vender mercería, pasamanería, zapatos(productos de uso personal) haciéndose rápidamente de muy buena clientela por su carisma y buena atención.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.  2000.00, comprará: espejos, peines, linternas, gel para cabello, jaboneras y zapatos, todo ello en docenas para así surtir su mercadería y dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

María Cecilia es una mujer emprendedora, su sueño es contar con una tienda propia y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Cecilia belongs to the “Virgen de las Mercedes” Communal Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is single, 42 years old and has 4 children, three of which have their own family, the youngest is 17 years old and is attending high school.

Due to necessity she decided to earn her own income and began her own business selling makeup that many times she sold on credit, which caused her great losses to her capital as she only had S/. 500.00. Mrs. María Cecilia decided to sell haberdashery, embroidery, shoes (products for personal use) especially having quickly made a good customer base with her charisma and good customer service.

With a loan of S/. 2000.00 she will buy mirrors, combs, flashlights, hair gel, soap, and shoes, all of it in dozens to stock her merchandize and provide her customers with what they need.

María Cecilia is an enterprising woman; her dream is to have her own store and is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women liker achieve their dreams.

loans.use: buy mirrors, combs, flashlights, hair gel, soap, and shoes.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
El Sr. Sebastián es casado, tiene 66 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Obrero, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familar y movilidad propia (moto).
El se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad, gaseosas y otras mercaderías. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y su local es muy reconocido en la vecindad.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima para mejorar sus ingresos con el aumento del negocio, como gaseosas, golosinas, artículos de limpieza para el hogar, detergentes, desodorantes de ambiente, lavandina, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Sebastián is married, 66 years old and lives in the city of Pilar in the Barrio Obrero area. He has his own home and has all of the basics to develop his work in his own home and transport (a motorcycle).

Mr. Sebastián sells basic household goods including refreshments and other merchandize. He has worked in this field for some 4 years, he has the infrastructure necessary to do his work and his stall is very well known in the neighborhood.

Mr. Sebastián needs the loan to buy raw materials and refreshments, candy, household cleaning products, detergents, and air fresheners to improve his earnings by increasing his business sales.

loans.use: buy basic household goods like refreshments, household cleaning products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Higinio Anastasio

texts.es:
Don Higinio tiene 58 años, está casado con la Sra. Lina. Ella es ama de casa, mientras que don Higinio es taxista, ademas de ser Jubilado del IPS (Instituto de Previsión Social).
Su actividad de taxista la inició en el año 2006 en la parada ubicada sobre la Ruta Mcal Estigarribia c/ Ingavi.
Hoy, cuenta con otro vehículo, ademas del taxi.  Necesita de este crédito para poder poner en condiciones el segundo vehículo y asi  emplearlo también como taxi.
Su anhelo es poder concluir la construcción de su modesta vivienda asi como también poder cubrir el costo de los estudios de su hijo menor el mayor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
Mr. Higinio is 58 years old, and is married to Mrs. Lina. She is a housewife while Mr. Higinio is a taxi driver and retired from IPS (Social Security Institute).

He began working as a taxi driver in 2006 in the Mcal Estigarribia c/ Ingavi Route.

At present, Mr. Higinio has another vehicle besides the taxi; he needs the loan to make repairs to the second vehicle and use it as a taxi as well.

Mr. Higinio’s biggest dream is to be able to finish building his modest home as well as being able to cover the costs of his youngest son’s education.

loans.use: make repairs to his new car to use it as a taxi.

loans.name: Noel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Noel, tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la  cual labora como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle siempre estudios a sus pequeños, don Noel tiene un pequeño negocio de lavado de carro, moto, buses, etc. La mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder contar con un capital suficiente para realizar las compras de una sola vez de ambientadores, silicón, shampo para carro, toallas y otros materiales de limpieza que requiere el lavado; ya que con esto comprar al por mayor y sus ganancias son más factibles que estar comprando cada unidad cada vez que estos productos se terminan. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva.
texts.en: Mr. Noel is 33 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife who works as a salesperson to help him with the household expenses. They have two children under their care, their hopes for their family is to be able to improve their quality of life and give their children a good education. Mr. Noel has a small business washing vehicles like cars, motorcycles, buses, etc. His biggest obstacle is not having access to capital to make his purchases at one time since buying wholesale is more profitable for him rather than buying products whenever he runs out of them. Mr. Noel will buy materials like air fresheners, silicone, detergent, towels and other cleaning materials needed in the wash. He is thankful for the support given to him through Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: Buy materials for his car wash.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan, de 47 años de edad, es agricultor, el vive en la comunidad llamada los Brasiles, en Estelí, es padre de 4 hijos, sus estudios a duras penas llegaron hasta sexto grado de primaria. Inicio a la edad de 30 años a sembrar papas ,  conto la ayuda de su cuñado, suegro, el antes sembraba tomates , pero después el vio que le era mas rentable sembrar papas, además sembró repollo, fue con las ganancias obtenidas de la papa y repollo que el logro hacer su casita poco a poco, comprando algunas herramientas de trabajo, también dándole estudios a sus hijos , ya que el desea verlos preparados profesionalmente , para que no se queden en la ignorancia y  sin saber nada como le sucedió a el por falta de recursos económicos. El viaja hasta la capital Managua para logran vender sus cosechas de papas  pero a el le gustaría vender también en los mercados de los departamento de Jinotega, León y Chinandega. 
El solicito el préstamo para terminar de sembrar 1 manzana de papas, comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra. Con el financiamiento lograra sembrar por completo sus cultivos de papa, sacar  mejores rendimientos y producir con calidad.   
El desea seguir cultivando papas y de los ingresos que obtenga quiere sembrar frijol y maíz, hacerles mejoras de infraestructura a su casa para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 47 years old, a farmer and lives in the los Brasiles neighborhood in Estelí. He is a father to 4 children and only completed a sixth grade education. He began growing potatoes at 30 years of age with help from his brother-in-law and father-in-law. Before he used to grow tomatoes but he later saw that it was more profitable to grow potatoes, he also sowed cabbage with the profits he made and was able to build his home little by little buy buying work tools. Mr. Juan is also able to give his children an education since he wants to see them become professionals so that they do not remain ignorant without knowing anything as it happened to him because of a lack of economic resources. Mr. Juan travels to Managua, the capital, to sell his potato crops but he would also like to sell his products to markets in the departments of Jinotega, León and Chinandega.

Mr. Juan needs the loan to finish sowing a block's worth of potatoes, buy supplies and pay for labor. He will be able to sow completely his potato crops, to have better profits and produce quality products.

Mr. Juan wishes to keep growing potatoes and from the profits that he gets he would like to grow beans and corn, and make improvements to the infrastructure of his home to give his family a worthy home.

loans.use: grow a block's worth of potatoes, buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase creams and hair products to use in the shop.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, D. 29 años, es un hombre muy humilD. y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Caroline D. 23 años y su querido hijo Jordan D. 2 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Gracias al trabajo D. Arturo las calles D. su distrito están más seguras, su labor como personal D. seguridad ha hecho que sea una persona muy querida por L. vecinos D. éste distrito, ya que conocen L. peligros a L. que está expuesto por las noches y el valor que tiene para afrontarlas. Aunque le va muy bien en este trabajo, el sueldo que percibe no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna, es por eso que ha decidido poner una tienda, el cual administrará su esposa y espera que con este nuevo ingreso, las cosas en su hogar mejoren. Se siente muy feliz en su trabajo, ya que le es muy gratificante saber que gracias a su labor, las personas pueden dormir tranquilas. Lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer toda la noche muy al tanto D. las cosas que suceden en este concurrido distrito. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con L. mil nuevos soles solicitados, planea comprar víveres para su tienda, ya que desea iniciar en este negocio lo más pronto posible.
texts.en: Arturo is 29 years old and is a very humble and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Caroline who is 23 years old and their beloved son, Jordan of 2 years of age for whom they wish a very bright future. Thanks to Arturo’s work the streets in his district are safer as he is a security guard and it has maD. him a very well liked person by his neighbors since they know the dangers that he is exposed to at night and the courage it takes to deal with it. While Arturo does very well in this job, his salary is not enough to give his family a dignified life which is why he decided to set up a store which will be managed by his wife and hopes that with the income things at home will improve. Arturo is very happy in his job since it is very gratifying to know that thanks to his job people can sleep safely. He has worked for a year in this field and says that the most difficult part is staying all night informed of what is happening in the district. This is Arturo’s first loan with MFP and knows that he has to pay his quotas on time and is determined to do so since he wants to have future loans as well. With the thousand nuevos soles he plans to buy merchandize for his store since he wants to start the business as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, y tiene un hijo.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, dicha actividad viene realizando hace más de 13 años y tiene clientela formada. Ella sale a vender sus productos a tempranas horas y esporádicamente deja a crédito a sus clientes y en esos casos le falta capital para comprar mercaderías por lo que concurre para acceder a los créditos.
Carolina  es muy activa, cumple cabalmente con sus compromisos y su máximo sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida. Justamente es por eso que solicita un crédito, a fin de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y así obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden a crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina is 31 years old, single and has a child.

She buys and sells vegetables a job that she has been doing for over 13 years and has a steady customer base. Carolina goes to sell her products early in the mornings and sporadically throughout the day to her customers who pay her on credit and sometimes she lacks the money to buy merchandize.

Carolina is very active and always meets her obligations; her biggest dream is to improve her quality of life. This is why she needs the loan to have her merchandize in stock to have greater earnings that will help her grow financially.

loans.use: buy vegetables, tomatoes, peppers, cassavas, etc.

loans.name: Arnoldo Manuel

texts.es: Arnoldo es soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicios de asesoria tecnica, ya que tiene como profesion perito contador con orientacion en computación, en una institución de microfinanzas, lleva 3 años de experiencia en este trabajo, debido al trabajo que realiza cada día, vió la necesidad de contar con el equipo necesario, por esa razón acude a ASDIR para solicitar un préstammo que le servirá para comprar una computadora, la cual es muy importante para mejorar su desempeño. Espera mejorar su condición de vida, con la inversión que esta realizando.
texts.en: Arnoldo is single and 27 years old. He has worked for 3 years in a microfinancing institution giving technical support since he is by profession an accountant specialized in computing. Due to the work that he does each day he needs to have the equipment necessary which is why he went to ASDIR to get a loan that will help him buy a computer which is very important to improve his productivity. Arnoldo hopes to improve his quality of life with the investment.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 43 años  y  es madre de 04 hijos, de ,os cuales una cuenta con familia propia.
 
Se  inicia con  la crianza de peces, mariscos (churos, conchas) para su consumo familiar.  Con un pequeño capital de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, y debido a la gran demanda en el mercado local decide incrementar la crianza con fines comerciales es así que actualmente distribuye sus productos a los distintos puestos del mercado contando con una buena clientela.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 comprará redes para pescar, alimento balanceado para poder alimentar a los peces y mariscos, alvinos (crías pequeñas de peces y mariscos) para que se desarrollen y así  proveer de estos productos, de forma diaria, a su numerosa  clientela, quienes se encuentran satisfechos con la buena atención que ella les brinda. 

Margarita tiene como sueño ampliar su piscigranja y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en: Margarita is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de las Mercedes” in Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres, San Martín. She is 43, married and the mother of four children, one of whom has her own family.   Margarita raises fish and seafood for household consumption.  With a small base capital of S/ 300.00 soles she was able to grow her business and now has an established clientele.  She now seeks a credit of S/ 1200.00 to buy fishing nets, fish feed, fish and mollusk stock, in order to increase production and satisfy client demand.  Her clients are very pleased with her service.  Margarita dreams of having an expanded fish farm, and is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish feed, fish and mollusk stock

loans.name: Tarneem

texts.en:
Tarneem is a 31-year-old housewife. She is married and has three daughters and two sons; all of her children are school students. Tarneem's husband started his job one and a half years ago, and now he is in need of a new fishing net.

Tarneem took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the net he needs. Tarneem is a conservative woman, therefore, her husband appears in the picture here instead of her.

loans.use: To pay for a fishing net.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Heriberto owns Comanche Auto Recyclers, a business that collects, crushes, and transports old vehicles to metal recycling centers.  Heriberto has been in the waste management industry since 1990, when he and his brothers opened a junk yard.  In 1994, they acquired a metal crusher, which launched Heriberto into the metal recycling business.  Shortly thereafter, he started Comanche Auto Recyclers, which he has been running ever since.

For years, Heriberto went from junkyard to junkyard with his crusher and trailer, looking for salvageable vehicles.  If he saw a vehicle with metal he could use, he bought the car from the junkyard.   If not, he went to the next place, spending fuel and time on the road.  A few months ago, Heriberto changed his business dramatically by moving to a new location where he could weigh scrap metal onsite.  Now, people who want to get rid of their vehicles take them to Heriberto, saving him the hassle of traveling with all of his equipment.  He pays for the vehicles according to their weight, with the price fluctuating according to the price of steel.  He crushes the cars, loads them onto his trailer and then he transports them to a metal recycling center in Seguin, Texas (roughly 40 miles east of San Antonio).

To make this expansion possible, Heriberto rented a new location where his business can operate, bought a portable building that serves as his office and a used scale for weighing cars.  Being hit with all of these expenditures at once strained Heriberto’s cash flow.  Because Heriberto buys all of his cars in cash, it is important that he always have cash on hand.  This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana provides Heriberto the operating capital to continue buying cars as he navigates his business through this transitional period.

Before relocating his business, Heriberto worked long days that often did not finish until 8 or 9 PM.  His new business model allows him to work fewer hours so that he usually finishes work by 6 PM.  As a father of six, he appreciates the opportunity to spend more time at home with his family.  Heriberto has two flatbed trailers that can store up to 18 crushed cars each.  He has two employees, one of whom is his son.  They currently make one trip a day to the recycling center in Seguin, though they hope that once word catches on of their new location, they will be fully utilizing both trailers.

loans.use: to buy cars

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Ignacia desde hace 27 años se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de primera  necesidad, y desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías con la inversión del crédito solicitado en la compra de arroz, yerba, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, etc. ya que posee su propio local de ventas en su domicilio donde le abastece  a todo el vecindario.
Ignacia posee muchas más mercaderías debido a la cantidad de clientes que tiene en la actualidad. 
Ella espera poder superar más aún la pobreza en la que viven, porque desea poder tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Ignacia is single and has three grown-up children.  For the past 27 years, she has been selling basic household products.  She would like to increase her stock by investing the loan that she has requested in buying rice, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, soda, etc.  She has a sales location in her own home from which she supplies the whole neighborhood.

Ignacia has a lot of merchandise owing to the number of customers that she has right now.  She hopes to be able to further overcome the poverty in which she lives because she would like to enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to buy rice, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, soda, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 42 años de edad, convive con la señora Adela con la cual tiene 2 hijos menores.
Se dedica en el ramo de Olería, cuya actividad aprendió de cuna, pues, su papá también era olero, y ahora él trata de ir mejorando sus técnicas dentro del rubro.
El solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de arcilla y arena, y así aumentar su producción y por ende su ingreso.
Mario es muy  activo, tiene visión de crecimiento y cumple cabalmente con sus compromisos, su máximo sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida para poder brindarle oportunidades de educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old.  He lives with Adela and they have two dependent children.

Mario is in the brick making business.  This is a trade that he learned as a young child since his dad was also a brick maker.  Mario is now trying to improve his techniques in the field.

Mario is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of clay and sand so that he can increase his production and, consequently, his income.

Mario is very active.  He plans to grow in his business and make his loan repayments punctually.  His biggest dream is to improve his quality of life so that he can provide his children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clay and sand

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos está  casado con la señora Rosalina, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son menores que aún están en la escuela primaria y 2 son mayores están trabajando en forma independiente.
Tienen una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja Rosalina.
Se iniciaron en la actividad con una platita que recibió Carlos como parte de una indemnización de un trabajo anterior que él realizaba. 
Carlos  además de su despensa trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa contratada por Itaipú, para que de esa manera pueda ayudar  con los gastos del hogar y educar a sus hijos.
El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque  resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Carlos is married to Rosalina. They have 5 children, 3 of whom are still at primary school. The other two are older and have jobs. 
Carlos has a well-stocked store, where his wife Rosalina works. 
They began this business with some money that Carlos received as severance pay from a previous job.  
In addition to having the store, Carlos also works as a security guard for an Itaipu-based firm. With the money he earns from this job, he is able to cover the household costs and provide for his children's education. 
He explains that the only way of being able to develop the business is through loans, since it is very difficult to secure sufficient capital through other means. It is for this reason that he has requested the loan. He is a very responsible person, who wants to succeed. He has a jovial spirit and is enterprising. There is a little doubt that he will be able to achieve all the goals he has set himself.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, and other basic foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y sandalias, tiene 5 años en dedicarse a este negocio, a tiempo completo durante todos los días de la semana.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones y zapatos, pues quiere incrementar el negocio y sus ganancias, su única alternativa es a través del financiamiento.
Sueña con algún día tener su propia casa y formar su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old.  He is single and lives on his own.  His business is selling clothes, shoes and sandals.  He has been in this business for five years and works full time hours, every day of the week.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, pants and shoes as he would like to increase his business and his profits.  His only option is to use loans.

Wilfredo dreams of some day owning his own home and starting a family.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants and shoes

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: Etelvina tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Fredy de 6 y Leyla de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su inseparable carretilla de anticuchos, Etelvina sale todos los días rumbo a su puesto de venta, ella vende en un paradero muy concurrido del Asentamiento Humano Pachacutec. Su venta diaria es de casi 150 anticuchos diarios, lo que le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras sale a vender. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto en espera de los clientes. En adelante, desea poner otro puesto de comida, en otra zona concurrida de dicho Asentamiento Humano. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos anticuhos.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 30 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children, 6 year-old Fredy and 3 year-old Leyla, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Together with her inseparable kebab cart, Etelvina goes out every day to her sales location.  She makes her sales from a very busy bus stop in Pachacutec settlement.  She sells almost 150 kebabs every day which provides her with the income she needs to support her family.  What Etelvina most enjoys about her work is that she is able to look after her young daughter while she is making her sales.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her stall all day waiting for customers.  In the future, she would like to set up another food sales location in another busy area of the same settlement.

This is Etelvina's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels able to make her repayments on time since she has faith in her business.  Etelvina will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy ingredients with which to make her delicious kebabs.

loans.use: to buy meat and supplies for preparing kebabs

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia es cliente recurrente D. nuestra entidad, la misma vive en la ciudad D. Luque, vive en casa propia con su hija.
La titular se dedica a la costura hace más D. 10 años cuenta con buena clientela formada a la fecha, además se dedica a la venta D. ropas en forma independiente. 
La misma es cliente desD. el año 2005 y cuenta con 18 creditos cancelados en nuestra entidad. A la fecha el titular desea retirar dicha operación para la compra D. telas, ya que cuenta con una oferta y desea aprovechar la temporada D. invierno.
Dicho negocio le dejará mejores ingresos para su unidad familiar y un mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Lidia is a long-standing client of our institution.  She lives in her own home, in the city of Luque, together with her daughter.

Lidia has been in the sewing business for more than ten years and has a good, well-established customer base.  She also sells clothes independently.

Lidia has been a client since 2005 and she has repaid 18 loans with our institution.  She would like to take out a new loan to buy fabric since she has an offer and would like to make the most of the winter season.

Lidia's business will make her better income for her family and help her to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Juana Cristina

texts.es:
Juana Cristina es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó el quinto años de educación secundaria, se dedica a la tejeduría, al tejido de cortes típicos, lleva un año de experiencia en este trabajo, inició gracias al apoyo de su familia.

Debido a la necesidad de contar con mas capital de trabajo, decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar hilo de diferente clases y colores, esto para producir mas volumen de tejidos, espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande y prospero, para que así pueda seguir mejorando su condicion de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Cristina is 20 years old and single.  She studied up to the fifth year of high school.  Her business is weaving and she weaves traditional clothes.  She has one year of experience in this line of work.  She started out in her business thanks to the support of her family.

Owing to her need for more working capital, Juana Cristina decided to request a loan that she could use to buy different types and colors of thread so that she could produce more woven products.  She hopes, in the future, to see her business increase and become prosperous so that she can continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy threads

loans.name: Sixta Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Sixta es soltera tiene 52 años de edad y vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio Villa Del Maestro de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Sixta es comerciante desde hace tiempo, actualmente tiene un local de venta de accesorios, prendas de vestir, calzados, bijouteris y otros artículos en el Circuito Comercial nuevo de la ciudad. Ella trabaja con su hija, quien también atiende el negocio cuando ella no puede. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha salido adelante, ha ido ampliando cada vez más su negocio hasta llegar a lo que es actualmente, mediante eso ella puede mantener su hogar pagar sus gastos y cubrir cualquier necesidad que tenga.
Ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar mas mercaderías para su local.
texts.en:
Señora Sixta is single and 52 years old.  She lives in her own home in the Barrio Villa Del Maestro neighborhood in the city of Encarnación.
Señora Sixta has been a shopkeeper for some time.  She currently has a shop where she sells accessories, clothing, shoes, trinkets and other articles.  Her shop is located in the city's new Commercial Circuit.  She works with her daughter, who runs the business when Señora Sixta is unable to do so.  Thanks to this business, Señora Sixta has been able to get ahead.  She has continually expanded her business to its current state.  Through this, she has been able to maintain her home, meet her expenses and afford whatever necessity arises.
Señora Sixta has requested the loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, trinkets, jeans, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald es vecino del cimarrón en Cartago. El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura. 
Sin embargo el ha decidido que quiere probar también en la Industria de la leche. Los lácteos es una de sus pasiones es por eso que él desea un préstamo de  500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera, con la que podrá empezar su proyecto lechero.
El desea mejorar sus ingresos, y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ronald e  socio de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ronald is neighbor in the Cimarrón community of Cartago.  He has dedicated his whole life to agriculture. 
Even so, he has decided that he wants to try out the dairy industry.  Dairy is one of his passions, and that is why he is requesting a loan of 500,000 (five-hundred thousand colones (($1025 USD)) ).  He wants to purchase a dairy cow with which he can start his dairy project.
Ronald wants to improve his earnings and to offer his family a better quality of life.
Ronald is a member of the communal Credit Union "Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón," (New hopes for Cimarrón), one of the 110 business partners of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Flor De Quinua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE QUINUA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la señora Martha.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa interior, venta de medias artesanales, taller de maniquíes, venta de cerveza, viajera trae ropa, soldador, tienda en general, venta de pescado.

La señora Martha nos indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer, y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de medias y chompas, los cuales vende, este negocio lo trabaja hace cuarenta años, aprendiendo este oficio de su tía.

El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para comprar lana y fibra de oveja y llama, material que compra de la feria 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo vende a sus caseras en diferentes puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permitió generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella quedo viuda hace 30 años y educo a cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y hablar con sus amigas.

En la fotografía podemos a observa al señor de plomo y a la señora de lente, ambos son acompañantes de sus parejas que participaron en la reunión.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Quinua" community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by an executive committee which is led by Martha.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in include: selling underwear, selling hand-knitted tights, running a mannequin workshop, selling beer, selling clothes, welding, running a general store and selling fish.

Martha tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for three years and that she joined through an invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a business knitting tights and sweaters which she sells.  She has been in this business for forty years and learned the trade from her aunt.

On this occasion, Martha is requesting a loan to buy llama and sheep yarn and fiber.  She buys her materials in the street market in 16 de Julio neighborhood (a commercial part of the city of El Alto) and makes her sales to customers in different places.  This work has allowed her to make money with which she supports her family as best she can.  She was widowed 30 years ago but has managed to provide her four children with an education.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and chatting to her friends.  In the photo we can see one man and one woman who accompanied their partners who were taking part in the meeting.

loans.use: to buy sheep and llama yarn and fiber

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 28 años, es un hombre muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Carmen de 23 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Jorge le da los ingresos necesario para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, él es conductor de su propia movilidad urbana, la cual recorre la ruta desde Ancon hasta Villa El Salvador. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en esta ruta, por lo cual conoce muy bien a las personas que vive cerca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente su movilidad por las calles en busca de clientes. Lleva 8 años realizando en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es arreglar el carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. Para el futuro, anhela tener un negocio más rentable en su casa. Es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es uno de los pocos varones y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará material de escritorio, ya que desea poner una librería, puesto que no hay ninguna en su barrio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28 years old.  He is a kind and cheerful man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 23 year-old Carmen, and their three beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Jorge's work makes him the income he needs to help his family with their household expenses.  He drives a vehicle which he owns on a route between Ancon and Villa El Salvador.  He has been working this route for a long time and so he knows the people who live nearby very well.

What Jorge most enjoys about his work is the freedom that he has since he can drive his vehicle peacefully through the streets in search of customers.  He has been in this business for eight years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be fixing his car when it has a problem.  In the future, he would like to own a more profitable business in his home.

This is Jorge's first loan from MFP.  He knows that he must repay it on time if he doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of his community bank where he is one of the few men in the group.  He feels that must be very responsible.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles that he has requested to buy stationery products since he would like to set up a stationery store as there isn't one in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stationery and school supplies to stock his stationery store

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con integrantes del comité San Cayetano de Conavi Aregua, el cual se dividió formándose dos grupos, de esta forma se inició el comité Kuña Guapa del barrio Caacupemi de Conavi San Cayetano.
Actualmente se encuentra en el 6° ciclo del programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está integrado por 19 señoras quienes se dedican a diversas actividades, sobre la base de la cooperación mutua, compañerismo y solidaridad con cada una de las integrantes.
La Sra. Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Nestor quien es docente, tienen 3 hijos. 
Es la tesorera del grupo y en esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para invertir en su taller de costura comprando insumos para la elaboracion de sus prendas.
texts.en:
The present committee was formed with members from the San Cayetano de Conavi Aregua committee which split into two groups.  This is how the Kuña Guapa committee from Conavi San Cayetano’s Caacupemi neighborhood came to be.

It is currently in its 6th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Committee and is made up of 19 members who are in a variety of activities based on mutual support, companionship and solidarity among each other.

Gloria, 43, is married to Nestor, who is a Teacher, and they have three children. She is group Treasurer and on this occasion is asking for a loan to invest in her dressmaking workshop buying supplies needed to make her articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sweaters, caps, jackets, shirts, pants, as well as other items.

loans.name: Cornelio Elias

texts.es:
Cornelio, es empleado de la Unión de exportadores y cultivo de maíz, vive con su esposa y su hijo; tiene 5 años de ser empleado y dos de dedicarse a cultivar maíz.
Actualmente necesita pagar el alquiler de terreno y prepararlo para dar inicio a la siembra, así mismo comprar abono y fertilizantes, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra esta necesidad y le permita realizar la siembra en el tiempo adecuado.
Para él trabajar fuertemente es su objetivo, continuar cultivando para ayudar a su familia y junto progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Cornelio is employed by the Exporters Union and farms corn.  He lives with his wife and son. He’s been employed for five years and has been farming corn for two.

He needs to pay for the leas of his field and to get it ready for planting and needs to buy manure and fertilizer.  To do so he’s asking for a loan that will meet this need and make it possible for him to plant in time.

His objective is to work hard and continue farming to help his family so that they can progress economically together.

loans.use: to pay land lease and to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza De San Luis Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Luis de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 21 (Veinte y un) señoras trabajadoras, solidarias y responsables, que decidieron formar un grupo de mujeres, cuyo fin es recibir un pequeño préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya para invertir en sus trabajos diarios,con el deseo de incrementar las ventas y recibir más ganancia para beneficio personal y de toda la familia.
La Sra. Librada desea dedicarse a la venta de ropas y confección de bijouteries para lo cual necesita de este crédito que será destinado a la compra de remeras, blusas, pantalones, camperas, camisas, shorts, asimismo hilos, agujas, perlitas, acrílicos, entre otros elementos necesarios para iniciarse en esta actividad y poder superarse diariamente.
texts.en:
This committee formed in the city of Caaguazú’s San Luis neighborhood.  It has 21 members.  They are hard working, mutually supportive and responsible women who decided to form a group of women whose goal is to receive a small loan from Fundación Paraguaya to invest in their daily jobs hoping to increase sales and receive more profits for their own personal and their families’ wellbeing.

Librada wants to go into clothes and notions sales and needs the loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, jackets, shirts, shorts as well as thread, needles, seed pearls, acrylics, among other necessary supplies to get started in this activity and to be able to improve herself daily.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to buy notions.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia nació en la ciudad de Abancay (Apuricma, Perú), ella tiene 48 años está divorciada y  es padre y madre para sus tres hijos.  

María Virginia es una madre de familia que vive con sus hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad comercial y el turismo.

María Virginia cuando se divorcio, ella tenia que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y por eso ahora ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (Duphre, Avon) y es conocida por sus vecinos porque ofrece sus productos mediante catálogos. Estos productos son para que las personas mejoren su imagen personal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ha solicitado María Virginia a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para adquirir más productos de belleza y ofertarlos a sus vecinos, para obtener mayores ganancias. Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

María Virginia es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Virginia is a mother living with her children in her own house that has all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department.  This zone is noted for its commercial activity and tourism.

When María Virginia divorced she needed to work to get her children ahead so she now sells beauty products (Dupree and Avon) and is known by her neighbors because she sells her items via catalogue.  These products are so that people, especially women, can improve their personal image and the income helps her support her children.

María Virginia requested a 1500 new sol loan from Asociación Arariwa to buy more beauty products to offer to her neighbors and earn higher profits.  Income from the sale of the beauty products will cover the granted loan’s repayment.

María Virginia is very well known for being a hard working, responsible woman who is a good mother who wants to provide a better future for her children improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire more beauty products.

loans.name: Tekopora Group

texts.es:
Este comité está integrado por 15 mujeres, con diversas actividades, algunas realizan bordados en ao po'i, camisas, manteles, chombas, otras se dedican a elaborar comidas rápidas como empanadas, sandwiches, milanesas y los venden en su comunidad.
La Sra. Maria como la presidenta, está comprometida con sus compañeras porque cree que solo si trabajan en grupo van a poder salir adelante.
Para conocer mejor a una D. las integrantes nombramos a la Sra. Avelina, ella se dedica a las tareas manuales y busca mejorar y aumentar su negocio y venta por lo que solicita el crédito, ya que con él podrá adquirir los materiales necesarios como telas, hilos, agujas, para bordar sobre los mismos.
texts.en:
This committee is composed of 15 women who have different occupations.  Some do ao po’i (traditional embroidery) on shirts, tablecloths, jackets; others make fast food like turnovers, sandwiches, breaded steaks to sell in the community.

María is the President.  She’s a vendor.  She is committed to her fellow members because she believes that only by working as a team will they get ahead.

Avelina makes crafts and is looking to improve and enlarge her business and sales so is asking for the loan to acquire supplies she needs like fabric, thread and needles to embroider with.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies like fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Virgen Del Paso Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Elena, que vive en la cuidad D. Itape. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité D. Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Virgen del Paso".
Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la Artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron D. sus padres y va pasando D. generación en generación.
Confeccionan hermosas prendas D. vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, en ao po'i, también las integrantes se dedican al comercio D. productos alimenticios, como así también compostura D. calzado, empleada doméstica y ama D. casa.
La Sra. Irma Concepción necesita del crédito para mejorar su labor en la artesanía, adquirir materiales D. buena calidad para confeccionar telas, camisas, manteles, en los cuales realizar mejores y distintos diseños D. bordados y así poder enseñar a sus hijos siguiendo la costumbre familiar.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to Elena who lives in the city of Itape.  They gladly accepted forming a Committee of Rural Women named “Virgen del Paso” committee.

The group members are artisans, a skill passed down from their parents and which is passed down from generation to generation.

They make beautiful articles of clothing like shirts and tablecloths using ao po’i (traditional embroidery technique).  Other members sell food, repair shoes, and are domestic employees and housewives.

Irma Concepción needs the loan to improve her crafts making.  She wants to acquire good quality supplies to make textiles, shirts and tablecloths on which to embroider better and unique designs and to be able thus to teach her children to follow the family tradition.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, fabric and shirts to embroider on.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María,vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 21 años D. edad, Doña María tiene un molino D. nixtamal, desD. hace 6 años con un horario D. 5:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento al molino y otra parte para materiales para hacer pan, este préstamo le ayudara a tener en buenas condiciones el molino para continuar brindando el servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte, cancelar este préstamo D. una forma ordenada y estar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and a 21 year-old son.  She owns a mill which is used for grinding cooked corn.  She has owned this business for six years and works from 5.00am to 4.00pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to have maintenance work done on her mill and also to buy materials for making bread.  This loan will help her to keep her mill in good condition and continue providing a good service to her customers.

María's goal is to work hard, repay this loan correctly and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her mill and to buy flour, sugar, yeast and eggs

loans.name: Wakilaré Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité wakilaré est créé le 31/05/2007.Il est composé de 17 femmes habitant le même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe de par voisinage et par affinité .leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou est responsable du groupe ,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.elle a en charge aussi de 02 autres enfants .

Elle a un petit commerce de tissus (thioub et wax);sacs à main.Comme activité secondaire elle vend de l'encens .Elle possède une cantine au marché de son quartier.Elle capitalise 07 années d'expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus, de l'encens,et sacs à main.

Elle a comme objectif de diversifier sa marchandise en y ajoutant des bijoux .Elle soutient aussi son mari dans la prise en charge de la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Wakilaré solidarity group was created on May 31, 2007. It consists of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. They created their group based on affinity and proximity. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Aissatou is the group leader. She is married and the mother of four children. She also looks after two other children who were entrusted in her care.
She has a small business selling fabrics (thioub and wax) and handbags. As a sideline, she also sells incense. She has a canteen at the local market. She has seven years of experience.

This loan will help her to buy fabrics, incense, and handbags. Her goal is to diversify her merchandise by adding jewelry. 

She also supports her husband with respect to the children’s food and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, incense and handbags for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Limpio.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son la venta, preparación de comidas rápidas, despensa.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Sra. Petrona es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a las ventas varias, ventas de escoba, de merceria y detergente. Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. Tiene 2 hijos y su marido se dedica a la construccion, es albañil.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como para regalo, ropas, librería, peluches, así también más variedad de escobas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) committee was formed by several neighbors from the city of Limpio.  All the members work independently in activities like sales, fast food preparation and grocery stores.  The members form a much unified group that’s capable of carrying out group activities that strengthen their companionship.

Petrona is one of the committee members.  She sells miscellaneous articles: brooms, notions and detergent.  She is a very creative woman and her customers are amazed at her work.  She has two children and her husband works in construction, he’s a bricklayer.  She is very happy with her work and with the training she gets in the group.

She is asking for the loan to buy miscellaneous merchandise like gifts, clothes, stationery, stuffed toys as well as more variety of brooms.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of general merchandise.

loans.name: Yeshenia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unión Y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela las Orquídeas de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por la calidez de su gente y por su empuje para salir adelante.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yeshenia, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 17, 16 y 9 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y bisutería. Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo en una distribuidora. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Este crédito lo quiere utilizar para poner una tienda de comestibles  en la casa, nos cuenta que ha arreglado su local y que solo le falta comprar los productos para echar en marcha su negocio.
	
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos necesarios para surtir su negocio. Está hace ocho ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Unión Y Desarrollo" (Unity and Development) meets every two weeks in the Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for the warmth of its people and its push to progress.

In this place, we meet Señora Yeshenia.  She is 38 years old, married and with her husband has three children who are 17, 16 and 9 years old.  The older ones go to high school, and the youngest to elementary school.  Her husband has a cabinetmaking workshop.

Señora Yeshenia is a homemaker who, in order to have her own resources, makes a living selling cosmetics and costume jewelry.  She works three days a week.  She sells her products on credit and collects the payments weekly.  She purchases her products from a distributor in downtown Portoviejo.  She has been earning a living in this business for five years, and it is going very well.  This loan is intended for opening a grocery shop in her home.  Señora Yeshenia tells us that she has fixed-up her shop and only needs to purchase the products to open for business.
	
This loan is for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, detergents and other products that she needs to stock up her store.  Señora Yeshenia has been with the communal bank for 8 cycles.  She is the bank treasurer.  She likes the bank because the payments are easy to make.
 
Señora Yeshenia's dream is to have her own home, since the one she lives in is a rental.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents and other products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tienen cuatro hijos de 11, 6, 5 años de edad, y el último de 4 meses de edad.
