La sra. Damiana se dedica a la costura, ella realiza prendas para hombres y mujeres, es muy reconocida en la zona por la excelente calidad de sus ropas.
Tiene este rubro desde que era una adolescente, pues fue un oficio aprendido de manera rápida a través de su madre y hoy día se ha convertido en el principal medio de ingreso económico de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar telas de distintas calidades y colores a modo de poder confeccionar más y tener mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The name of this group is "Mujeres Virtuosas", meaning "Virtuous Women". It is an excellent group of women from the city of Villa Elisa. Thanks to Damiana who contacted an assessor at a weekly meeting in the region to inform herself on the kind of work carried out by Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Once she was informed on the program she was able to bring together a group of 15 women, and now they are on their first loan cycle. They all have business activities to earn an income. They help each other to meet their common group objectives and with Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner). 

Damiana is a seamstress. She makes articles of clothing for men and women and she is very well known in the region for the excellent quality of clothing she makes.

She has had this business since she was an adolescent. It was a trade that she quickly learned from her mother and today it has converted into the primary source of income for her family.

She requests a loan to purchase fabrics of different qualities and colors in order to be able to produce more and to have a larger selection for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Women Of The Future Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel surgió por contacto de la Directora General con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 6º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Marisa, ella se desempeña como directora de finanzas, tiene 3 hijos dos mayores y una pequeña, su marido es comerciante  y ella tiene un local de venta de ropas en el nuevo circuito comercial.
Cuenta la Sra. Marisa que el crédito que espera recibir lo utilizará para la compra de ropas para volver a surtir su mesita, y poder mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que desean con muchas ganas sobresalir.
texts.en:
This group from the community of San Miguel came together following a contact from the Director General with the organization. This group is on their 6th loan cycle. They have been with Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) since 2009. 

One of the members of this group is Marisa. She is the director of finances. She has 3 children, two are grown and one is a girl. Her husband is a merchant and she has a clothing store in the new commercial circuit. 

Marisa says that she hopes to invest her loan in the purchase of clotting to supply her business and to improve her income and that of her family. 

All of the members of the group are women who very hardworking fighters who are very eager to excel.

loans.use: compra de ropas, pantalones, camisas, remeras, poleras, camperas, busos, etc.

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.es:
Para la formación D. presente comité, tuvo el inicio la Señora Norma D. km. 9 Acaray de Ciudad D. Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se denomina “Nueva Esperanza" están en el Quinto Ciclo con 15 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsables entre ellas, realizan actividades para el fondo D. grupo en caso de que alguna compañera esté con dificultades de pago.
En el caso de la Sra. Nancy, solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas nuevas y usadas para seguir creciendo en esta actividad, más ahora que se aproxima el frío D. invierno.
Ella se dedica netamente a esto pues es un ingreso seguro que posee debido a la cantidad de buenos clientes que fue adquiriendo a través D. tiempo.
Hoy día todas están con esperanzas de poder prosperar con la ayuda de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The group was formed by Norma of km. 9 Acaray of Ciudad D. Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in their community. The name of this group is "Neuva Esperanza", meaning "New Hope". The 15 members of the group are on their fifth loan cycle. It is a group well-known in their community for being very united, supportive, and responsible to each other. They carry out activities for the group fund in case a member ever has trouble with their payment.

IN the case of Nancy, she requests a loan to purchase new and used clothing to keep her business growing, most importantly now that the cold of winter approaches. She dedicates herself solely to this business because it is a secure source of income given the number of good clients whom she has acquired through time. 

Today they all hope to prosper with the help of Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase new and used clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fátima se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, logró juntar a 22 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8° ciclo.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo.
La Sra. Zunilda solicita en esta ocasión el crédito para la compra de ropas, cosméticos, frutas, verduras, ya que posee un negocio modesto dedicándose a la venta de esta variedad de productos, pues es su medio de ingreso económico para poder mantener a su familia y a ella misma.
texts.en: The name of this excellent group of women is "Virgen de Fatima" and it is located in the city of Ita. It is thanks to Teresa, a fruits merchant, that the group of 22 women was formed following her contact with the assessor at a weekly reunion held in the region to inform herself on the work carried out by the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras. They are working very comfortably on their 8th loan cycle. They all have activities to earn an income. They help each other to reach the common objectives of the group. At this time Zunilda requests a loan to purchase clothing, cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables. She has a modest business selling this variety of products. This is the source of income that she earns to support her family and herself.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, fruits and vegetables, and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio, from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon, is 66 years old and married. To make a living, Sergio has been raising pigs to sell for over six years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sergio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell, he is requesting his seventh loan for 23000 PHP to purchase medication for his livestock. Sergio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase medication for his livestock.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani, from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, is 44 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Lani owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals including afritada, caldereta and pancit bihon in the local community. She also runs a store selling snack foods and canned goods. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital, she is requesting her sixth loan for 20000 PHP to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Lani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City, is 40 years old, separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish such as sardines and milk fish in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, he is now requesting his second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional fish such as sardines and mackerel. Leonardo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish such as sardines and mackerel.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business selling seafood products,  including fish like sardines & mackerel. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like mackerel & sardines

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 37 years old. Sandy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sandy owns & operates a business selling coconuts & green bananas in the local community. Sandy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sandy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sandy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Sandy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Sandy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old. Manilyn is single. To make a living, Manilyn owns & operates a business selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community.  Manilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and bags.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 35 years old and married with two children.  He earns a living from his barber shop. He has three years of experience in the business. He says that he has grown his business through Faulu Kenya, hence, improving his standard of living. His dreams and aspirations are to own a piece of land and provide the best education to his children. He has requested 45,000 Kenyan shillings to open another barber shop.

loans.use: to open another barber shop.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 29 years old, married, has one child and has made a living as a tailor for the last three years. Joining Faulu Kenya has helped her focus on her business, which she is now committed to grow as rapidly as possible. She is applying for a loan for 40,000 Kes to expand the location in which she works.

loans.use: to acquire a larger space to work in.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 32 years old, married, has two children and makes a living selling electrical appliances and working as an electrician. He has been in business for only one year but is committed to expand his company and acquire more items to sell. Through Faulu Kenya he has been able to share ideas with other businesspeople and get other kinds of help. He has applied for a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy new items to sell to his customers and also buy a new testing kit.

loans.use: to buy a new testing kit and more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is 24 years old and he lives in Zovaber village, an area of Sevan, with his parents and his brother. 

For a while, Hambardzum worked as a builder. After that he became involved in farming. 

On his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Hambardzum’s family members help him in farming and so they meet their family’s needs
. 
Hambardzum intends to grow potatoes on his farm and therefore he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan, which he will use to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel. 

This is Hambardzum’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is 31 years old, married and has one child. He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has managed to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He has also benefited from business training conducted by Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: To increase stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 43 years old, married and with six children. She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. She has engaged in the business for five years. She says that she hopes to open other branches of her business in the future. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her money and add business stock. She has requested for 40,000 Kes to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Diya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diya est crée le 31 / 05 / 2007. Il est composé de 25 femmes du même quartier. 

Elles ont formé leur groupe en affinité et par voisinage.

leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame safi âgée de 31 ans est divorcée et mère d'une fille.

Son activité est l'achat et la vente de tissus teintés qu'elle exerce au marché central. 

Son objectif est la prise en charge de sa fille et ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Diya group was created May 31, 2007. It comprises 25 women from the same neighborhood. They created their group based on sympathies and proximity. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Safi is 31 years old; she is divorced and mother to one daughter. Her activity is the purchase and sale of dyed fabrics, which she procures at the central market.

Her objective is to provide for her daughter and for herself.

loans.use: to purchase " thioub" dyed fabrics.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik was born in 1953. He lives in Jujevan village, Tavush Marz. Valerik is married and has two sons who are already married. His younger son’s family lives with Valerik.
 
Over 33 years Valerik has been worked at Jujevan village’s school and simultaneously he has been engaged in farming and shopkeeping. In his shop he sells foods and household goods. Valerik’s family helps him to manage farming and trading and thereby they meet their needs.
 
Valerik is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy food items such as a large amount of flour, sugar, etc., and some household goods for his shop.
 
This is Valerik’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy large amount of flour, sugar, etc. and some household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Ditavan village, Tavush Marz. She is married and has four children: three daughters and a son.
 
Anzhela and her husband have been engaged in beekeeping for a long time. They say bee families need systematic and careful concern, and thanks to Anzhela's and her husband's treatment and diligence, they get high-quality honey. That honey they trade or sell on the market. With income from beekeeping they meet their family's needs and develop their farm. 

Anzhela breeds cows and calves on her farm as well. She needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy five beehives, some piglets and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: To buy five beehives, some piglets and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Macaria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Macaria Elena es casada, tiene 33 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía específicamente a la confección D. pantalones para caballeros, lleva 10 años D. experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria. 

Solicita un préstamo en ASDIR para invertirlo como capital D. trabajo, específicamente para la compra D. telas e hilos que son materia prima muy necesaria para la produccion D. pantalones, que es una fuente D. ingresos muy importante para ella, en el futuro espera ver su negocio con varios trabajadores.
texts.en: Macaria Elena is married and she is 33 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 2 children who are in school. She is an artisan who, more specifically, makes gentlemen's slacks. She has 10 years' experience in the business. She started out as an operator. She requests a loan from ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) to invest as working capital, especially to purchase fabrics and threads. They are the materials which are very necessary for the production of slacks. It is a very important source of income for her. In the future she hopes to see her business with several employees.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, grains, drinks, toilet paper and detergent

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, él vive con su esposa y tres hijos, don Andrés se dedica a la crianza de ganado, comercializa la leche y quesos, también siembra maíz para el consumo familiar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaquilla, ya que no dispone de los fondos, esto sea una gran ayuda para él y le permitirá aumentar el número de animales.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para ayudar a su familia y sobre todo a que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,
texts.en:
Andrés grows basic grains and also raises cattle. He lives with his wife and their three children. He sells milk and cheese, and also grows corn for the family to eat.

Andrés is seeking a loan to buy a heifer as he doesn’t have enough money to do this. This would be a big help and allow him to increase the number of animals he owns.

His goal is to work hard to support his family, and above all to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Monica Santos

texts.es:
Mónica es una mdare de familia de 39 años de edad,  tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con servicio básicos, ubicada en el caserío los Aguilares  que pertenece al distrito de Pítipo que se encuentra en la Provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura  y ganadería.

Mónica se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y  pavos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada y granos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.  También cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa, ya que en el caserío donde vive no hay, lo que le permite tener otro ingreso económico.


El crédito que ha solicitado  es de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, el cual será destinado  para la compra de aves de corral y algunos productos para abastecer su tienda para y así poder pagar su préstamo, lo que le ayudara  a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mónica es una persona trabajadora y con mucho empeñosa  a sabido salir adelante para mejorar en su negocio y como familia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 39 year-old mother who lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  Her home does not have basic services and is located in the small village of Los Aguilares, in Pítipo district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Mónica raises and sells poultry (hens, ducks and turkeys).  The pen where she keeps her animals is located outside her home.  She feeds her animals a balanced diet and natural grains.  She then sells her animals in the different markets in the city of Chiclayo once they have reached an ideal size and weight.  This increases her profits and she is able to obtain things that her household lacks.  Mónica also has a small store in her home since there isn't one in the village where she lives.  This makes her another income.

Mónica has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa through their seed fund.  She will use this money to buy poultry and some products with which to stock her store.  This will enable her to repay her loan and improve her family's quality of life.  Mónica is a hard-working person with a lot of drive who has known how to get ahead in order to improve her business and also her family life.

loans.use: to buy poultry and some products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 17, 15, 11 y 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio tiene 6 años de existir y lo realiza por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos que le ayude a amortiguar los gastos de sus hijos.
Ella quiere comprase unos cerdos y comprar concentrado, para esto solicita un préstamo que es de mucha importancia, pues así estará aumentando la granja de cerdos y tendrá suficiente alimentación.
Su sueño es que a través de financiamientos crezca el negocio, aumentando el número de cerdos, darles una buena alimentación para comercializarlo a un buen precio, de esta manera dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fermina is a single mother of four children aged 17, 15, 11, and 8. She earns her living by raising pigs, a job she’s been doing for six years in order to have an income to support her family.

Fermina wishes to buy more pigs and special feed so she is seeking a loan. The money is very important to her as she will be able to increase the number of pigs she owns and have sufficient food for them. Her dream is to expand her business, increase the number of pigs, and give them good food so she can sell them for a good price. In this way she will improve the standard of living of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Maritza Magda

texts.es:
Maritza de oficio comerciante, con más de doce años en las venta de lentes, en toda variedad, controles de tv, Dvd y accesorios de celulares. Comenzando con pocos producto y ambulante en los semáforos. Hoy en día sus ventas aumentaron al ofreces más productos de calidad, con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado por medio del crédito.
Ahora cuenta con un lugar fijo en sus ventas, en un centro comercial, en la parte de afuera, logrando vender más. Ya que es un centro muy visitado. y que gracias  a la variedad de productos sus ventas son buenas.

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara; lentes de sol, cartuchera de celular, protectores de celular, controles de tv, manos libres y cargadores de celular. Siendo de mayor demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza is a merchant by trade and she has more than twelve years experience selling all types of glasses, television remote controls, DVDs, and cellular phone accessories. She started out with only a few products and selling at street intersections. Today, her sales have increased and she offers more quality products with the help of loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner).

She now has a fixed store space for her sales, located in the exterior of a shopping center where she can sell more. It is a highly visited shopping center and thanks to the variety of products, her sales are good.

With this new loan she will purchase: sunglasses, cellular phone cases and skins, television remote controls, hands-free devices, and chargers. These products are in most demand by her clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sunglasses and other merchandise to keep her business growing.

loans.name: Berna Haydee

texts.es: La Sra. Berna  tiene 38 años, es conviviente tiene 1 hija menor de edad de 14 años, quien estudia en colegio estatal, cuenta con casa propia de material noble, Berna se dedica al negocio de transporte  tiene 2 vehículos el cual es alquilado y su cónyuge trabaja en la otra movilidad, realizando el servicio de colectivo para la ruta de Ica- Fonavi San Martín viceversa, las movilidad fueron adquirida con el trabajo que ella realizaba como ayudante de venta de comida, el préstamo será invertido en darle mantenimiento al motor y comprar algunas piezas del mismo, y  así  poder seguir trabajando, su sueño a futuro es de contar con otra movilidad con mayor capacidad de pasajeros para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ocasiónales , Berna esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Berna is 38 years old and has one daughter who is 14 and in high school.  Berna owns her own home which is made from solid building materials and has a transport business.  She owns two vehicles; she rents one of them out and the other is used by her husband who provides a taxi service (with fixed route and fare) on the Ica - Fonavi San Martín route.  The vehicles were purchased with money from the work that Berna used to carry out as an assistant in a food sales business. 

Berna will invest her loan in having the vehicle's engine serviced and she will also buy some spare parts.  This will enable her to continue working.  Her dream for the future is to own another vehicle which can carry more passengers so that she can provide a better service to her casual customers.  Berna is very grateful for the trust that is being placed in her.

loans.use: to maintain the engine of her car and purchase spare parts

loans.name: Santos Nicanor

texts.es:
Santos Nircanor es una padre de familia de 54 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo e hijo, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos40 minutos del departamento de Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

Santos Nicanor se dedica hace 12 años a las labores agricolas en sus tierras cultivo siembra mango y limón, son frutos muy ricos para el consumo de los pobladores que lo comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Piura, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Pero quiere intentar sembrar maíz  en sus tierras donde tenía sembrado el mango, ya que este fruto sólo sale en tiempo de verano y así amplia sus productos para vender. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para empezar a sembrar maíz necesita comprar fertilizantes para preparar las tierras donde se va a sembrar y también para el pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de sus tierras, esto le va permitir que una vez que coseche tenga mayores ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  Santos Nicanor es conocido por las personas que también se dedican a esa actividad, por ser trabajador y responsable, con el único objetivo de brindarle a su hijo estudios superiores y tener algunas comidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Santos Nircanor is a 54 year old father.  He lives in his own house with his wife and son.  The house, which is in the Tambogrande district 40 minutes from the Piura department, does not have basic services.  The people in this zone engage in farming, raising livestock, and handicrafts.

For 12 years Santos Nicanor has been working on his land growing mangoes and lemons.  They are delicious fruits that the villagers consume, and he sells at the market in the city of Piura.  He sells wholesale and retail, and his objective is to increase his income.

He wants to try growing corn on his land where he has planted mangoes.  He wants to do this because this plant only bears fruit in the summer.  That way he can increase the products he sells.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to start growing corn.  He needs to buy fertilizers to prepare the land where he will plant.  He also needs to pay for the labor to clear his fields.  This will allow him, once he harvests, to have greater income to cover the family expenses.

Santo Nicanor is known by the people who are in the same business he is in as being a hard-worker and for being responsible.  His only objective is to give his children a higher education and for them to have some conveniences at home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to prepare his fields to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have the spool in his mill repaired and to buy paint for his vehicle workshop

loans.name: Justo Marcial

texts.es:
Justo, originario de la comunidad Los Cocos ubicado en Telica, municipio de León, de oficio carpintero, tiene 37 años de edad, el fabrica  muebles, esta casado, es padre de dos hijos, de 14 y 8 años respectivamente. El inicio sus actividades en 1990, su papa le enseño el oficio de carpintero, fabrica camas, roperos, comedores, cunas ofrece sus productos en la parte central de León  y en su propia comunidad, tiene otros ingresos posee una camioneta la cual utiliza como acarreo de arenas, incluso hace mudanzas. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar madera, pintura, clavos, tornillos, materia prima para trabajar. Con esta inversión espera poder producir mas, a mayor cantidad, para así aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, hacer nuevos clientes. En sus planes futuros esta comprar maquinaria para producir más  y ampliar su negocio para brindar trabajo a otras personas
texts.en:
Justo is from the Los Cocos community, which is located in the Telica municipality in León.  He is a 37 year old carpenter, and he makes furniture.  He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 8.  

He started his business activity in 1990.  He father taught him the carpentry trade and how to make beds, wardrobes, dining room sets, and cradles.  He sells his products in the central part of León, in his own community.  

He has other income from a van that he uses for hauling sand and also for removals.

He is requesting the loan to buy wood, paint, nails, screws, and raw material for work.  With this investment he plans to be able to produce more.  By producing a greater quantity he will increase his sales, improve his income, and make new customers.  

His future plans are to buy more machinery in order to produce more, to expand his business, and to provide work for other people.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, nails, screws, and raw material for work.

loans.name: Melia  Teresa

texts.es:
Melia es comerciante, vende tortilla, frijoles cocidos, nacatamales con más de nuevo años en las ventas, pues ha sido el medio de poder apoyar  a su familia y con el fin de poder terminar de construir su casa. 
Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio, ahorro de su trabajo como albañil. Lo que vino a mejorar con los financiamientos al aumentar sus productos en venta de más tortillas y preparación de nacatamales. 
Así como las mejoras de su casa el cual la tiene bien avanzada en la parte de enfrente y quiere seguir serrando a los lados. Para esto comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y seguir avanzando en la construcción.
texts.en:
Melia sells tortillas, baked beans and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales).  She has been selling for more than nine years and it has enabled her to support her family and finish building her home.

Melia started out with money that her husband gave her.  He had saved up money from his job as a construction worker.  She also improved her business through loans, increasing the products that she sold, making more tortillas and making nacatamales as well.

Melia has also made improvements to her home.  Her house building is advancing well at the front and she would like to continue work on the sides.  She will buy blocks, sand, cement and iron, and continue making progress with her building work.

loans.use: to continue building the internal walls of her home from concrete.  She will buy blocks, sand, cement and iron

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise: detergents, soap, sugar, corn, beans and rice

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira es comerciante desde hace once años, logrando poner su propio negocio de venta de comida, para esto trabajo mucho, pero esta satisfecha al tener su negocio propio.
Su esposo es maestro de obra el cual siempre ha contribuido para el bien común de la familia, y para la educación de sus dos hijos que estudian.
Gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado mediante el crédito, ha logrado el crecimiento en sus ventas, y hoy desea ampliar la parte de enfrente de su vivienda ya que necesita mantenimiento de paredes, hacer paredes interna lo que comprara materiales de construcción en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra, teniendo el beneficio de no pagar en mano de obra, siendo su esposo quien las hace.
texts.en:
Yadira has been a merchant for eleven years. She has managed to set up her own catering business and she worked very to achieve this. But She is satisfied to have her own business.

Her husband is a master construction worker and he has always contributed to the common welfare of the family and for the education of their two children. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) she has managed to increase her sales. Currently she wants to expand the front section of her house, to carry out maintenance to the existing walls and to add new walls to the interior. She will purchase construction materials such as construction rocks, sand, cement, and steel to start the project. They enjoy the benefit of not having to pay for labor expenses because her husband can do it.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction rocks, sand, cement, and steel to start maintenance on their interior walls.

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessica, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre, se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana y fue su madre quien le enseño a prepararlas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos: plátanos, azúcar, leche y aceite, con la obtención de estos productos mejorara su producción, podrá seguir en el negocio y generar ingresos para el hogar.
Sueña con algún día independizarse y formar su propio hogar, así también crecer con su producción teniendo mejores herramientas.
texts.en:
Yessica is 21 years old, single, and lives with her mother.  Her business is making empanadas and she has been in the business for seven years.  She works every day of the week and it was her mother who taught her how to make them.

Yessica is requesting a loan to buy supplies: plantains, sugar, milk and oil.  The purchase of these products will improve her production.  She will be able to continue in her business and make income for her household.

Yessica dreams of some day becoming independent and forming her own household.  She also dreams of increasing her production and having better tools.

loans.use: to buy supplies: plantains, sugar, milk and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall in the backyard to avoid water leakage into the patio for which she will buy blocks, sand, cement and iron.

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa, ya no tienen hijos a cargo, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, lleva ya muchos años realizando cultivos año a año, aprendió desde muy joven a través de su padre.
Actualmente el necesita invertir en insumos para llevar a cabo la siembra, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita obtener abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar el trabajo agrícola y recibir la cosecha para comercializar el frijol y maíz que produzca. 
Él aspira tener una granja de gallinas ponedoras, ya que por su edad,  siente que las labores agrícolas dentro de un par de años no las podrá realizar,  pensando siempre en tener una fuente de ingreso, Además le gustaría ahorrar para comprarse un vehículo para transportarse y transportar las cosechas.
texts.en:
Tereso is 59 years old.  He lives with his wife and they no longer have any children in their care.  Tereso grows corn and beans.  He has been growing crops for many years.  He learned the business at a very young age from his father.

Tereso currently needs to invest in supplies so that he can sow his crops.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments.  This loan will help him to farm and harvest his crops and then sell the beans and corn that he produces.

Tereso aspires to own a farm of laying hens.  Owing to his age, he feels that he will no longer be able to carry out farm work in a couple of years time.  For this reason, he is thinking about a future source of income.  He would also like to save up to buy a vehicle which he can use for his own transportation and with which he can also transport his crops.

loans.use: to buy materials, manure, fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Angel Alfredo

texts.es:
Don Alfredo es casado, tiene 29 años de edad, estudio 4 años en educación primaria,  se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició su negocio pensando en su superación personal y ahora en la superación de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Decide ampliar su capital de trabajo para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le servirá para comprar hilo de diferentes clases y colores esto para seguir produciendo mas cortes y obtener ganancias al vender el producto final de la inversión que esta haciendo, ya que en el futuro desea ver su negocio prospero y con mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
Alfredo is married, 29 years old, and studied until the 4th grade.  He dedicates himself to weaving traditional fabrics, and has 10 years of experience in this work.  He started his business with thoughts of personal accomplishment, and now in terms of its benefit to his family.  He counts on the support of his wife.

He has decided to augment his working capital, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He will use the funds to buy threads of different types and colors, so he can continue to produce more fabrics.  He hopes to obtain profits from selling the final products from the investment he’s making.  In the future, he wants to see a prosperous business with greater income.

loans.use: buy threads of different types and colors.

loans.name: July Ivonne

texts.es:
July de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es chofer ambulante. Tiene un hijo de tres años. Su actividad comercial es que tiene un gabinete de belleza.

Estudio belleza hace 15 años y le gusto . A parte de que su mama le enseño algunos estilos de cortes. A veces su mama la ayuda, labora de 8H45 am a 21H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas productos para su mercadería como tintes, esmaltes, cremas capilar. En un futuro quiere vender productos naturales en un local mas amplio y que su familia tenga salud y bienestar.
texts.en:
July, 31 years of age, lives in an urban area in a suburb of Guayaquil.  Her husband works as a driver.  She has one child that is three years old, and her business is a beauty salon.

She studied beauty styling 15 years ago and really liked it.  Also, her mother taught her some styles of haircutting.  Her mother sometimes helps her.  She works from 8:45 am until 9:00 pm.  With the help from this loan, she wants to buy more merchandising products such as dyes, nail polishes and hair creams.  In the future, she would like to sell natural products from a larger locale and wants health and well-being for her family.

loans.use: buy beauty products such as hair dyes, nail polishes, and hair creams.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Martha, vive con su esposo y una nieta, tiene casa propia y ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cosméticos, lleva 8 años D. ser comerciante, ofrece las prendas D. vestir en su vivienda y también sale a visitar casa por casa en un horario D. 8:00am a 2:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar blusas, faldas y productos D. belleza como polvos, lápiz D. labio y cremas, este préstamo le ayudara a  tener mayor disponibilidad D. productos que le permitan incrementar las ventas.
El sueño D. Martha es crecer en su negocio, lograr ampliarse en la zona y además D. sus ganancias poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha lives with her husband and a granddaughter.  She owns her house, and dedicates herself to selling clothing and cosmetics.  She has been in this business for 8 years, offering her clothing from her home as well as door-to-door from 8:00 am until 2:00 pm.

She requests this loan to buy blouses, skirts and beauty products such as powers, lipsticks, and creams.  This loan will help her have more product availability so she can increase her sales.

Martha’s dreams are to grow her business, expand in the area, and also to make money for some home repairs.

loans.use: buy blouses and skirts, as well as beauty products such as powders, lipsticks and creams.

loans.name: Hortencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hortencia de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos, con su propio negocio la venta de tortilla y con más de cinco años en la venta con el fin de poder apoyar  a su familia.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa que junto a su esposo lo han logrado. Pero aun le falta lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder terminar el cuarto, lo que repellara, y pondrá techo. Siendo Afodenic una puerta al desarrollo para la conclusión de su casa.
Materiales a comprar: arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, láminas de zinc, perlines, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en: Hortencia is 46 years old, married, and she is the mother of four children. She has had her own tortilla business for the past 5 years. Her goal is to support her family. Her objective has been to build a house and she has managed it together with her husband. But she still needs a loan to finish a bedroom. She will plaster it and add a roof. Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) is a door to finishing the construction of their house. Materials to buy include: sand, construction blocks, steel, zinc sheets, rebars, and to cover the labor expenses.

loans.use: to finish building a room to improve the living space of her family.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos, este negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y también realiza trabajos de albañilería.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas y jugos, también terminara de cancelar un vehículo, este financiamiento le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a tener su propio vehículo que le sirva para ejecutar las labores de albañilería. 
Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia a través  del trabajo y que sus hijos estudien para que se superen.
texts.en:
Modesto lives with his family and three children.  He dedicates himself to selling sodas and beverages.  He has this business in his own home, and he also works on construction projects.

He requests this loan to buy beverages, sodas and juices.  He will also finish paying off a vehicle.  This loan will help him strengthen his business, and have his own transportation so he can carry out his construction work.

His goals are to support his family through his work, and to see his children complete their educations so they can be successful.

loans.use: buy beverages, sodas and juices.

loans.name: Lucio Jose

texts.es:
Lucio, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y estructuras metálicas, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia, además de poseer un camión de volteo, trabaja a tiempo completo durante todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar equipo para el taller de mecánica, como un taladro y compresor. Estas herramientas son muy necesarias para ejecutar sus tareas diarias.
Su aspiración es tener un taller más amplio y con todo lo necesario en herramientas, tener un vehículo para trabajar y en su familia pues contribuir al estudio de sus hijos para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Lucio is married, lives with his wife, and they have three children ages 17, 10 and 8.  He has a workshop for auto repairs and metallic structures.  He has 25 years of experience.  He also has a dump truck.  He works full-time, every day of the week.

Currently, he is requesting this loan to buy some mechanical equipment, such as a drill and a compressor.  These tools are very necessary for him to have in order to carry out his daily work.

His aspirations are to have a larger workshop outfitted with all the required tools, to have a vehicle for his work, and, with relation to his family, to contribute to his children’s educations so they can succeed academically.

loans.use: buy a drill and compressor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her premises

loans.name: Libeth Paola

texts.es:
Lizbeth de 24 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su negocio de venta de almuerzos en las tardes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar vendiendo almuerzos y en ocasiones desayunos. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm todos los días. Los desayunos que vende tienen un precio desde $ 1.25 según el plato y los almuerzos a $ 1.75. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para tener mas ingresos con el dinero quiere comprar sillas, mesas y una cocina.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 24 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a business selling lunches in the afternoons.  She has many aspirations for her business.  She would like to continue selling lunches and occasionally breakfasts as well.

Lizbeth currently works from 8.00am to 3.00pm, every day.  Her breakfasts cost from $1.25, depending on the meal, and her lunches cost from $1.75.  She has many aspirations for her business and would like this loan so that she can make more income.  She would like to use the money to buy chairs, tables and a stove.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Leopoldina Primitiva

texts.es:
Leopoldina de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es separada y tiene un hijo de 12 años que estudia en la Academia Naval. Ella se dedica en la venta de gallinas chanchos y ropa por catálogos.

Comenzó criando gallinas en su casa y luego las vendía y así fue incrementando su capital y después de un tiempo empezó con la venta de chanchos y mercadería de ropa por catálogos. Le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que por el sector es mas frecuente. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas gallinas chanchos y ropa por catálogos.

En un futuro desea comprarse otro solar para poner criaderos de pollos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is 55 years old and lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She is separated and has a 12 year-old son who is studying at the Naval Academy.  Her business is selling hens, pigs, and clothes through catalogs.

Leopoldina started out raising hens at home and then selling them.  In this way, she gradually increased her capital and, after a while, she started selling pigs and also clothes through catalogs.  Leopoldina is affected in her business by crime since it is very common in her neighborhood.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more hens, pigs and clothes.

In the future, Leopoldina would like to buy another plot of land so that she can set up a poultry farm and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy 30 units of hens, 2 units of pigs, and clothes

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuela de 43 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es unida y tienen 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor es fallecido.

Comenzó hace tres años en su negocio de taller de sandalias trabaja con un a persona que realiza los zapatos de caballeros. Labora con su ayudante de 8H30 am a 6H00 pm de lunes a sábados. Su esposo trabaja independiente como cerrajero. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas productos para la elaboración de calzados como plantillas $200 correas $100 fibras de yutes $300 para incrementar su capital.

En un futuro quiere tener un local para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 43 years old and lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 15.  Her eldest is in high school and her youngest is deceased.

Manuela started her business (a workshop where she makes sandals) three years ago.  She works with another person who makes men's shoes.  She works with her assistant from 8.30am to 6.00pm, from Monday to Saturday.  Her husband is self employed as a locksmith.  With the help of this loan, Manuela would like to buy more products for making footwear such as insoles ($200), straps ($100) and jute fiber ($300).  This will increase her capital.

In the future, Manuela would like to have premises where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy insoles, straps and jute fiber

loans.name: Bella Amira

texts.es:
Bella de 59 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Es viuda y tiene una hija mayor de edad discapacitada. Se dedica a a la venta de ropa.

Comenzó su actividad desde muy joven vendiendo ropa a créditos con su mama pero desde que se caso siguió con el negocio con su conyugue hasta abrir un atienda de ropa. Con el pasar del tiempo su esposo la dejo y ella no se dio por vencido que siguió con su actividad hasta que su conyugue murió pero ella vive con su hija que es discapacitada . Labora desde las 6H00 am a 7H00 am de ahí ya se queda en su tienda desde las 6H00 pm. De 6h00 pm a 7H00 pm sale a a cobrar su ropa a crédito a sus clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar víveres y ropa por docena para mejorar sus ingresos. La cliente desea tener una tienda mas grande para ya no dejar mucho tiempo sola a su hija que la deja en su casa. Con respecto a su familia solo le pide a Dios que le de los años que mas pueda para poder cuidar a a su hija hasta su ultimo aliento de vida.
texts.en:
Bella is 59 years old and lives in Playas canton.  This is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and is known for its wide variety of seafood.  Bella is a widow and has a grown-up, disabled daughter.  Her business is selling clothes.

Bella started her business at a very young age, selling clothes on credit with her mom.  However, when she got married, she continued in her business together with her husband and eventually opened a clothes store.  Bella's husband left her but she did not give up.  She continued in her business until her husband died.  Bella lives with her daughter who is disabled.  She starts work at 6.00 or 7.00am and stays in her store until 6.00pm.  From 6.00pm to 7.00pm she goes out to deliver clothes on credit to her customers and collect payment.  With the help of this loan, Bella will buy food products and clothes in bulk so that she can increase her income.

Bella would like to have a larger store so that she no longer has to leave her daughter alone for long as she leaves her at home.  As regards her family, Bella only asks God to grant her as many years as he can so that she can continue to care for her daughter until she draws her last breath.

loans.use: to buy food products and clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Raiza Alexandra

texts.es:
Raiza de 20 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, es una joven emprendedora que abrió un cyber – cabinas.

Comenzó su actividad hace 2 años a raíz que el papa falleció ella se hizo cargo del negocio y seguir saliendo adelante. En su local también vende tarjeta telefónica y hace recargas telefónicas. De $3,00 a $20.en el negocio se encarga la mama en las mañanas en la tarde el hermano y ella labora en las noches ya que estudia en universidad. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar una fotocopiadora y otra computadora para el negocio y así aumentar sus ganancias. Ella anhela que su negocio crezca, terminar su carrera universitaria y seguir con su mama en el negocio.
texts.en:
Raiza is 20 years old and lives in an urban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil.  El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood which used to be a large estate.  It is named after a species of tree (Guazuma ulmifolia).  Raiza is an entrepreneurial young woman who opened an Internet cafe.

Raiza started her business activity two years ago.  Her dad died and she took charge of the business.  She also sells phone cards and minutes (top ups) costing between $3 and $20.  Raiza's mom looks after the business in the mornings, her brother in the afternoon and Raiza works nights since she is studying at university.  With the help of this loan, Raiza would like to buy a photocopier and another computer for her business and thereby increase her profits.  She would like to grow her business, to finish her degree and to continue working with her mom in the business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and computer for her business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena de 51 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposo en la actualidad es discapacitado. Tiene tres hijos mayores de edad y están casados. Su actividad comercial es la venta de comidas.

Empezó hace 6 años a raíz que su esposo quedo discapacitado, empezó por los vecinos ahora entrega almuerzos a trabajadores en otro sector. Una de su hija le ayuda de 7H00 am a 13H00 pm que es la hora que se desocupa del negocio. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea implementar en su negocio nuevas comidas y abrir un mini papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. En un futuro desea abrir una papelería y adecuar la loza de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Elena is 51 years old and lives in an urban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil.  El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood which used to be a large estate.  It is named after a species of tree: 'Guazuma ulmifolia'.  María's husband is disabled.  She has three grown-up children who are married.  Her business is selling meals.

María started working six years ago when her husband became disabled.  She started out selling to her neighbors and now she delivers lunches to workers in another area.  One of her daughters helps her from 7.00am to 1.00pm which is when she finishes work.  With the help of this loan, María would like to start serving new meals in her business and open a mini stationery store in the front part of her home.  In the future, she would like to open a stationery store and do some work on the concrete floor at home.

loans.use: to buy stationery products and cooking supplies

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
El señor Maximino esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar mercancía que es ropa para niño, bebes y zapatos también desea iniciar un negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quiere descapitalizar su ingreso que tiene ya que es la fuente de ingreso que para su familia. 
Don Maximino espera contar con su cooperación para este crédito, planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio con la nueva inversión. Ya ha tenido un crédito FVP el cual realizo sus pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Maximino is requesting a loan so that he can invest in buying merchandise: children's and babies' clothes, and shoes.  He would also like to start a business making and selling food but he doesn't have the necessary money to do this and he doesn't want to deprive his current business of capital as it is the source of income for his family.

Maximino hopes to be able to count on your cooperation with this loan.  He plans to repay the loan with the profits that he will make from his business with this new investment.  He has had a previous loan from FVP and he made his repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in his current business and to start a business selling meals

loans.name: Nelson Tyrone

texts.es:
Nelson de 23 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es soltero y su actividad comercial es la venta de comidas.

Su madre le cedió el negocio de venta de comida ya que ella se fue del país. Ahora el se quedo con la responsabilidad del negocio y su hermana menor también le ayuda. El esta estudiando en la escuela de chef para ser un profesional. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere seguir pagando sus cuotas de la escuela del chef y comprar mas mercadería para sus ventas de comidas. El anhela terminar sus estudios y poner un negocio de bufet para fiestas y reuniones familiares.
texts.en:
Nelson, 23, lives in a neighborhood at the edge of the city that lies along the city's ring road.  He is single and he has a business selling food.

His mother left him this business because she left the country.  Now he is left with the responsibility of running the business, and his younger sister also helps him.  He is studying in a culinary school to become a chef.  With the help of this loan, he wants to continue to pay his tuition and also buy more merchandise for his business selling food.  He wants to finish his degree and have his own buffet business where he can host parties and family reunions.

loans.use: to pay his university fees and to buy supplies for his food-selling business

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 30 years old, married and has a seven-year-old child. She want into business as a tailor in 2005 and helps support her family by working seven days a week, eight hours a day. She has already repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy raw materials for her tailoring business, which she would like to expand. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, where Sarita lives, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line streets and store owners sell material and use their sewing machines to turn those purchases into garments. The items which are in highest demand are school uniforms for children and the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. BPW borrowers use Kiva loans to buy cloth and/or sewing machines that will increase their productivity and profitability. 

This loan will be administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, the Patan Business and Professional Women. In 2007, Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal and now operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. Patan BPW also seeks to empower Nepali women within their homes and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 50 years old, married and has two children who are 32 and 35 years old. In 2000, she opened a grocery store and now works seven days a week, 10 hours a day to support her family.  She has already repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goods to sell. She is very committed to improve her family's economic conditions and thanks Kiva lenders for their support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called pasal are an important part of the local economy where people buy produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour to cook when they get home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory high and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of customers, produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, the Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. Patan BPW also seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Sarita. She is married and has two children, aged 18 and 11. In 2001, she opened a grocery store where she now works seven days a week, 10 hours a day to support her family. She has already repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent one to buy more items to sell in her store. Her main goal for the future is to improve her family's living conditions. She is very grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called a pasal are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory high and purchasing supplies in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of hard-bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, the Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. Patan BPW also seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Maleeha

texts.en: Maleeha is a 60-year-old hardworking mother. She had to work because her husband has a health condition that doesn't allow him to work. They have 12 children. Two of the children are married. To be able to support her big family, Maleeha start cutting vegetables, packing them and selling them either frozen or fresh. She has been doing that for five years now. During these five years, she was able to be the supplier for a few grocery stores in her area. Now Maleeha has applied for a loan to buy more vegetables and a freezer to increase her productivity to be able to cover her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and a freezer

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa, 31 years old, is a very ambitious woman. She is married to Foad, 35 years old, who got an early retirement from the military for health conditions. After retirement, he started working as a cleaning products distributor to be able to support the family. Since Sanaa has always wanted to have her own business, she decided to start a retail business selling clothes and cosmetics at her house. She has been running her retail business for five years. Now Sanaa has applied for a loan because she felt it was time to expand and open her own store to sell clothes and cosmetics. Since Sanaa is a conservative person, her husband Foad agreed to be in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To open her own clothes and cosmetics retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of items to sell
